Reviews.Title: “Good stay while at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: beavertontim
Reviews.Content: Building will be revitalized soon, but it is in pretty good shape. Breakfast was OK. Food was kept in good supply, but overall quality was just OK. Room servicing runs until 5 PM, so if you go back to your room for a break, let the desk know otherwise you may cone back to an unmade room. Service at the desk was good. Internet connection was good. Lots of dining out choices within half a mile or so. They offer a shuttle to disney, but we drove instead. Takes about 15 minutes. Easy drive, just stay in the right lane when heading toward I-4.

Reviews.Title: “Bill”
Reviews.Author: Kim P
Reviews.Content: We settled out account the night before we left and that next morning we had another bill for staying an extra night. Make sure you look at all paper work before departing. The rooms were okay for the price but nothing to rave about. The pool was great for the kids and the location to the park was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: shins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in March 2012 having previously stayed in 2010 and in 2004. The property is starting refurbishment during April 2012 which is needed at this stage but we still couldn't fault our stay there. We had a two bedroom trio suite on the 2nd floor which was perfect for us. Housekeeping were very helfpul to us, providing us with bed guard rails for our 2 year old daughter. Pool is a good size, pool towels are provided and there is a small pool with plenty of buckets, spades, balls for the children to play with. There is no elevator if you have a room on the 2nd/3rd floor. This wasn't a problem for us at all but maybe for other guests. Internet in business centre can be very slow at times. Laundry room provided also. Free breakfast was great, but as we were staying 10 nights, we felt it was a little repetitive on occasions. Location is excellent - there is a large grocery store located behind the hotel and another accross the road and plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Evening reception a bonus. Location for Disney is also excellent. If we return to Florida, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “feels like home”
Reviews.Author: delawaretheshire
Reviews.Content: All of the staff were very kind and helpful-they went the extra mile to make sure our stay was comfortable. Free breakfast was great. Location was very convenient to grocery store and restaurants as well as to all major theme parks. Only drawback was no elevator to third floor. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Twice Blessed”
Reviews.Author: RugbyRef
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Staybridge Suites at Lake Buena Vista. As it happened we were allocated the same ground floor trio suite as first time so it really felt like home. Everything about the visit was positive. Reception, restaurant, housekeeping and maintainance staff were all efficient and friendly. The accommodation was as expected from Staybridge and of excellent quality. Recent comment regarding some of the complex looking 'tired' is understandable, but will be resolved during the forthcoming major refurbishment. We only encountered one cockroach and it certainly did come in as we opened the door. Cockroaches are to be found all over the world and Florida is no exception. Why people get upset about them puzzles us as they are normally easy to dispose of. As on our previous visit we found the location ideal for the Disney and other theme parks. If ever we return to this area there is little doubt that we will choose this establishment. In fact we cannot wait to see how good the refurbishment will be. See you soon Mickey!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you like Roaches”
Reviews.Author: TrishE44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a ground floor unit. There were several "palmetto bugs" at night and in the morning. They were primarily in one bathroom and the kitchen, averaging two a day. At first, unapologetic management tried to say that the roaches flew in when we had the door open or came in on our clothes. It was obvious that the bugs were in the walls and possibly coming up the drains. It doesn't matter if they had a warm winter or what other excuse they want to try, they have a roach problem. Under the beds had not been vacuumed in a very long time. Staff come and go all day with carts clattering loudly up and down the walkways by the pool and the rooms. They are very noisy and disruptive. It is a very poorly thought out system. Garbage bags of towels and who knows what along with cleaning carts are left all day in front of the ground floor rooms by the stairs. There can be an extremely long wait for towels at the pool. The buffet breakfast is very low budget. The staff member in charge of the free wine and beer "reception" three nights a week watches like a hawk and does not allow some guests to pour more than one drink or use larger glasses. The snacks are very cheap. Walls are thin and there is a great deal of noise from other neighbours especially from the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMom_of_three
Reviews.Content: seriously, we have stayed at several hotels in Florida over the years and I have never seen a cockroach. We saw several "Palmetto bugs" here. They were in the bathroom and kitchen, even in light fixtures. The breakfast was mediocre and the "reception" three nights a week with free beer and wine was not much to make up for the rest. The woman who runs the "reception" would not let us use large glasses for anything including the soft drinks and said there was no more red wine. The snacks were not even worth eating. The walls are thin and it sounds like someone is using your bathroom or jumping on the floor over your head. There were small items under the beds that were left there by previous guests. We waited over an hour and a half for pool towels after asking. It is a good thing that they have a renovation scheduled, but they really have to do something about the roach problem and stop making excuses. They did not come in on my clothing!

Reviews.Title: “Palmetto Bug”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia V
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 3 nights. We saw several roaches, the onsite manager said they had a problem with the "palmetto bug" = cockraoch. They never offered to transfer rooms just apologies. My son found a roach on his bed 2 days in a row and also in the shower. Beware!!!! I am not going back nor do I recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Musty”
Reviews.Author: DougieDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Checked in for one night when arrived in Orlando. The first impression was that it was a bit smelly and dated as we entered. The rooms are nice and the service good. The bar had a bit of an old folk feel to it with people staring at each other like something out of a Hitchcock movie LOL. Anyway, it did the job but I wouldn't be in a hurry back

Reviews.Title: “Staying on or off Disney property? A case for Staybridge suites”
Reviews.Author: Tanya9025
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Disney World while I was on maternity leave with our second child. We are a family of 4 (2 year old and 2 month old at the time) and grandma and grandpa joined us. Our needs were a little complicated since we had two young children and would need to factor in returning to the hotel for naps and also, we have many food allergies to work around so we needed a place with a full kitchen so we could prepare our own meals, and we wanted a connecting room with the grandparents. Complicated? Just a little! It turned out that to get lodging at Disney that would accommodate all of these needs was WAY out of our budget. We found Staybridge Suites had the option of a one or two bedroom suite with full kitchen and living room. We had plenty of space so that we (and our parents) could have privacy if necessary. The kitchen came fully equipped with just about everything one could need to prepare most meals. The room was very clean and spacious and the living area was quite comfortable. We didn't use the pool but it was open late and supposedly kept at 82 degrees. The staff was very helpful. For example, one day the internet wasn't working in the business center and I needed to use it so they allowed me to use the internet in their office briefly. The location of the hotel was convenient as well. We went back to the hotel everyday for lunch/dinner and naps. The trip to and from Magic Kingdom was a little far because one has to take the tram to the TTC and the monorail in addition to the drive but it was certainly doable. The hotel was very close to Epcot. Overall, we were extremely satisfied with our experience and plan to stay at this hotel again this September.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Lydia C
Reviews.Content: I stayed during a family vacation to disney from the 25th-1st I am familiar with staybridge and there were some things that i didnt quite get use to.. it was my understanding that all staybridge suites accept pets this is a standard yes? and isnt laundry complimentary? and the fact that i was placed on the 3rd floor with 3 small children and no elevator was a little annoying at times even though i got quite the leg workout.

Reviews.Title: “A few tips.....”
Reviews.Author: levo69
Reviews.Content: Family of five, stayed Feb 2012 for two weeks. I booked this hotel after reading a few hundred reviews on trip adviser as well as other review sites. although the reviews were helfull there were certain things i wanted to know in more detail which none of the reviews highlighted, so i will cover them here. But first, here is our general overview; Loved our stay. We found the room, a trio suite to be clean and spacious. The hotel location cannot be faulted, (Outside of the main Disney hotels) and we recieved great service. We requested a ground floor room which we had, and upon arrival we requested an in room kettle which was delivered within five minutes, fab ! After the first week we experianced some minor issues with the room, (A blocked WC and a loose towel rail) and again, these were fixed by the time we returned to our room later the same day. The breakfast; Whilst i can understand some of the negative reviews, at the end of the day this was no five star banquet, (but neither did we expect one !) there was enough choice to keep us happy; toast, waffles, cakes, cereals, eggs, fruit, sausage, yoghurt, ham, porridge, juices, pop, hot drinks. If you want to laze around all morning relishing your surroundings and eating the finest food then book a five star hotel elswhere, otherwise if you are like us and want to have something to eat that will keep you going half the day b4 hitting the disney parks then this will do nicely. the free snacks and drinks three nights a week are OK, perhaps not worth rushing back for, but if you are coming back early to the hotel anyway then its nice. Typically you get hot dogs, wine or beer, plus soft drinks. The pool and jacuzzi are clean and quite warm. They are open until about 23:00 hours every night. There are three free computers with internet and one free in the kids room. Indeed, as some others have suggested, they can be slow but still usable. LOCATION/TRANSPORT; IT TOOK ME MUCH DELIBERATION CHOOSING WHETHER OR NOT TO HIRE A CAR OR TO TRUST THE BUSSES. I TOOK A CHANCE WITH THE BUSSES AND IT WORKED OUT JUST FINE. THE PACKAGE DEAL I GOT FROM ENGLAND INCLUDED A FREE CAR FOR TWO WEEKS BUT THE INSURANCE WAS ANOTHER Â£300, PLUS ON TOP OF THAT YOU HAVE $15 PER DAY DISNEY PARKING !!! THEN YOU HAVE PETROL, AND TIREDNESS ETC TO FACTOR IN SO FOR ME IT WAS A NO BRAINER. I GOT THE IMPRESSION FROM OTHER REVIEWS THAT THERE WERE REGULAR BUS TRANFERS TO THE DISNEY PARKS BUT NONE OF THEM GAVE A TIMETABLE SO HERE GOES; MAGIC KINGDOM; PICK UP AT 07:50, 10:20, 11:40, 13;40. RETURN AT 7PM, 9.45, AND 11.35/12.50 WHEN THE PARK OPENS TIL LATE. ANIMAL KINGDOM; 07:50 ONLY, RETURN 5.30PM ONLY. EPCOT; 09:20 AND 11:40. RETURN 16;10 AND 22:00 HOURS. HOLLYWOOD STUDIOS: 09:20 AND 13:40, RETURN AT 15:55 AND 19:20. (23:20 WHEN THE PARK IS OPEN TIL LATE). ALL THE DISNEY BUSSES BETWEEN THE PARKS AND RESORTS ARE FREE AND REGULAR. FOR EXAMPLE, IF YOU ARE AT EPCOT AND MISS THE 16:10 BUS, YOU COULD HOP ONTO A SHUTTLE TO MAGIC KINGDOM AND GET THE 17:45 BACK TO THE HOTEL. THERE ARE NO DIRECT BUSSES TO DOWNTOWN DISNEY, HOWEVER HOP ONTO A FREE DISNEY SHUTTLE FROM ANY OF THE PARKS TO SARATOKA SPRINGS RESORT AND ITS A FIVE MINUTE WALK FROM THERE. THERE ARE NO DIRECT BUS FROM THE HOTEL TO THE WATER PARKS BUT AGAIN FREE DISNEY SHUTTLES GO FROM ALL THE PARKS, ALL BE IT VIA A RESORT. TAXIS; ABOUT $6 EACH WAY TO DOWNTOWN DISNEY. ABOUT $20 EACH WAY TO MAGIC KINGDOM. $15 EACH WAY TO EPCOT, $30 EACH WAY TO EITHER THE FLORIDA MALL OR THE MALL AT MILLENIA. COSTS: A TYPICAL BURGER AND FRIES IN A DISNEY PARK SERVICE COUNTER IS BETWEEN 8-10 $. DRINKS ARE $3 INCLUDING TAX, SAME FOR AN ICE CREAM OR POPCORN. FOR A SIT DOWN MEAL YOU ARE LOOKING AT 25-35 $ PER ADULT FOR THREE COURSES OR BUFFET, MINUS DRINKS TAX AND SERVICE. THERE ARE ALSO MORE EXPENSIVE PLACES TO EAT TOO. THERE ARE LOTS OF GOOD VALUE PLACES TO EAT NEAR THE HOTEL:cici pizza buffet, sizzler, shoneys, subway, steak n shake, papa johns pizza, chillys, to name but a few. Furthermore, a 15-20 minute walk away will bring you to Mcdonalds, golden corrall buffet and the highly recommended bahama breeze. There are also two chinese buffets withing walking distance, and two supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “It is home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SGfromNJ
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay over there. It is always a very pleasant stay. The rooms are big and clean. We are a family of 5 so we all had room to sleep and starch. Two nice size bedrooms and two bath. The beds are comfortable as well. The kitchen was perfect for a family on vacation even though we only used the fridge and the microwave. Disney and Universal Studios allow you to bring food and drinks; so our fridge had water and soda ready for us. The breakfast was adequate. They had make your own waffles, eggs, some kind of breakfast meat (bacon/sausage/ham) rotated daily, yogurt, cereal, some kind of pastry and drinks (milk/coffee/team/soda/juices). They also have a manager reception at night 3 days a week from 5 PM to 7PM. That one is somewhat ok. One time they had BBQ food, it was good and free. Regardless of the food, they had free wine and soda as well which is not bad if you are going to order something in. The location is also wonderful. There is a big plaza across the Street from it where you can find casual dining. On the other side there is a Walgreen which is very convent if someone got sick (it has one of these quick clinks) or you forgot your sun block. It is very close to Disney. Again, on your way to and from Disney there are sooooooo many dining choices. The way the hotel was designed, no matter what room you are in, you are close enough to the lobby (which has the breakfast era) and the pool. Also, the parking is a all around the hotel, so you can always find a parking spot close to your room. I have nothing to bad to say about this hotel. All good. Not very fancy but clean and comfortable which what we care about. The only thing they can improve is the check in time. 4PM is abit late

Reviews.Title: “Spread the word”
Reviews.Author: Betty A
Reviews.Content: I had occassion to stay at this property on 2/11/12 and it was great. The facilities were excellent my suite could sleep 6 comfortably.+ a LR and kitchen. There was a wonderful, complete, complimentary breakfast bar. The best part is yet to come...the staff. sI dealt with check-in, guest services and breakfast....all professional...well trained....and seemed to know everything I wanted.......GREAT FOR FAMILIES

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Petty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Staybridge for the International Builders Show and found it to be a great choice. We were out of the congestion of International Drive and had many dining choices very close to us. Getting to the convention center was a breeze when I used the "avoid major roads" and "avoid tolls" on my GPS unit. It took us left out of the hotel and routed us on some great secondary roads that got us there with no traffic at all. I booked a Trio room and it was great, as my company likes for us to share rooms when a group of us attend a convention. The TVs were a bit outdated, and the wireless Internet was definitely spotty, but not bothersome enough for me to complain. I'm sure those things will be taken care of in the upcoming renovation they have planned. The food was better than most hotels where I stay. They have a virtual cafeteria in the morning, and the evenings we were there had beer, wine, and some sort of food available. The hamburger/hot dog cookout seemed the best. Enjoying that at the outside area with great weather in February made for a great time. While we didn't take a dip, many folks were enjoying the pool, which I have to assume is heated. I will definitely stay at the Staybridge on my next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an Update.”
Reviews.Author: binzy
Reviews.Content: staryed here with my husband.,,,January 2012... good size rooms with a very very comfy large bed... A bit dated but I think they are going to refurbish this year.... The breakfast was a bit of a dissapointment....could do with a bit more variety.....but generally ok. Pool area very pleasant....Winn Dixie supermarket at the rear of the property...excellent for grabbing some lunch and groceries. Good location for Disney and Universal...and try the Angus Steakhouse....down towards Disney, very good steaks.!! All in all a good base.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jan4645
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Staybridge this last January 2012. We loved the location. We were within an easy 10 minute drive of all the big parks. Lots of restaurants also nearby. Hotel is clean, could use an update and believe that is in the works. Only real complaint was the wi if service was hit and miss, slow for sure. Would stay here again though however. Loved the Orlando area!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownboy_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5nights, and the hotel is amazing. Clean family friendly, free shuttle to Disney parks (to/from in mornings and evenings at various times - daily, free breakfest, clean rooms, close walking distance of 1 block to grocery and restaurants, good value per night rate, friendly helpful staff. Thank you Staybridge Lake Buena Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, accomodating hotel that is great for families”
Reviews.Author: Nicole W
Reviews.Content: I give this 4.5 stars. We noticed that this hotel had great reviews, so we decided to give it a try during our visit to WDW. We booked two "Trio Suites" for our party of 11 guests. We were impressed! Bob, the front desk clerk, was very helpful and took his time with us. The housekeeping staff did a great job cleaning both of our suites each day. The suite is spacious and is exactly as described/pictured. The kitchen is stocked with everything you need to prepare/serve a meal (we cooked dinner two nights here: after we saw what our kitchen had to offer us, and made a trip to the grocery store). The free, hot breakfast had many choices and was fresh and convenient (saved us tons of money!) The outdoor, heated pool was large and clean (kids loved relaxing there every afternoon after a day at Disney). The guest laundry facilities had 5 washers and 10 dryers (cost $1.75 each cycle), which was very convenient. I counted on using these so we could pack light for the week, and it worked out well for my husband to watch the kids in the pool while I did laundry in the room adjacent to the pool. There is a Winn Dixie grocery just 1 block away and more restaurants than you can count in every direction, some within walking distance, others just a 3-5 minute drive. Walgreens Pharmacy is across the street and even has some affordable Disney souvenirs there! We will stay here again in the future. NOTE: Outdoor room entrances only and NO elevator on property, which is stated clearly on their website, so I knew this in advance, and it was not a problem at all for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: scruffmaster
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum Priority Club member, I have stayed at MANY HI brand properties. This one was chosen after reading some of the reviews. Not quite what I expected..... Front Desk staff (Juan) was extremely abrupt and did not seem interested in trying to check us in early if at all possible. No acknowledgement of Priority Club member, etc. I understand the hotel was busy, however no effort was made to even offer pool access, luggage storage, etc. When I requested pool access, I was given a HUGE sigh and after a minute a short "ok". Room was sub-par. Looked clean at first but after looking under the beds we found other people's socks, popcorn, gift cards, etc. Counter tops were dirty, window blinds were caked in dust. Call me fussy but when I pay for a hotel I expect some level of cleanliness..... Breakfast was not on par with most Staybridge Suites. Being in Florida, I would expect some fresh citrus fruit. Only fresh fruit was terrible Red Delicious apples. There were some canned peaches but really? No English muffins, not much on "healthy" choices. The hotels seems designed to be a flop house for theme park visitors and staff appear to have the attitude of "get them in, get them out". I asked for a review card from the front desk and was told I would get one via email. THIS NEVER SHOWED UP. I eventually sent a concern email to IC hotels main group who forwarded my request to management. I received a short email from Melissa saying "sorry" and that was all. VERY DISAPPOINTING. When considering this hotel, think again. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge Orlando to Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: J0_melb
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel - not a good location for visiting all the Theme Parks. If you aren't going to spend every day at the parks and just want somewhere to relax and explore Orlando by car, I would definitely stay here again. My friend and I stayed for 12 days in November 2011 with plans to visit all the theme parks. The hotel was fabulous, but the location and free shuttles didn't suit our needs. Basically I recommend staying at Disney while you visit Disneyworld, as you then have full access to all the parks day and night for free and then stay somewhere closer to Universal/Seaworld to see the other parks. The Staybridge is a really great hotel, but not a good location for visiting parks. The 'free shuttles to theme parks' from the Staybridge only go to Disney World and only 3 times a day (7.40am, 10.40am and 1.40pm) and there are limited return shuttles too (7pm, 10pm and 11.25pm). (Times vary by season) Basically most of the parks closed to the general public at 8pm and we then had to wait around until 10pm or later for the return shuttle. There is nowhere to sit or shelter while waiting for the shuttles. If you are staying at Disneyworld you can stay at parks much later. Disney Downtown is only about $8 cab ride from the hotel, but you can't get to the parks from there on the disney buses unless you are staying at Disney. To get to Seaworld or Universal it was a $25 flat rate cab ride each way - cheaper than a car hire and parking I suppose, but expensive extra on top of entrance fees. The hotel itself, I couldn't have asked for anything more. We had a 2 bedroom suite(both with ensuite bathrooms), full kitchen and lounge area. Better still, it include free buffet breakfast every day and free Happy Hour every Tues to Thurs night including wine, beer and food. The pool and spa were heated and great. We both loved it. The hotel is also across the road from several restaurants, a Disney Outlet store and 24 hour supermarkets that sell absolutely everything. If you aren't going to spend every day at the parks and just want somewhere to relax and explore Orlando by car, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: TrishE44
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for long periods of time on a budget. If you don't mind "Palmetto bugs", I call them cockroaches. The free wine and beer in the evenings makes it easier, but the snacks three nights a week are just cheap: hot dogs one night, nachos with salsa, and canned ravioli. The barbecue available is always disgusting as it in never cleaned.The breakfast buffet is just adequate. It is a goo thing it is scheduled for a renovation because it is getting pretty run down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: ibidforit
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel on a recent short trip to Disney to see the holiday lights at the parks. The family consists of 2 adults and 2 teens. We had booked a 1 bedroom suite, but were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite at check-in. The room consisted of a master bedroom with a king bed and bath, living area with full kitchen, and a 2nd bedroom with 2 double beds and another bath. The rooms were all extremely clean, which is a biggie for me. No complaints in the cleanliness department at any time we were there. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful. The pool was quite large compared to most hotel pools, and there was also a hot tub. The pool was heated to a very comfortable temperature. There is a free breakfast buffet which consisted of both hot and cold foods. The food was quite adequate, not top restaurant quality, but good for the price (free)! This hotel is located very near Disney, and is just slightly north of the Hotel Plaza Blvd entrance that takes you to Downtown Disney. There are many restaurants, fast food places, grocery, liquor store, drug stores nearby. Many are within walking distance if you do not have a car. I believe they have shuttle buses to take you to the parks, but I cannot comment on them as we had a car and did not use them. Overall, this hotel was a great deal! The amenities, location, and price put this as one of my favorite off-site Disney hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbugg1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 3 nights while enjoying our time at Disney (2 adults/3 kids). It was perfect! We had a two bed/two bath condo. King bed in one room, two double beds in the other. After long days at the theme parks, it was nice coming back to a comfy place to stay and get a good night sleep. Bed were comfortable, rooms were clean, everything worked. Having the full kitchen we were able to keep lots of food/snacks to bring to the parks with us, which helped cut the cost of buying meals in the parks. The breakfast was just right too. Saved us quite a bit of money and time when trying to get an early start. If it wasn't so cold out, we definitely would have made use of the pool and hot tub which looked very inviting. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay with Staybridge Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms for the Money but a few words of caution”
Reviews.Author: txjeffrey
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this facility Nov. 19-26, 2011 for our Thanksgiving birthday celebration for my twin daughters. We absolutely loved the suite.........2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, nice kitchen, 3 televisions. It was very spacious with large closets; reminded us of an apartment rather than a hotel suite. As other reviewers have noted, you must ask for a first floor room because there are no elevators. We were in Building A in Suite #213. I had requested a downstairs room close to the main building where breakfast is served and the free transportation picks up for Disney. The reservation clerk I spoke with prior to our arrival was very nice and accommodated my requests. We did hear a bit of road noise as our room faced the main roadway, but it was not too bad. You might want to request a room in another building if road noise bothers you. Now a word of caution about housekeeping. We normally stay at Marriott Residence Inns, and we are accustomed to their superior cleanliness standards. When we checked in, my daughter found an empty soda can under her bed. I found an empty dirty plastic cup under the master bed. When my husband went to get a glass from the kitchen cabinet, he picked up a glass that had red lipstick on the rim. I did report this to front desk, and I was just simply told they would report it to housekeeping. I thought an apology would have been nice. Breakfast buffet was good, but again, it did not compare to what we are accustomed to at Marriott Residence Inns. Each day the scrambled eggs were cold. When I reported this to the kitchen attendant on the first morning, I was told I could use the microwave to warm them. The problem never was corrected. My main word of warning for future guests is absolutely do NOT allow the front desk to call a taxi for you. When we checked in and mentioned that we wanted to go straight to Downtown Disney, the front desk clerk kindly volunteered to call a taxi for us. That taxi ride cost us $12. We called the same company to return us to the hotel that night. The next night we were at Downtown Disney and just used a Yellow Cab that was parked outside the World of Disney. That taxi ride (traveling the same distance) only cost us $6.60. The taxi that the hotel called for us cost almost twice the amount charged by Yellow Cab. When I reported this to the front desk, I was told that they always call the same company, and yes, they knew it cost more because the company charges a flat rate rather than using the meter. I replied that I felt like this was wrong to volunteer to call a taxi that they know overcharges their customers. I am curious as to why they would purposefully call a company that they know charges almost twice what a Yellow Cab charges unless perhaps they receive a kickback for calling that company. If you do choose to stay at this facility, just call your own taxi to avoid being overcharged. The location of the hotel is awesome, especially if you fly and do not rent a car. There is a Walgreens across the street, a grocery store behind the hotel, a reasonably priced souvenir ship across the street, and a Steak n Shake across the street. The Steak n Shake has great food with very, very reasonable prices. The free bus transportation to Disney is another perk. The bus picks up at the front door, stops by 2 other hotels, and then takes you to Disney. The bus picked us up at 7:50 each morning, and we were usually at the parks before 8:30 which was great since the parks opened at 9:00. I have left comments about the housekeeping, breakfast buffet, and taxi incident on the Staybridge website comment link. If they were to correct these issues, I would certainly consider staying at this property again. If you would like additional information about this property or hints about Disney visits, please contact me via e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “)Lovely vacation with family”
Reviews.Author: rosie1030
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort from 11/3/11 to 11/11/11 with husband, daughter and her family (2 sons, 5 and 18 mons.). Lovely 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. Very spacious even with the little ones. Kitchen and living room were both roomy enough while we were there. They offer a very nice buffet breakfast and light supper (we did not partake of the supper as we were out). Breakfast really cut down on the spending as it was quite substancial. Grandson loved the game room and pool. Courtyard was very nice in the evening to just relax from the day's activities. Front desk was very helpful when we needed assistance with local information. We used the shuttle service a few times and it was always on time both picking up at the hotel and the parks. It was a lovely vacation. Definitely would stay here again as it is located close to the parks, shopping and other attractions offered in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Aging but MAJOR Renovation started April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Jane D
Reviews.Content: Noticed the aging of the furnishings but was pleased to learn they will be starting a major renovation starting April 2012. We stayed 5 nights this visit. The two bedroom suites have lots of space & are nice for families to spread out and rooms are adequate, but show that they are headed into a renovation. Full kitchen and the Winn Dixue grocery store is just beside the hotel across a small street- great to have real meals while travelling. On check in they explain the green housekeeping policy- basically quick clean- make beds & change towels then on 3rd day vacuum & clean counters. 7th day change sheets- you can call housekeeping at any time if you need something additional. Having stayed in Orlando many times all the hotels seem to be going this way to cut down time per room- at the 5 area hotels we have stayed at all have had issues with getting the room cleaned in the 4-6 hours we are out during the day. Pool is heated to 83 so nice to go swimming even in winter!! Often Orlando hotels SAY they heat their outdoor pools to 80, but the pool heater just can't keep up with the pool size so the pool is more like mid 70s December to March- their pool honestly is well heated all winter long!! Staff are freindly and most have been at the hotel a long time- a good sign in this day & age! I think the towel oragami on our arrival may have been done because we have stayed several times in the past. It was a very nice touch. I'm looking forward to the renovations being completed & would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for 3 Generation Family”
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: We picked this place because of the great reviews and the free breakfast. We had a 2 bedroom suite, perfect for us, our kids, and grandson. Our suite had a full kitchen! We ate dinner out or ordered in most of the time, but made sandwiches to take to the parks. If we had had to buy that breakfast buffet at a restaurant, it would have probably cost us $70 a day! Yes, the eggs could have been better, but they also had make-your-own waffles plus bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit, coffees, teas, the most extensive free breakfast I've ever seen at a hotel. The staff were amazing. If there was any worker near you when you approached a door, they would quickly come over, open the door for you and greet you. It seems as if they know the better they treat you, the better their reputation and the better their business. I would definitely go back there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, good rooms, mediocre breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Pickypickypickyman
Reviews.Content: My wife, two young kids and I stayed here for six nights. Location is great - one interstate exit from Disney, about 15 to 20 minutes from Universal And about one hour from Legoland, which was our kids favorite park of the bunch (age 7 and 4). Having two bedrooms and two bathrooms is great with the kids. They enjoyed having their own room to play in and watch TV (3 TVs - not flat screens but who cares?). I don't like hotels, and have walked out of places that I didn't find clean enough. This place was acceptable. The bathrooms are small and the tile is 80s vintage but it is clean. The carpet seems new-ish and I felt comfortable that my young son could play with his cars on the floor. So this place is a solid 3 - coming from someone fairly picky - and for the price it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staybridge Suites, the pillows, not so muchâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: rockgoddess919
Reviews.Content: I loved Staybridge Suites! My husband and I, our two young sons and my parents all stayed together in a two-bedroom suite which was very spacious! My husband and I commented that it was roomier than some apartments! Each room had its own bathroom, which is great for everyone and saved time when we were all getting ready at the same time to head out sightseeing. The bathroom was a bit small, but just to get a shower or bathe the kids it was sufficient. The beds were comfortable, however, I was not a fan of the pillows; I thought they felt like marshmallows for how soft they were. I had to put a pillow from the sofa into the pillow sham to firm it up a bit, as Iâ€™ve been having neck problems lately. Iâ€™d have brought my own, but I tend to leave them behind so I decided against it. Upon request, the hotel provided a crib for our 18-month old, which was made of metal and appeared to be safe by the new government regâ€™s. While it was a bit on the small side, it was fine for him and he slept great in it every night. The kitchen was clean, and silverware, glasses, coffee mugs and plates were provided in the cabinets along with a refrigerator and stove, and a dishwasher, which we didnâ€™t use. My 5 year-old son slept on the pullout sofa bed, and his only complaint was that the clock on the wall above him kept him awake. He said the bed was comfortable. We enjoyed the free buffet breakfast every morning, which offered different hot selections like eggs/omelets, bacon, ham, and sausage, as well as cereal, toast, muffins, donuts and a waffle maker. The food was good, and none of us had any complaints or problems. We did not get to go to any of the evening â€œsun-downerâ€� events that the hotel offers during the week, as we were enjoying Disney World, but just the fact that they were offered seemed nice. I used the laundry room and found it to be clean, the machines easy to use, and a few different products available both free (I assume left behind by other guests) & for purchase. I bought some snacks from the shop and thought it was a bit pricy ($4 for a bag of Doritos and a 20 oz. Diet Coke). They have different toiletries, etc., available for purchase, which are good in an emergency, but if you can wait, go to Walgreens across the street or Winn-Dixie in the plaza around the corner. There are lots of different restaurants in the area, also, to satisfy the pickiest of eaters. We also noticed there was a medical clinic across the street, which is good to know should an emergency arise. My father took my one son to the pool one day and said it was nice and clean (and warm). In all, Iâ€™d say I really enjoyed my stay and would not only stay here again in the future, but would recommend it to others. Itâ€™s only about 10-15 minute drive to the parks, and is right around the corner from Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great Orlando area bargain”
Reviews.Author: psopsic
Reviews.Content: I brought my family (wife and daughters 13 and 6) for a 8 nights to this hotel mostly chosen due to positive reviews from this site. Please note that I travel for work frequently and used Priority Club Points to pay for this stay (160,000 points). The biggest negative on this stay is that I requested a two bedroom suite and only got a one bedroom. As you will notice on previous reviews you can only get to the bathroom in a one bedroom suite through the bedroom. It makes it difficult in the middle of the night. After shouldering a 6 year old through amusement parks all day it was not a lot of fun to sleep on the couch. Plus- This is a great property with a staff that is always looking to help. Rooms and linens are kept extremely well for the age of this property. The amount of people from other countries make this a wonderful place to make interesting and amazing new friends. Mid week sundowner parties allow extra interaction. The pool is kept really warm, even during the off season. I spent a fortune on theme park tickets- but my kids loved the pool area. The breakfast will save you a lot of money (sorry, it is coming in my negatives). I am told that a property "refresh" is happening. I would stay here regardless. Although dated, a great stay. Giordonnos (spelling?) in the mall across the street has wonderful deep dish pizzas. You can not beat the location of this property! Negatives- The pool is kept warm so the need for chlorine is greater- make sure your kids have goggles (really inexpensive goggles available in the mall across the street). Most of the breakfast food is really bad (scrambled eggs, meats, etc.). Rely on waffles and fresh fruit to fuel your day. I was lucky enough to get a room next to where the breakfast truck delivery truck parked on the first floor. I would walk stairs any day of the week to not have to listen to the truck at 5:30 every morning. As a Priority Club member who earns over 250,000 points per year, I am shocked I did not recieve and uprgrade. I have stayed at a number of properties in this area and can tell you that this ranks among my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and would return again and again”
Reviews.Author: candicane0104
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this location and we have nothing bad to say at all. 2 bedroom trio suite was fabulous. Asked for pool area room. We like being near the pool. If you don't want to hear people having fun until 11pm don't ask to stay near the pool. It can be a loud area but no complaints here we LOVE being near the pool. Lots to choose from for breakfast. We had one issue with our in-room safe and someone was there within 5 min to fix it. Close to plenty of restaurants, mini golf, 24 hour pharmacy across the road, grocery and liquor store on the street behind, and close to downtown Disney and Universal. So convenient and everyone is so nice there!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: NolanK
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and location. Generous breakfast. Clean property. Wifi was a little spotty but not a big deal. They have dinner snacks a several times a week with drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMom761
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a fantastic trip to Orlando. The Staybridge Suites helped make our vacation. It was so nice to get up in the morning and get a free breakfast. The location was great. Close to all the Disney parks, Universal, and super close to Sea World. Restaurants, Walgreen's and Winn-Dixie all within walking distance. We did see a few cockroaches on our first day, but we called the front desk and a pest control person came up and we never saw one again. The kids enjoyed the pool and the water was warm. Parking was free and very close to the rooms. We were on the 3rd floor and there's no elevator, but I'd read it was quieter. We didn't have any problems with noise and the beds were pretty comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. It's not a super fancy hotel, but if you're looking for value, location, and free breakfast, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location,comfortable accommodation and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeViv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven nights and have no complaints about the accommodation or the location. It was perfect for getting to the theme parks and attractions in Orlando but located in a quiet setting. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the breakfast provided was of a good standard and plenty of variety to meet most tastes. We would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great price, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JGinat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for only one night, and the overall experience was very good. However, there is a minor remark: The suite we had one bedroom and one living room. The bathroom area has a sink that is part of the bedroom. Thus, if someone wants to wake up early, or to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, he'll probably wake up everyone in the bedroom. Apart from this - we had everything we were looking from. The hotel is near all the Disney parks (and the downtown Disney area). It's less than 20 minutes drive from the airport. The suite was big, with a large living area, a nice kitchen (fully stocked) and more than enough closet space. Breakfast was great, and the pool area is nice. Bottom line - you get a great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price, great convenience”
Reviews.Author: Monctonmomof3
Reviews.Content: This property was everything we were looking for. We chose the two bedroom trio suite. Suite A had the king size bed, walk in closet, and ensuite bath. Suite B had two double beds, double closet, and ensuite bath. In between the two was the kitchen/living room. Housekeeping even put all dishes through the dishwasher everyday. The breakfast was so good every morning. We had so much choice and usually tried most of it. Waffles, oatmeal, cereals, eggs, bacon, ham, yogurt, muffins, juices, etc. Jose was amazing every morning. Don't even try taking your used dishes to the cart. He's there to get them the second you are done. The hotel is a few minutes from the entrance to the Disney area. The street is lined with restaurants, with the grocery and liquor stores immediately across the side street. The staff is friendly and we couldn't have been happier. The only thing we found odd was how hot the pool was heated. One day we came home tired and hot from the parks only to jump into a hot pool.We enjoyed that temperature at 9 at night this first week of October, but during the day? The grounds were kept spotless and there was plenty of parking, poolside chairs, places to sit and hang out. We will definitely recommend this hotel and we will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: nicksmomToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week of October. The location is great with lots of restaurants close by. There is even a liquor store, and grocery store right across the street. The location is also very convenient for Disney World, which is just 1 exit up on the I-4. The room: The rooms are dated but we understand that they are going to be renovating them in the next year. The room was sufficient size for me, my husband, and our 3 year old son. We really appeciated having the kitchen with dishwasher, fridge, and stove. The one thing I didn't like about the room is that the bathroom is connected to the bedroom. That meant that if we were taking a shower at night, my son couldn't fall asleep until we were done and if we showered in the morning, he was awoken by the shower and fan. Definitely made it hard to get up early and get myself ready before everyone else got up. Although the room did seem clean, we did come across a couple of huge beetles(cockroaches?) on our last day. Because it was late on our last day, we didn't tell hotel staff about our findings. However, I have no doubt that they would have switched us to another room if we had told them (I've since emailed them to let them know so they can inspect and treat the room). The staff actually phoned us a couple of times during our stay to make sure everything was going well - we were very impressed with the level of service received during our stay. Buffet Breakfast - We enjoyed having the buffet breakfast. It saved us the time and money of going to eat in a restaurant. I think the food offered is more than enough - they have waffles, eggs (scrambled or omelets), bacon, sausage, or ham, yogurt, fruit, cereal, toast, bagels, muffins, juices, coffee, tea, and milk. Hotel grounds - as someone else mentioned, the grounds are very clean. They have a nice seating area beside the pool area. The pool itself is a reasonable size. We were there during off season so it wasn't too busy. I'd be interested in seeing this hotel once it's all renovated. The only suggestion I would make is if possible, try to reconfigure the rooms so the bathroom is not located within the bedroom. Also, it would be a nice touch to have a playground for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieThomasPam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Staybridge Suites Hotel in Lake Buena Vista several times for combination business/pleasure trips. The hotel is very convenient to all of the attractions such as Disney World, Universal, Sea World etc. It is only minutes off of Disney property, which means there are dozens of restaurants from which to choose. The hotel offers a full hot breakfast. A very nice man named Jose keeps everything clean and fresh. We encountered him every morning. He gives every indication that he never has a "bad" day. He was always cheerful and friendly. The manager of the hotel, Julie, is also friendly and genuinely concerned that you enjoy your stay and that everything goes well for you. We had been staying at the Residence Inn for our trips to Orlando, but this hotel offers so much more. They are not adjacent to the interstate so noise is no issue whatsoever. The grocery store (to stock your full kitchen) is a short walk across the street. The square footage is greater than at the Residence Inn and the accommodations are more modern and up to date. We had a wonderful time at this hotel. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: shellw40
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I wasnt sure what to expect from the Staybridge LBV. However I had emailed Melissa at the hotel requesting a high floor room and the possibility of a pool view. We stayed from 17th Sept to 2nd Oct 2011 After a long flight and waiting to collect our car we finally arrived at our hotel. We were greeted on the main desk by Melissa and another of the hotel staff, what a welcome they had remembered my email without me mentioning it and that we were on a trip for our anniversary, check in was quick and we were shown to our room, we already knew there were no lifts but I had asked for top floor but even so they offered assistance with the cases. on arrival at our room we were so pleasantly surprised, we had been given a pool view 3rd floor two bedroom suite. The space was amazing a great little fully equiped kitchen, lounge area with dining table and chairs a master bedroom with a huge king size bed, dressing area and bathroom and another bedroom with two double beds dressing area and another bathroom. How anyone can complain about this I will never know, ok some of the kitchen bits are a lttle older but so what the whole place was lovely. ( and they are about to completely renovate the suites in a few months for those of you that are really fussy) The whole hotel was beautifully kept there were cleaners inside and out all the time the gardeners were keeping the grounds every day we were there and they were lovely grounds. The pool was cleaned evey day and was lovely as was the spa. There was a small air conditioned gym and games room. A business centre with computers and free internet (WiFi was free in all the rooms too) Breakfast was free daily and would vary from day to day.. Scrambled egg and either Bacon, Sausage or Ham. There was yohgarts fruit and cereals, muffins bagels toast. in separate area you could make your own waffles with a selection of waffle machines and porridge. (Included in the price really yes! ample foods to start your day) My only thing and its really not a complaint it is mearly a comment would be the cleaners come in to do a mini clean each day and once a week a full clean of the suites but you never know when they will be coming one day it may be early in the morning another maybe 5pm in the afternoon and when you are just coming back from a long day at the parks sometimes not what you would want. Another comment that may help We loved our Pool View room but bear in mind it is open till 11pm at night and there is noise from children and families till that time ( it didnt affect us one bit) Having said that This place is amazing, we will be back and will bring our children next time so spacious, great suites fab hotel lovely people a really pleasant holiday give it a go you really wont be disappointed here.... Thankyou Melissa and all at the Staybridge LBV loved out stay with you. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great buy for families”
Reviews.Author: Stewartma
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy for families. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suites with a full kitchen and sitting area. Easy access to all the attractions. Surrounded by huge selection of restaurants. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. I will never stay anywhere else again while visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Top Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaLuigi
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenage daughter and myself stayed here on 27th August for 14 nights. It was important that our daughter had her own space while on holiday and the Staybridge LBV turned out to be fantastic as she had her own room which was huge, en suite and had two king size beds. The staff at this place were absolutely fantastic from the receptionists all the way down to the cleaning staff at breakfast and our chambermaid called Mayte was lovely. We were given a 3rd floor Trio Double Suite at the back of the hotel opposite the Winn Dixie which was ideal and quiet. We hired a car for the whole holiday which we parked free of charge right outside the block our suite was in. This place is on the doorstep to Disney and 15 minutes from all the other non Disney attractions for which this hotel gives you lots of information about when you check in - a lovely touch was the information sheets that the hotel has put together for all driving guests which had all the addresses of virtually everything you wanted to do for your car SatNav, all Disney, Universal, Seaworld theme parks as well all the restaurants you can imagine locally of which there was many to choose from, including the supermarkets and shopping outlets. Another nice touch was on our last day due to a late flight back home, they let us have the suite until 2.30pm instead of having to vacate at 11am at no extra charge. On the whole this was a fantastic place to stay and would absolutely recommend it to everyone whether your a big family or not. You will love coming back to your own suite and chilling after a long day at the parks oh and I forgot about the breakfast which was included with your stay - it's absolutely fantastic even though a little different to what you might be used to but appertizing and filling ...... when you come here, you'll see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lots of amenities for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SophieBlue09
Reviews.Content: If you're not staying at an on-site hotel for any of the theme parks, this Staybridge Suites is a good choice. My husband and I stayed for three nights, and went to Disney's Hollywood Studios on one day, and Sea World's Aquatica the other. Close by, there are loads of restaurants and fast food places to eat. There's a lot of space in the one-bedroom we had, although the bathroom is on the crowded side. We were pleased with the number of towels. The staff was very friendly on check-in. When we were given a room on the third floor with our windows facing the pool, we found out there there are no elevators, so if you don't want to walk the stairs, be sure to ask for a ground floor suite. The suite included a kitchen including a large refrigerator with an ice maker and a coffee maker. The buffet breakfast serves a large variety of OK food, including a waffle station, and was very crowded each morning. I've stayed at newer Staybridge Suites that have had much nicer grounds and decor, and this one, being older, may have been built as another chain motel.

Reviews.Title: “I always recommend this Staybridge suites;they are great”
Reviews.Author: disfaninnyc
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite places to stay when we visit Disney World. the suites are spacious and clean;they have everything you need in the kitchen to cook a real meal and clean up afterwards. Could not be more convenient to stores and restaurants. The front desk staff is helpful-our reservation was a little messed up(we asked for a quiet room and they gave us one on the first floor after we had specified the third floor)this was fixed quickly.Only caveat;the breakfast...isn't great. The eggs were pretty tasteless and the attendent reprimanded us for taking juice to drink outside. But the value is unbeatable and I highly recommend the Staybridge suites for solo,families or anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: Ellanora
Reviews.Content: My parents, my son, and myself shared a 2 bedroom suite for a one night stay at the Staybridge in Lake Buena Vista. The suite was well-appointed and lovely, full kitchen, and comfortable beds. The ice maker in the freezer did not work, but the front desk sent up a bag of ice almost immediately after we called down. There is a Winn-Dixie right across the street if you need supplies. The pool area was very pretty and well taken care of. The provided breakfast was not bad, but the selection was not great. Scrambled eggs, which could have been warmer, yogurt, oatmeal, do-it-yourself waffles, and a few other continental type selections. The fresh baked cookies at check in are really good and a nice touch. Overall, we had an excellent stay and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Haven't stayed at a Staybridge that I haven't loved!”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaPoppy
Reviews.Content: Another enjoyable stay at a Staybridge Suites! We had family visiting and wanted to stay close enough to the Disney Parks without paying the ridiculous price of the better Disney Resort Hotels. We picked a 2 bedroom suite which was spacious, very clean and comfortable for 4 adults and a toddler. The pool was exceptionally clean and the groundskeepers were constantly keeping up with the neat and manicured appearance of the grounds. The buffet breakfast, included, was filled with a variety of breakfast options, as well as make your own Belgium Waffle! All the staff from the front desk to the dining room attendant were courteous, attentive and professional. AGAIN we are most pleased with Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarai L
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was very suprised to find out that light housekeeping does not include sheets being change daily. I also had 3 uninvited guest in a four day stay...Waterbugs!!! I would give it another shot.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Superguy1221
Reviews.Content: I think this place is ideal for almost anyone. The rooms are large and all have kitchens The pool is nice all day The breakfast isn't great, but it's included in the room price, so it's nice to go down and grab a free apple The location is good (right next to a grocery and liquor store where you can get drinks to put in your fridge). The free buses to disney parks are a nice feature The parking is free. There's chain restaurants nearby (Macaroni Grill, Chili's, Joes Crab Shack) And best part is, I've never paid more than $140/night for a 2 bedroom! The place isn't pristine or brand new, but usually the best you can get for $140 is a standard room at the Sheraton. Keep in mind that the parking is outdoor (hot), there are no elevators, and that there's a desk trying to sell timeshares and disney tickets at the hotel (the tickets are more expensive at the hotel than at the gate). I also recommend going to the large outdoor outlet mall that's about a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and in a good location ... we'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Gracie99uk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks at the Lake Buena Vista Staybridge Suites. We (me, husband and our 14 month old) stayed in a one bedroom suite on the ground floor (no stairs with a buggy was a bonus). On arrival the check in staff were friendly and welcoming. The room consists of a lounge with sofa and one armchair and footstool with tv in one corner and a small square table with three chairs in the other plus stools at a worktop area leading into the small but adequately equipped kitchen. The kitchen was clean but did require a wipe down near the microwave area which was the only noticably grubby area. Kitchen had everything we needed although a pair of scissors in the kitchen would be a handy addition. The bedroom leads off the living room and onto a vanity area and walk-in wardrobe area. There is a separate room containing the toilet and bath/shower. The bathroom area seems small and a little dated but had good water pressure, hot water on demand and again was clean. Housekeeping is a light service every day ie: make beds,empty bins and replenish towels. The provision of towels was hit and miss and sometimes we had to call up to request more - these were always brought to the suite promptly. There is a complimentary breakfast consisting of bacon or sausage, toast, pasteries, cereals and a waffle maker. On three days of the week there are complimentary drinks and nibbles in the evening (beer and wine). There is a laundrette on site which was kept very clean and was $1.75 each for a wash and dry. The pool was lovely and warm, always pool towels and some children's pool toys/inflatables etc provided. This hotel is in a good location on LBV and there are numerous restaurants etc within walking distance if you're without a car. There is a Winn Dixie and Walgreens across the street too. All in all we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and close to all the attractions.”
Reviews.Author: hilasvg
Reviews.Content: We arrived on July 22nd for a 4 day/3 night stay. We arrived at the hotel at 11 am but our rooms were not available for check-in as yet. The front desk clerk was very nice and suggested that we relax at the pool while we waited for our rooms. We decided to have lunch at Perkins because we had a free coupon for an entree. At 4:15 our rooms were ready. It is basically an apartment which is very clean and spacious. No elevators but if you can manage a couple of stairs you will be fine. Lots of restaurants within walking distance and a winn Dixie and walgreens across the street. Overall this is a very nice hotel. Nice free buffet breakfast each morning. Only complaint was that on our last day the fire alarm went off twice. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to have stayed longer and would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: wmccann40
Reviews.Content: Stayed two weeks from 4th July as package holiday with first choice after reading good reviews. Was not disappointed. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet had an excellent choice and a great start to a day. Stayed in a two bedroom apartment which was very clean and roomy with excellent kitchen.Rooms also had a large safe and air conditioning. clean towels were provided every day. Pool area was always clean with towels also provided and the pool was cleaned every morning. The hotel seems to go out of its way to maintain cleanliness. There were free snacks and drinks provided on tuesday, wednesday and thursday evenings which were excellent. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance (Chilis was fab). Largish WinnDixie right beside with a lovely ice-cream parlour on the same lot. Excellent location to all the Parks. Only 5-10 minute drive to downtown disney and longest trip to any park was 25 minutes to universal. I would like to thank all the staff at the Staybridge for a wonderful 2 week stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “First time and loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lvsdsny
Reviews.Content: We are South Floridian Passholders who try to get up to Disney whenever possible (we average once every two months). This trip we decided to try Staybridge LBV after finding a discounted rate. We were thoroughly impressed! The front desk staff were courteous and prompt. Our two bedroom was on the second floor and was spotless, nicely decorated, roomy, had ice cold a/c and provided more space and amenities we had a chance to use for our weekend stay. We always try to stay at a hotel where breakfast is included, and sometimes...well, it leaves a lot to be desired. Not at Staybridge! Breakfast was very, very good! Nothing negative to report at all! We will certain be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk NOT accommodating but they have kitchens”
Reviews.Author: SmartConsumer
Reviews.Content: The building was very outdated and badly needs renovation. But, the kitchens are nicely equipped even if the dishwasher rattles. There's a nice-sized dining table for a family of four to sit comfortably; and, if there're more than 4, other people can sit on the counter or on the sofa which also serves as a pullout bed. One of the bathrooms was so tiny that you can't close the door while sitting on the toilet. Other than that, there was nothing to complain about as far as the facility was concerned. However, the Operations Manager and one of the Front Desk clerks' competence, attitude, and lack of hospitality disposition was quite another story. They made a big stinkin' deal about our request to check in 1 hour early when their check-in/check-out times don't even match other competitors like Marriott whose times are 1 hr earlier/later, respectively. Since the GM was trying to be hospitable and tried to make good, I give this hotel an "average" rating instead of "terrible" because at least the head of the hotel made attempts to apologize. Having stayed at other IHG hotels (ie. Candlewood Suites, Holiday Inn) my observation is that IHG hotels' facility qualities seriously lag behind those of other brands.

Reviews.Title: “Planning a return trip”
Reviews.Author: candicane0104
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful experience. We actually stayed here last October and as I started pricing this hotel again I realized I didn't write a review. We had a fabulous time here. Close enough to all attractions without spending alot of time in the car. We visited Disney, Universal, and Sea World. We are definitely staying here again. Great staff, nice pool, great location, great breakfast, I don't think it could've been better.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a stopping off point in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: karen.simpson
Reviews.Content: I was in Florida with my family about to do a driving holiday north from Orlando to Washington. We just needed an overnight stay after landing. This was ideal - we are a family of 5 with 3 teenage kids. The hotal is convenient, clean, provides suites with 2 bedrooms and a sofa bad - it sleeps 6. There is a kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Midweek there are free drinks and snacks in the evening. There is a laundry room. There is free wifi.There is 24 hour fitness room; the pool opens rather late for me but I suppose it cuts down on noise. Breakfast is basic but lots of choice - there is even a waffle maker - our kids loved! There is free parking. It may be OK for those visiting Florida on a budget - its near I Drive and there are some good local restautants e.g. we found a good Italian and Thai within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 7 nights”
Reviews.Author: NyWillie
Reviews.Content: Close to parks. Clean enough. Just outside Downtown Disney (3 blocks away). Tons of restaurant options. Walgreens across the street. Winn Dixie across the other street. Close to Interstate 4. Traffic can be brutal depending on the time of day. Pool was loud after 10 with poor parenting.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and just as great!!!”
Reviews.Author: nogecko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 16 nights April/May 2011. This was our second visit having stayed here in October 2009. I was afraid that the second time around things might not have been as good as I remembered but I needn't have worried. Check in was effortless. We had emailed the hotel before arriving requesting a ground floor room as my daughter had injured her foot shortly before the holiday. This request was met. We stayed in a 2 bed trio suite, 2 adults and 3 children aged 13, 11 and 5. The main bedroom had a king size bed, shower, bath and separate wc and handbasin. There was also a dressing area, a safe, extra linen, towels, iron and ironing board in this room. The second bedroom had 2 queen beds, shower, bath and separate wc and handbasin. There was ample closet space in this room. I liked this room because there were windows on two walls making it nice and bright. My only fault with this hotel is that the room can be quite dark. The kitchen seemed to be very well stocked, although I never used anything other than a wine glass! We did use the fridge though. We froze bottles of water to bring to the parks with us as we didnt like the bottled water on sale at the Disney parks or the price of them. The breakfast as other reviewers have said was a great start to the day - eggs, bacon, bagels, make your own waffle station, pastries, fruit, juices etc. There was something to suit everyone. There are Styrofoam cups if you want a take away cup of coffee and paper plates and bowels to bring cereal or pastries back to your room. We did this a couple of mornings when the older kids slept in. The last time we stayed we didnt attend any sundowners Tues, Wed and Thurs 5 - 7pm) but this time we did and I have to say they were great. It was a really good way to meet other people staying at the hotel and I was surprised that the food was so good particularly on the "Cook Out" nights. Pool area nice with plenty of sunbeds and towels. A couple of times they ran out of towels but they were replaced very quickly. There are plenty of pool toys available to keep the kids occupied. A bit of music around the pool area would have been nice though. There is a games room with arcade games, at a cost, and a computer. My teenager loved this for checking up with friends at home. We used the computers in the business centre to arrange car hire and found this very useful. A couple of times it was difficult to get at the computers in here though as there were teenagers using them to go on facebook. No under 18s are allowed to use the computers in this room but no one seemed to be monitoring it. It is only a small issue anyway. We didnt use the shuttle buses this holiday so I cant comment on them only to say that when we stayed in 2009 we used them all the time and found the service excellent. I am nearly finished - I know this is a long review, sorry. One of the main reasons we picked the Staybridge LBV on our first visit and again this time is the location. 10 minutes to disney and 25 to universal. Also for those evening when you aren't in the park there are ample restaurants within walking distance. Orlando Ale House and Olive Garden are two I would highly recommend. Winn Dixie and Walgreens are also within 3 minute walk. Anyone with any questions please feel free to ask, I know I did before I first chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal place to visit Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: dannyvanheck
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge Suites are a good place to stay during your visit of the Disney parks in Orlando. The suites are spacious, clean and well equiped. The hotel has a good infrastructure, a nice pool with towels, and a daily "happy hour" with free drinks and snacks. The complementary breakfast is OK: nothing special but good enough to start the day. A drive to the different Disney parks takes you about 10-15 minutes. There are supermarkets and restaurants in the immediate neighbourhood of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: tigtink
Reviews.Content: Check in was excellent - they had a 2 bedroom suite available right away - but had told us if they did not then they would store our food in their refrigerator. Into the room and a nice loveseat and chair with ottoman. small dining table with 4 chairs. 2 bedrooms with queen beds in both. Nice full sized dressers, dressing area and seperate baths with shower and toilet for each room. The area with toielt and tub/shower are small - but usable and clean. Kitchen has everything we needed and if you were missing something front desk staff would be accomodating. Free breakfast every day - which would be a money saver for most families. Nothing spectacular - but very good - scrambled eggs, hard boiled egss, yogurt, muffins, bagels, toast, cereals, assorted juices, coffee, milk, and a breakfast meat each day. Also a beer and wine reception eery night. Had guest laundry that was very clean - $1.75 to wash and $1.75 to dry and the dryers actually worked. small excercise room, and game room. Pool area small but never seemed crowded with 2 hot tubs and ample lounge chairs. Walgreens right across the street and very close to a myriad of restaurants and shops. About 5 minute drive to downtown disney and about 20 to universal. would think this would be ideal locale for a family vacation - staff very friendly and rooms very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay... feels like home.”
Reviews.Author: MCLima
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Staybridge LBV. Really felt like home... Pros: it was very convenient to have complimentary hot and cold breakfast, wifi internet in the room and sundowners. The pool was clean and the kids loved it. The location was perfect: just 10-15 minutes to MK and other WDW parks, and close to supermarkets, drugstores and restaurants. I also greatly appreciated the kindness of all the staff, specially Anthony from the front desk. Cons: the hotel needs some renovation.

Reviews.Title: “very homely”
Reviews.Author: trishnick
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a small complex that has a homely feel about it. We stayed in a 2bedroom trio suite. The bedrooms were a good size but the main living/kitchen area are much smaller than what they appear in photos. The free breakfast and sundowers were good. Hotel has a free shuttle service to Disney but not to Universal. We would catch the shuttle to the parks and then taxi it home. Next door to the hotel is a Win Dixey supermarket which was very cheap and enabled us to buy supplies for our room. The hotel is also surrounded by numerous resturants and you must try the milkshakes at steak and shakes. Bob at the front desk was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: dudeandlu
Reviews.Content: We are so happy with this Staybridge that we will return again and again. My kids love it here! The staff is very friendly and helpful including the two new trainees we met. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast each morning was great. My only concern is that the housekeeping staff ran the dishwasher every day with just a couple of dishes in it. The kind thought was there but extremely wasteful of water and energy. Thank you all again! See you next Spring!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: JoTravelsSJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend and her teenage daughter, Room was nice, The AC worked better if you slept with the bedroom door open. We also appreciated the travel desk./ concierge (sp?) assistance from Eric. His advice was to not buy the fast pass at Univiersal was right on!

Reviews.Title: “YES, YES, YES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deko85
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! This is a note from someone that lived in Orlando for 01 year working for Disney. Great hotel, perfect location (if you like to stay in Lake Buena Vista, instead of Intl. Drive), close to everything, spacious suites with full kitchen, complimentary full-buffet breakfast where you can make your own waffle, and so on. Very thoughtful staff, great housekeeping. Just be careful if you are traveling with very old people or someone that uses a wheelchair. This hotel does not have elevators, so make sure you request a room on the ground floor. My family and I stayed 10 nights in a 02-bedroom Trio suite. What an amazing option! It has 01 bedroom with a king size bed, another separate room with two queen size beds and a queen size sofa-bed in the living room. It's all you need in Orlando to stay comfortable! Lots of dining options in the area, including the Crossroads center, where you can find restaurants and a supermarket (Gooding's), 5 minutes drive to Downtown Disney and 10 minutes from any Disney theme park. Want the whole package? You got it!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about the Staybridge. Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marks281172
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge suites LBV for two weeks in Nov/Dec 2010 and loved every minute of it. Im an experienced traveller both to Orlando for holidays and to the USA in general for work and have stayed in various big name Hotels and on site at Disneyworld so wasnt expecting huge things from this more moderatly priced hotel but have to say everything about it was spot on. We arrived on the Saturday after thanksgiving and was quickly given our room after being given a little bag of cookies. We were asked by a lady on the opposite desk if we were interested in discount park tickets but said we were sorted and were sent on our way with a smile, no hard sell. The suite itself was on the 3rd floor facing the pool. I was aware that there were no elevators so expected to have to carry the cases up, but its only once up and once down so no hardship. If your party isnt able to do this im sure the guys at front desk would be happy to help. The suite had everything we needed, nice little kitchen, comfy lounge area with a good sized TV, nice bedroom and clean and well layed out bathroom. It was the little extras that made it for me though like the free in room safe and the free wi-fi. In the morning we did notice that one of the plug sockets was damaged and let front desk know. When we returned that evening it was fixed and we had a message apologising, there really was no need but nice touch. We made use of the free breakfast buffet about half the time we were there, its not as good as going to Dennys or Perkins for breakfast but theres plenty to choose from and if youre on a budget a great way to start the day. The hot food wasnt great but the pastries and coffee were lovely and i loved making myself a fresh waffle with maple syrup. It was a little chilly when we went but we did manage to use the pool a couple of times, its lovely and clean. Even at this time of year we saw the friendly maintenance folks cleaning the pool daily, it really was spotless. During our stay we had a weekend at Clearwater at the Hilton hotel and despite the Hilton being great we loved coming back to our little home from home. Location wise you couldnt ask for me, its a 10 minute drive to the Disney Parks, 15 mins to Universal and 5 mins to Seaworld. There is a shuttle bus to the parks but we had a car so never used it, it didnt seem too full when we saw it outside but again it was a quiet time of year. There are several restaurants in walking distance, we loved Chilli's for a nice no frills meal with a nice cold beer and Giordannos across the road does awesome chicago style stuffed Pizzas. There is also Joe's crab shack, Sizzler, Dennys, Black Angus and a few others in walking distance and you have Crossroads plaza a 2 minute drive away with lots of other eating spots including the awesome Sweet Tomatoes. There is a wallgreens near the hotel and a Winn Dixie out the back, i found the Winn Dixie to be much quieter and friendlier than Walmart and not much more expensive. Theres also so fast food take away places next to the Winn Dixie that would be good for a quiet night in with a pizza or chinese. Overall i have to say this is probably the best place ive stayed at in Orlando, beating the Disney hotels for convenience and value hands day and at least equal to the higher end off site hotels ive stayed at like the Wyndham resort and Hilton Garden inn in terms of service and quality of stay. So long as you can cope with the lack of lifts i would recommened this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay - good location”
Reviews.Author: carlyscan
