Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and friendly. We were there for a 5 day vacation with a rented car. It's easy to get around Orlando with a GPS -however, one day during our stay, traffic around the I-4 near the hotel exit got very busy with slowdowns/jams. The location was great being not far from most of the major theme parks. A grocery store was within close walking distance and we used it several times during our stay. There is a huge variety of restaurants nearby. We used the refrigerator in the room-kitchen was very clean. The rest of the suite was ok for cleanliness -- I felt the bathroom and bathroom sink could have been cleaner. The pool area was very clean. The breakfast and evening reception food was just ok, but it was nice to have soda and wine. Noisy neighbors were reason for poor sleep quality. Overall, it was a good value stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Anasof
Reviews.Content: My family and I love Staybridge hotels because we find them really comfortable and the kitchen is a big plus. But really, this one is terrible. It looks like a motel and our room was so dark and it faced the parking lot at the first floor so every time someone arrived and use the stairs it felt like they were coming right into our room. And the room smelled funny like moist or dust. Bathroom is so small and the safe box did not work at all. We are not coming back to this particular Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LesmarieW
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be just great - it was basic but for the price what more would you expect! The staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed for 10 nights (6 nights then a cruise and back for 4 more nights) and we were able to leave our excess luggage not needed in a small cruise cabin in the hotel lock up facility for our return. The free breakfasts were limited but filling and tasty and more than enough food for my growing boys! Maps and directions supplied by the hotel were simple and accurate. We were able to find our way every time - even driving on the wrong side of the road for us South Africans! Facilities in the area were just what we needed! I would and have recommended this to a friend who stayed there just after we did and who enjoyed their stay too! I would have likes more cleaning supplies as who wants to have to bring dish clothes and drying cloths on holiday with them - and the light touch cleaning service was sometimes not quite enough and i would have liked to clean a little more without having to go and purchse items for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, large suite, free food, great location, old 3-story buildings without elevators.”
Reviews.Author: jamesham
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the morning long before the posted 4pm check-in time, and Anthony at the front desk was very helpful in getting us into an available room on the first floor. (Unfortunately the hotel consists of multiple three-story buildings without elevators...think ex-MARRIOTT RESIDENCE INN from the 70's.) The suites are large one and two bedroom units with attached bathrooms, and kitchen with full-size appliances. King bed in the "master" and two beds in the second corner units. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The free hot breakfast is great. Tuesday to Thursday has an evening reception with soft drinks, beer, and light food. Good location with lots of restaurants and grocery stores close by. This area also creates some security concerns after dark, and the hotel locks the rear parking lot entrance to limit car traffic to the front driveway. Very nice pool and spa in the middle of the courtyard. Property is old and could use some paint and updating. Great value considering room cost, location, and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: HotelHekla
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Orlando and stayed 8 nights at Staybridge Suites with a very large family, 5 adults, 2 teenagers and 2 babies. After reading some comments on Tripadvisor, I was initially worried about the quality of the room, but after arriving I was pleasantly surprised to find the suite met all of my needs. The location was terrific, and considering I was traveling with so many people I could not have asked for anything better. The room and facilities were excellent, and the price could not be beat. I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: aj12202
Reviews.Content: This place is basically a two bedroom house with two bathrooms, a full kitchen and living room with pull out couch. It also includes breakfast which is great, a pool jacuzi and a fitness center. Needs some updating but for under a hundred a night what more could ya ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: floridagirl1218
Reviews.Content: Two bedroom two bath suite with kitchen - what else do you need with a family? Free breakfast was perfect for us and had a wide variety to choose from. Kids loved the heated pool and were able to swim in it even in November. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Disney stay”
Reviews.Author: triptime247
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here for our disney vacation--We got to check in at @ 1 pm , our 3rd floor suite with no elevator wasn't a problem for us. If you have heath problems or older you might request a floor level room. WinnDixie grocery right next door,lots of eating places close by. Lots of room and storage in our 2 bedroom suite. The bedrooms are on each side of the living/kitchen area, 3 TVs, 3 real beds ( one king, 2 doubles) and a pull out bed in the sofa. Two full bathrooms in each of the bedrooms, enough kitchen supplies I made spagehetti for supper. Didn't use pool or hot tub ( too cold) but nice. Bus service to the parks everyday, several pickup and returns was OK-full buses, we had to stand one of our 4 days using this service. Nice breakfast every day, good coffee, coke products, one meat ( bacon, ham or sausage), packaged egg product eggs that are good, breads,cereals, yogart, make your own waffles. Lots of tables. Sundowners on tue, wed, thurs--we used 2 nights-great way to save money--burgers were good. I got a good rate through Orlando vistors--magic card-stay 4 nights get 5 free--5 nights of stay was $675 (including tax). We are planning a universal trip in a couple years ---i will check out the other Staybridge close to universal. This is a good place for a disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Space Space and More Space”
Reviews.Author: pflovett
Reviews.Content: Our family travels to Orlando every Christmas for the last 10 years. We stay here because we get plenty of space and privacy. This is not a normail hotel room and with teenagers they can watch TV all night in their room or in the living area and my husband and I can close our door and not be bothered. The breakfast is eggs, meat(bacon or ham) , breads, bagels, yogurt and some fruit plenty for everyone. This is not a 5 star so do not expect luxury but do expect peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Okay... I guess”
Reviews.Author: Korin
Reviews.Content: The property is located within easy driving distance from all the Disney Parks and is only one exit from Sea World and Discovery Cove. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. The staff was friendly and very helpful and this is why I rated the hotel as poor instead of terrible. Rating it average would be too generous as I have been in many average hotels that were much better. The rooms were worn down a little and could use a remodel. The property is a little old and I always felt like the room was dirty. The tile in the bathrooms were in need of serious cleaning or replacement. The pillows were the worst I've had in a hotel. They looked like a throw pillow for a couch with a cover on it. They barely measured 14 inches wide and were very lumpy. Internet... what internet? It was so slow they might as well say it's not available. It reminded me of a 56k modem and during peak times, a 28k modem. The free breakfast should be free as it was one of the worst! The eggs were horrible (foamy and lacked taste), the sausage floated in grease, and had no bacon. They did have fresh fruit and bread. It was so bad we opted to pay for breakfast elsewhere. The "Customer Service" desk is basically a desk where you get a sales pitch on all the Disney parks and other junk you may or may not want. The front desk makes you go to that desk to pick up your parking pass so you are forced to talk to them. I saw what was coming and made it known to only give me a pass and not say anymore. I hate being forced to talk to sales people. I am a Priority Club member at their Platinum level and I can say that of all the Staybridge hotels I have been to, this one ranks the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: dmmaglet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in November prior to checking in to our other resort. We stayed here in a 2br trio. I did get it cheap for $99 plus tax. That's all it's basically worth. The hotel does not have an elevator and they put us on the third floor. My husband just had knee surgery and it was difficult for him to do steps plus to carry our suitcase. I should have gone back and asked to be switched but he said it for only one night. The room had a sitting area a small kitchen with stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, and a microwave. The master bedroom had a king size bed with a large bathroom. The second bedroom had 2 full size beds with a typical bath. The bath/shower combo and commode was located in the bathroom and sink was outside. Breakfast was provided which was okay. The day we were there they had cheese omeletes and bacon. Waffles are available to be made everyday. Cereal, bagels, danishes, donuts and toast is provided all the time. It was very crowded and congested in the breakfast area, but we made it work. I would only stay here again for a cheap price. The hotel is showing wear and tear and needs renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price / location”
Reviews.Author: BWWblaxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a quick 2 day trip to Disneyworld. We decided to rent a car - the directions to the hotel were simple to follow. The area is full of restaurants and shops, mostly major franchises. The lady at the Front Desk was extremely helpful. They allowed for an early check in and we really appreciated the free parking. The suites are extremely comfortable and spacious. The bed was very comfy and we certainly appreciated the kitchen and living room area and 2 TV's. We ended up driving to the parks, but there are shuttles to take you there. The breakfast food was really good - bagels, cereals, eggs, bacon, etc Even make-your-own-waffles. I found it very filling. Because of time constraints, we didn't use the pool, but I thought this was an excellent value and quality stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, a little dated, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jasonmonica
Reviews.Content: If you are staying at this hotel prepare to walk upstairs with all of your luggage if you do not get a first floor room. No elevators. Got a two bedroom suite facing the pool. The pool stays open until 11pm so a room facing the pool can be noisy late at night. Lots of people stay here even in off season so be prepared for a very busy lobby during breakfast hours. Free breakfast included nasty egg like product, but the fruit and drink selection were good; bananas, apples, peaches, four types of milk and several juices. Hotel is clearly not new, but it was clean and the customer service from the front desk was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: papworth
Reviews.Content: Staying 10 nights we found the hotel to be a home from home. Clean and comfortable suite with two double beds in one ensuite room and one huge king bed in the other ensuite room. The two bedrooms were linked by a sittingroom/kitchen. There was also a vanity area in the master bedroom and lots of space to hang clothes. The staff were fantastic and quickly dealt with the couple of minor issues that we had. Very friendly and really nice to chat to even asking the children how their day had been. I also felt that they valued their priority club members. Good breakfast with lots of choice although I did wonder if the eggs were powdered? However the waffles more than made up for this and became a favourite as was the delicious coffee. Launderette good with lots of machines and costing $1.50 to wash and $1.50 to dry. The hotel refunded unused tokens at the end of our stay. Nice pool although small but thorougly enjoyed by my children especially the inflatables. Also we found pool towels readily available. Shuttle to Disney always on time and we always got a seat. Stops at one more hotel en route to Disney but a few more coming back depending on where everyone on the bus wants to go. When we decided to get a taxi, the front desk would call one for us and it would be there in 5 minutes each time. Great location for this hotel. Across the car park at the back, across a minor road and you were in the car park at Winn-Dixie. In the other direction you are a stones throw from a 24 hour Walgreens which also has a practitioner who can deal with minor ailments (at a price of course!) We also played Pirates Cove golf one night and had dinner at the Olive Garden and easily walked back to the hotel from there in 5-10 minutes. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: AlandPat
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to this hotel We were 5 adults with 2 small children. We were comfortably lodged in one of their 2 bedroom suites which feature 2 BR, 2BA and a compact living room and kitchen situated between the two. Our room cost 119 + tax total and included a full hot breakfast for all. Upon checkin we were given a bag of 8 large fresh cookies. The hotel was clean, not pristine but clean. It appears to be older but I am guessing the it has been remodeled in the last 2 years. The grounds were very well maintained and the pool was clean and well equipped. The hotel consists of a series of three story buildings ( about 12?) and our room was on the third floor facing the parking lot. Since we spent most of our time at Universal, it was suitable for us. Probably this hotel works better for Disney visitors since Disney is much closer than Universal. They do provide a shuttle to Disney which we found to be unreliable on our first visit 2 years ago Hopefully it is better now. The breakfast was filling but only a few hot entrees were served. Make your own Belgian waffles were available and delicious. Over all, unless you want to spent the money for a hotel on one of the park grounds, this is a great choice for travelling families .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianFamily480
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista for 3 nights in May. On our arrival very late at night, we were given a room on the busy road. It was quiet at the time of our arrival but the noise picked up by morning with all the traffic headed to Disney World. The front desk did not hesitate to move us to an inner courtyard room upon our request. We were lucky to get a room looking over the outdoor dining area instead of the pool. It was lovely and quiet. The room was spacious and an amazing deal for $113 per night. We booked a 2 bedroom suite with one king and two doubles. We couldn't believe all the amenities - two bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen, dining area and living area. The included buffet breakfast was expansive and we enjoyed it out in the courtyard - great way to start the day. The pool was big and there was also a very shallow pool for small children. The workout room was small but I had it to myself and it was just fine. We were very happy with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice place very friendly”
Reviews.Author: bajabev
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sept. for 5 nights. the room was clean and roomy. This hotel is is an all suite hotel. The tub/toilette area was a bit small. Housekeeping was very attentive and paid attention to details. My husband enjoyed the evening reception which was held on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday which included wine and beer along with a modest food items. I was surprised at the variety of items offered at the breakfast buffett. You could even make your own waffles. Roy at the front desk was extremly kind and made you feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Texans35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lake Buena Vista location for seven days in the beginning of October visiting Disney. The hotel itself looks good but has no elevators, three floors with stairs and is in short showing it's age. We did not mind as our package for flight, car and hotel for seven day was $1600, one great deal . We had a two room suite that resembled an apartment. Check in was easy and friendly, the room itself was fine, TV's in every room, just dated and a bit worn. The location is about four miles and five minutes from all the Disney resorts and was easy to drive. There is a Wal-Mart about six miles away and a Winn Dixie next door. All along the 528 corridor is enough restaurants to suit anyones needs along with three decent gift shops selling Disney and Florida items about half the price than at Disney close by the hotel. The internet was not working but within two days was fixed, wiring and server problems. The rooms where also cleaned and maid service provided everyday. After leaving the room in a mess and slogging around Disney for twelve hours it was nice to come back to a clean room. The beds are very comfortable. The breakfast is free and very good value, eggs, meat, cereal, fruit, toast, bagels,waffle maker, drinks. The pool was large and clean and the hot tub was working just fine. A BBQ pit was available for guests too. ALL in all we will be staying there again as the location to Disney meant that everything was within a five mile radius and easy to navigate and the extra bedroom worked well with the kids as did the full kitchen. The vacation was a blast too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is situated in great location for Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: dougal18
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect for Disney Attractions, free shuttle service to 4 attractions. The Hotel itself is clean rooms are clean, new carpets on the floor, the grounds are well maintained. Staff are excellent & cannot do enough to for you The pool area is perfect for kids & adults Great breakfast which is included in your booking , they also provide free sundowner Tues, Wed, Thurs. all free. Supermarkets - Wallgreens & Win -Dixy 5min walk Restruants - with in easy walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for loaction and price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stranglersfan
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the staybridge Suites in Lake Bueno Vista. The room was as described and far better than a regular hotel room. Bedroom was large with doors that closed off. This is honestly the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in, and we have travelled a fair bit! Check in was smooth, we were even 2 1/2 hours early and our room was ready! It was the first week after kids were back in school so the hotel was fairly quiet for the first 2 nights, not a bad thing in Orlando!! Plenty of space with a full size frodge/freezer and icemaker. didn't use the kitchen as there are many decent restaurants within a few minutes walking dostance, I never want to cook on holiday anyway, but the kitchen is handy if required. Room view was poor, we were in the 1800 building which overlooked our parking area.. No private balcony was a downside, but the only one I can think of. breafast is free and decent, the coffee is very good! Sundownwer 3 nights of the week included food, beer and wine, we enjoyed a couple of free bevereges each evening! Smoking is allowed in certain areas but not in the pool area ( nor are alcoholic drinks). We found the hotel more than adequate for our short stay and are planning on staying there again with family in one of the 2 bedroom rooms. Close to Disney and about a 15 minute drive to universal, which is where we went twice. Used our rental car not the shuttles so cannpt say anything about them. Wife and I would definately recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “All things considered, a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: RogerWilcoOver
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in this hotel. Pros.. It is very close to Disney.. Sea World, Universal are easy to get to. The room is comfortable with two beds, almost like a small apartment since there is a wall with a doorway that separates the two rooms. Room had a full size fridge, a full sized oven, microwave, plates and silverware. Room also had a safe; it was easy to use and there was no additional charge for using it. There is also a Winn Dixie supermarket within walking distance (be sire and ask for a free WInn Dixie card on your first visit). The breakfast was always good; eggs each morning and the meat available was either ham, bacon or sausage. Waffle makers, cold cereal muffins and doughnuts, milk juice and coffee. The breakfast area is staffed so they were never out of anything. Everyone in our family found something they liked. The pool was nice and is shaded in the hot afternoons. Cons... we did see a cockroach.. but we are from the south (Texas), and we have seen them before. Some people are put off by them so I figured I would mention it. The free shuttle was jam packed. Standing room only...no joke. We only used it the first day and we drove to the parks the rest of the time. Yes, we paid to park, but the parking pass is good for all of the parks all day long. One other thing.... if your stay includes a Friday or Saturday night, getting off on Exit 68 from I-4 will teach you a whole new vocabulary. Buy a good Orlando map and avoid that road during peak hours.

Reviews.Title: “Needs To Re-capture It's Potential”
Reviews.Author: Drew47
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a great deal. As a member of the family of hotels' loyalty program, for us, it was a no brainer: free breakfast, a two-room, 2 full-bath, full-kitchen suite for $100/night plus tax...and only minutes away from Disney attractions. Throw-in a package deal: 7 nights for the price of 5 and 6 days of Disney park passes for the price of four, and this is hard to beat. But, you have to be prepared for a bit of 'rough around the edges.' Trim everywhere on the exterior needed a new coat of paint or completely repaired due to central Florida's relatively brutal heat and humidity. We found small areas required stucco repair, and some wood trim was visibly deteriorating. Previous reviews we have read noted the carpets in the rooms appeared dirty. I cannot disagree. Housekeeping could've been better. Rooms have coffee service in them, though, with a free breakfast, I never had a need to use it. However, we just happen to inspect the service and found that there were only de-caffeinated coffee packs available, and a used coffee filter pack still in the coffee maker from the last guest. Yuck. Throughout our stay, this coffee service was never re-supplied. There is a form for you to list any thing in the room that needs attention. I noted the wall clock in the common sitting area was not working(dead battery?) . The form appeared to have been collected by housekeeping, but I never saw the clock fixed nor was there any mention made by hotel staff of having received my note. Also points off for the dryers in the laundry area. $1.50 per load and our clothes were as wet as if they just came out of the wash machine. Another guest had the same experience as us as we were washing at the same time. The pool and the jacuzzi were fine, though we used it only 2-3 times during our week stay. I assume the pool uses one of those salt-based chlorinators as there was a definite salty taste to the water (yeah right, you try and keep pool water out of your mouth when you swim!). Otherwise, the pool water did appear clean. The lobby was clean and inviting. The free breakfast was great. One step above what you would find in a Holiday Inn Express or similar. It was actually more of a buffet, with two serving lines. As the hotel is comprised of several 3-story buidlings around a large court yard, which includes the pool, laundry service building and a covered veranda area, there are no elevators, just external stairs. If you cannot 'do stairs' I recommend informing the hotel at the time you are making reservations. A Winn-Dixie supermarket and a liquour store is literally across the street making use of the suite's kitchen a very easy alternative to expensive restaurant fare. Downtown Disney is only minutes a way by car, and not difficult to get to either. There are money quality eateres nearby, too. While the hotel offers FREE bus transportation to all Disney parks, it isn't the best. You can't complain though, since it is free. At one point it took us an hour to get from Epcot back to our hotel as the bus route also services at least two other hotels in the area. For the morning trips to the parks, as our hotel was the last on the route, it was standing room only...and I must believe some had to be left behind as there was eventually no more room. After the second or third day, we drove ourselves to the parks, forking over the $14/day parking. Admittedly it was due to an injury requiring crutches and a wheelchair, but I must believe we would have eventually decided to drive on our own as did one family sans injury because of the amount of time it took to get to and from the parks otherwise. The schedule of pick up and return to the hotel is also a bit limited. Overall, if you are on a Disney adventure and don't want to stay at a Disney property because of the cost, this is a great choice. Since you won't be doing much more than sleeping and eating breakfast here, going for something more expensive is truly a waste of money, IMO. The hotel, however, needs to invest a bit of money in this money maker to keep it up to Disney quality.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel with minor problems”
Reviews.Author: PaddySch
Reviews.Content: Pros: 88 USD for a hotel with Breakfast, Disney Shuttle (all parks), 4 times a week Dinner and a one bedroom. A real good deal. Supermarket and restaurants are walking distance, about 200meters. Good check in. Cons: it is ok clean, but You will easily ind dust corners, e.g. behind TV or under the bed. If the hotel is full, breakfast is a battle, we ended up a few times having to wait for a table. Housekeeping might come late, we experienced once at 5 pm. Bad if You have two tired kids and need to wait. Summary: We stayed, with one interruption a total of 14 days. If the price is good, a good deal. Not the place for a romantic getaway. After a few days you get tired of the standard staybridge breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RubenNewyork
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly THANK YOU Anthony and Ron. These guys were great as well as the meal staff. Breakfast was GREAT they rotated eggs or cheese omelets, ham, bacon or sausage each day. The room was a little tight small king bedroom and small kitchen. The living room had the sofa against the wall where the T.V. is so you couldn't watch it from the sofa. The room door and walls are a bit thin so it is noisy. It is not a gated hotel so anyone can enter. The shuttle bus is used by three other hotels and the Staybridge is the last stop so you may not get a seat. There is also no security check so anyone from a number of hotels can get on the shuttle as they did. It is a free for all when you try to board the bus from Disney I recommend you take your car or ride the Lynx or Disney buses you are about three blocks from a Disney main gate.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat! Perfect for families.”
Reviews.Author: LesleyDublin
Reviews.Content: This is our second year to stay here and I think it's an excellent hotel and great value. We have 3 teenage children. The suite had two bedrooms, one with a huge king bed, one with two queen beds and a sofa bed in the living room. There are 3 tv's, free wifi, a full cooker, large fridge, safe, iron and ironing board, two hairdryers, and loads of storage space. There are 2 bathrooms. The breakfast is included and there's a great choice, so if you're going to Theme Parks you are not hungry again till late afternoon. With 5 of us, the rate was so good, my son said you would hardly get a hostel as cheap if you divided the nightly rate by 5. There is a business centre which we used to print off airline tickets, and no charge for that. There is a swimming pool and jacuzzi and a gym I think although we didn't use it. The hotel is literally around the corner from Disney and about 15 minutes in the car from Universal. There is a free courtesy bus to Disney and also to the outlets but we had hired a car so we used the car anyway. There is a great Walmart on Turkey Lake Road, open 24 hours and with a McDonalds in it as well, but there is a Walgreens and a Wine Dixie beside the hotel. Also there are lots of restaurants nearby. The beauty of this hotel is that there is so much room in the suites that everybody has their own space. The room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels, toiletries etc. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Orlando. I think it's an all round great hotel, in a great location, and so much space for everyone that you don't get the normal teenage arguing at all. On a visit about 10 years ago we rented a house in Kissamee but it was too far out and you had a long drive every night after the theme parks. Our flight was an evening flight so we were able to leave our suitcases in a locked room in the reception area and go back later for them. There is a huge parking area, free of charge. What else can I say. The rate is very reasonable. If I was going back to Orlando I would stay here again and would be disappointed if I couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mendoza830
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days while visiting the Disney parks. The 2 bedroom suites are great. They're roomy. The rooms have a kitchen, a fridge, an oven, a microwave, dishes, everything, a dvd player... They have light housekeeping daily. So, every day when we came back the beds were made, we had fresh towels and the room was ready to go another round with us. The breakfast was awesome. We didn't pay to go to breakfast once. That saved us lots of $. Don't expect steak and eggs or an omelet station or anything. Juice, milk, cereal, scrambled eggs, a meat, toast, oatmeal, waffles, great coffee, tea. Coffee is out 24 hrs a day too. It's great to just go downstairs together or just whenever you're ready. Also, during the week the staff will bbq burgers and/or dogs and put out chips, beer, soda. So we saved again there because there were 2 nights that we didn't even have to go out for dinner. It's a short walk to the drug store, olive garden, mcdonalds, many fast food places to choose from. There's a computer room, a game room, a laudry room. It's pretty much like home. Just like some other reviews, my small complaint was the carpet was older and somewhat dirty. But don't worry because when I check out I let them know that that was my only concern and they assured me that they're getting new carpet, so that will be taken care of shortly. We did not rent a car and we had no problem with the bus. Sometimes it was pakced, but so you have to stand for 10 - 15 mins, who cares. If I were going to go back to Orlando, I would stay here again. We didn't particularly care for Orlando because of the weather, but the hotel and the Disney parks are awesome. Overall, it was a great family adventure. But California weather is more our style. Disneyland, here we come.

Reviews.Title: “Groups needing multiple rooms should look no further”
Reviews.Author: ajsiegel00
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 3 small children (1, 3 & 5), 2 young adults (20 & 21) and 2 adults (>30). Little to say we needed space and showers. The benefit of the nice size room along with the two large showers was exactly what we needed. The rooms are a bit outdated but we did not pay for the Four Seasons. The rates were priced way better than reserving two rooms on Disney property and if we had been staying longer we would have loved the access to the full kitchen. And don't forget the breakfast. This is more than a traditional continental fare. There was eggs, bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit and more. It was a great way to start the day. Also during the week there were family nights which included dinners as well (we did not stay for this but saw it advertised in the room). There is a free shuttle to Disney if you don't want to pay for parking or it is only a few minutes to Downtown Disney where you can catch a shuttle to any of the Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 2 bedroom suite & location”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCaz
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful stay here. The two kids had their own beds, in their own room, with their own bathroom - after 5 weeks travelling together, this was a blessing. Lovely, big 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen. Free breakfast was a wonderful start to every day. We drove down I-Drive a couple of times and were glad to be staying in Lake Buena Vista.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jasonk287
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge from July 24-29, 2010. We loved the hotel in general. We saw it's high rating on TripAdvisor and liked the fact that it had plenty of space for a family. Traveled with 6 people, three adults and three teens. Check-in was smooth and trouble-free and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were given some coupons for nearby restaurants upon check-in and invited to the free daily breakfast and afternoon reception (held Tues, Weds and Thurs evenings). The hotel is a "WDW Good Neighbor Hotel", meaning you can buy Disney tickets here (though not necessarily at discounts). Hotel's location is outstanding. It is located just off Apopka-Vineland Road, just a couple miles north of I-4 exit 68. This road is somewhat of a tourist strip, but the hotel is not located in the busy section. Downtown Disney's entrance is 5 minutes or less away, and Universal and Sea World are no more than 10 minutes up I-4. You are really no more than 15 minutes away from any Disney location or park. The hotel is not smack on top of other hotels like some in this area; it is located by itself in a very quiet area, although everything you need is just minutes away, including several sit-down restaurants, fast food, and a grocery store (Winn-Dixie). If you're flying in from Orlando Airport, expect maybe a 25 minute drive to the hotel. We didn't encounter any problems during our stay. The rooms were VERY spacious, with a huge living room and two bedrooms, each with their own bathroom, which was wonderful. The bathrooms themselves are pretty small, however, but we didn't mind too much. The sink and counter is located outside of the bathroom. The carpets, as you'll see in other reviews on this site, are somewhat outdated and dirty, but the rest of the room is spotless. Side note, the grounds of the hotel are very nice, with nice landscaping. Pool is a little small but is well taken care of. It appeared, during our stay, that a maintenance staff was replacing cabinets and doors in some of the rooms, so maybe they're renovating somewhat. Hotel has free wireless internet, but the signal is hard to pick up and weak at most times. Beds and couches/chairs were very comfortable. Wished we stayed longer! We will definitely return to this hotel when we come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Brill - once again!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireS23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 14-28 May - no problems at all. Emailled before our stay and we were put again in the same room we had last year. on the third floor, 2 bedroomed suite with 2 bathrooms, fully fitted kitchen and great lounge space. Staff very helpful and rooms made up each day) Breakfast a bonus each day, and shuttle buses very useful to getting to and from the parks. Used managers reception a couple of times for a snack or took food to room to save going out for meals. Plenty of resturants in the area, recommend Giordanas pizza, black angus for the steaks. Winn dixie across the road and 10 minute drive to Downtown Disney and Seaworld and Discovery Cove

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here. The breakfast is...”
Reviews.Author: Kmonbuckeyes
Reviews.Content: We loved it here. The breakfast is awesome! Great service, quiet, clean rooms. Great location. Kids loved the pool (which was never very crowded). Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Modest budget...great choice”
Reviews.Author: RRUF
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, his girlfriend and I stayed at this suites hotel from 6/6/10 - 6/13/10 and I can't say enough positive about our experience. The value for the price was OUTSTANDING! Staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Room was dated, but more than sufficient for our needs and housekeeping came daily to make beds and wash dishes and freshen towels. They had a convenient washer and dryer next to pool area so you could relax while waiting. Located walking distance to Winn-Dixie grocery store. Winn-Dixie allowed you to access their store card to get store savings. At Staybridge, the free breakfast was great with what we considered to be a reasonable variety of foods. Mid-week they have Sundowner Receptions. Tuesday evening they had chinese night with egg rolls and fried rice, Wednesday evening they had a cookout with hot dogs and burgers and Thursday they had chips and salsa. All this was included in the price of the room. These reception foods, while not truly complete meals, really cut our expenses on eating out as we simply added a light snack. In addition to the foods, they had beer, wine and soda also free. The only thing I would change is more bus service to/from the theme parks, or at least Downtown Disney. You had a full kitchen to cook, but if you came back to your room for lunch and a swim, you had no way to return to the parks later in the day. We chose to use our car which made the travel to/from the parks fast and easy, However, you must pay $14 per day for parking at Disney if staying off property. Still a great value compared to the cost of staying on property. Highly recommend it if bedroom privacy and/or budget is a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: spready1971
Reviews.Content: We've just arrived back from a family trip to Florida staying at staybridge suites Buena Vista. The Hotel is in a fantastic location 10mins from Disney world and 5mins from downtown Disney and with interstate 4 also close by all the other attractions are within easy reach. The rooms are spacious and have separate sleeping areas for children and adults. A fully equipped kitchen with coffee ,fridge and microwave oven are also in the room along with two tv sets. Air conditioning is a must in the heat and its nice to return to a chilled room at the end of the day. The breakfast ,without being exceptional, is more than adequate to give you a good start to the day and food is plentiful. If i had any slight moan to make it would be that the pool was a little warm, but thats immaterial. Overall this is a great clean hotel in a fantastic location and i would like to thank everyone involved for making our family holiday so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed May 2010. Our 3rd time in Orlando...”
Reviews.Author: TreesyEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 2010. Our 3rd time in Orlando and this is the best hotel yet! Fantastic location, free breakfast, free parking, great pool, great weather would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: santa78
Reviews.Content: Am still staying here at present! Using the great IT facilities never busy. Kids love the pool although smaller than seems on the photos etc. Towels etc on plentiful. We must have an upgrade room, everything spotless, didn't have a kettle and asked at reception for this as English can't manage without kettle! and this and extra chair requested (as there is 5 of us) were there within 30minutes. Breakfast adequate with fresh eggs and meat each day and the kids enjoy the waffle station. Evening sundowner good for saving a few dollars on food, quite limited on choice but beer, wine and sodas all free and enough for evening meal. Reception staff couteous and attentive and helpful. Transport to the parks saves on $14 parking fee and reliable and takes you nearer to the parks than would if you drove. Read many reviews of this hotel myself and am very pleased with my choivce after looking at many others. Great location to Disney, 5 minutes from Seaworld and 15mins to Universal up the back road without using I 4. Tried a few local restaurants and Sizzler was far the best value for money $60 for 5 including all you can eat and drinks. Great food stores next door Winn Dixie (get a card and save on offers) and Walgreens across the road.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, would come again and again”
Reviews.Author: sofiasdad72
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we stayed at the Staybridge Buena Vista, the first time in Nov 2008. So we already had a certain expectation. The only negative is that it appears that the general infrastructure of the suites is lacking from our previous trip. The living and dining area in our suite was dirty and in need of refurbishment. We frequently had blackened feet and dirty socks from the carpet. However, as a place to crash at the end of the day it was acceptable. There was a serious pipe leak that put the small fitness room out of use and caused loud air dryers to be placed throughout the dining/reception area. Our room didnt get the attention that we had previously. On two occasions our room was not prepared and frequently rubbish not removed. I suspect that as with all of the travel industry the reccession has hit hard and perhaps their renovation and/or cleaning schedule has been affected. The maids seemed constantly busy working long hours, perhaps their numbers have been cut? The positives outweigh the negatives though. The location is great, Disney nearby, Universal a 10 minute drive (take Vineland Apopka Road, Sandlake then Turkey Lake to miss the Interstate (4) traffic). The I4 is 5 min drive and easy to access. Plenty of places to eat, Joes Crab Shack, Chillis, Red Lobster and various other family friendly restaraunts withinin walking distance. Winn Dixie supermarket is over the road which we found invaluable for snacks, drinks and stuff for our 2 1/2 year old. Parking is great easy to get to rooms and always available. The staff, in particular the breakfast team are very friendly and helpful. The pool is ideal for kids and was frequently busy up to about 1030 at night. Breakfast was ideal for setting us up for the day... not sure what people mean about lack of choice??? Cereal, fruit, juices, coffee, tea, eggs, meat, yogurts, waffles, muffins, toast, bagels, porridge..... What more would you really want? Lack of choice seriously???? We always enjoy the reception on a tues-thurs providing beer wine and nibbles... great to sit outside in the quiet courtyard after a day of chasing the kid around the parks. Beds are a real plus, big and really comfortable. Two TV's! Point to note....Keep kids away from the two lakes in front of the hotel however! Went for an early morning run and heard the tell tale sounds of gators belching! Overall would recommend, get what you pay for.. word to the management ... take care of the place!!! Its a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Family Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: AAHend
Reviews.Content: I am almost frightened to recommend this location in fear that more people will stay there and it will lose its charm and personality. We live in Florida and travel to Disney multiple times a year with our two children (9 & 11). Over the years we have tried many locations in and around Disneyworld. The Marriott Village is too busy and has no character, the people are rude and I feel like a business traveler when staying there. The Holiday Inn SunSpree is dirty old and has no value. Other hotels in the area are commercial and lack the personality that this particular Staybridge Suites has. We have stayed there now on 4 separate occasions and each time we feel like we are at home. The rooms are spotless, the grounds are constantly being kept, there is no noise once you are in the rooms and the respect for each neighbor is given once everyone recognizes the quality of the hotel. The Breakfasts are bountiful and never ending. The game room for the kids is, well its there but not much to it, but we never use it anyway as there is always so much more to do off property. What struck me most about this location is its staffâ€™s attention to details. The second time we stayed there was Easter vacation of 2009. In a politically correct society, this location showed their true character by having the Easter Bunny in the lobby visiting with all of the children on Easter Sunday. I was amazed that a business would do this and elated that this location took the time to show us how much they cared about children on such a religious holiday. We enjoy the Sundowners reception that they have on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays which offers complementary soda, beer and wine along with a small buffet of appetizers, hamburgers or Hotdogs. Parking is safe and free. This hotel is minutes away from Downtown Disney and Typhoon Lagoon as well as the rest of Disneyworld. The frond Desk staff is courteous, kind and most accommodating. The Management staff recognizes the location of the hotel and the vast choices that we as visitors have and make every effort to make themselves memorable. A 2 bedroom, 750 sqft room with a kitchen, 3 TVâ€™s, 2 bathrooms and dining area along with a pull out sleeper sofa if needed is all that anyone can ask for while on vacation. Add the beautiful pool views, hot tub, laundry facility and the quality staff and you will be pampered. Our hats of to the ownership group that got this one right, we will never stay anywhere else while visiting Disney in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great-sized rooms, friendly staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: soobysoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 16 nights April/May 2010 in a two bedroom suite through an offer with Walt Disney Travel in the UK. The suite was massive with 2 good-sized bedrooms, 3 TVs and 2 Baths. Decor slightly dated - kitchen and bathroom cabinets ready for replacing! But the beds were excellent and everything was spotlessly clean. Full kitchen had dishwasher and massive fridge freezer - useful for the nights we ate in although there were many restaurants within walking distance. Pool isn't large but great for our children 6 and 9 and for cooling off after the parks. Nice quiet location, 10 minute drive to Downtown Disney, the same to Seaworld Breakfast was limited but perfectly adequate

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and spacious at a great price !”
Reviews.Author: livinglarge
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying one night with the entire family. Each time, we checked into a Disney resort concluding our visit.. We secured a AAA rate for a 2-bedroom suite including breakfast. I cannot say enough positives! First of all, the floor plan is great. The two bedrooms are separated by a living area/kitchen AND each bedroom has its own bath. The decor is functional & simple..nothing fancy. The bedding is super soft and plush..very comfortable and the king size space for mom and dad is an added plus. Even though you are right in the busy Lake Buena Vista area (which is convenient), you are tucked off the busy road with a lovely inner courtyard complete with mature palm trees, pool/spa and gazebo type covering for eating outside. It is very relaxing and comforting. The pool already has some floaties to use and an outdoor shower to rinse off. Every Tues - Thurs., there is a manager's reception with free drinks and appetizers. My kids loved how the birds and squirrels would come for treats. My daughter said she felt like Snow White singing in the forest! You simply can't beat the value. I love this place and would recommend it for a budget-minded family. Don't hesitate to stay here..you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I've stayed in recently and a great value.”
Reviews.Author: CorneliaSkinner
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion in Orlando recently and stayed at Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista. We could not have picked a better place. It was exceptionally clean, grounds well maintained, good and generous breakfasts with delicious coffee, large tastefully decorated suites. The shower curtain actually stayed inside the tub! There were plenty of places to gather, including the gazebo in the courtyard. The staff is very accomodating and friendly. Other guests seemed pleasant. One woman told me she had been going there for 12 years and that the same family had owned it all that time. Location was good for restaurants and WDW. This is a low key place, better than most fancier places I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Beargonefishin
Reviews.Content: Booked online short notice and we were skeptical. This hotel was great! Excellent service, great food and drinks on mid-week afternoons. I can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: IowaMV
Reviews.Content: If you travel to Disney with a family, this is a great location. Suites have kitchens and the hotel is across the street (literally) from a full grocery store. Full breakfast provided each day, manager's special light meals provided 4 nights a week... and you are close enough to the grocery to buy what you need for lunches and the remaining 3 dinners. Our room was clean, service was top notch and friendly. Kids loved playing in the pool (as we sipped our free beer from the manager's special), not crowded at all. We found the hotel to be very quiet; the courtyard is a great place to eat meals. Loved just about everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: retired82
Reviews.Content: We arrived March 24 for a short two night stay. There were two couples and we stayed in a two bedroom suite. Everything about this hotel/resort was above average. From the evening Manager's reception to the morning breakfast, nothing could have been more perfect. Our only regret was having to leave to go to another resort for a week. We should have stayed right here. The pool and hot tub were very pleasant. The suites were spacious and very clean and well equiped. The location could not be better to attractions, shopping, Disney and Orlando. Would stay here again in a minute. The General manager was very nice as were all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Room, A++ Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: jkr64064
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite with fully equipped kitchen and it was perfect, very comfortable beds, high quality linens, and toiletries. Comfortable furniture in the living room area. The breakfast & happy hour were much better than we ever expected, fresh fruit & full hot breakfast with MANY choices, attentive staff. Happy hour had beer on tap & red and white wine - dinner items on Tues,Wed,Thurs. Awesome business center. Beautiful courtyard and common areas, large pool and hot tub, great location, about a 10-15 min drive to my conference at Disney. Walgreens right accross the street. The only drawback to this hotel - no elevators, staff very helpful with carrying luggage though! Be sure to request ground floor room in advance if you are unable to do stairs. All of this, for about the same price per night as one small room with limited amenities at Disney. We had a wonderful stay & would return & highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a few problems this time”
Reviews.Author: RavenUnitedStates
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once before and we enjoyed it. This time around even through it was not terrible it was not as pleasant as before. The wireless internet was broke in our room {it was only our room it seemed so just bad luck I guess} they were unable to move us so we had a very unhappy teenager without his computer and I also wanted to use it to check out restaurants and activities, there is one in the lobby but it was in always in use and not as private. Also I decided to sleep in one day being exhausted and I hung the "do not disturb sign" on the door, a workman knocked then before I had a chance to say anything he walked in, I was in bed and very startled he apparently had the wrong room to fix something, he was very apolegetic and nice, he felt badly about disturbing me and left right away but still with the sign on the door they should of called first. Other than that the hotel is pretty nice, a little dated and the bathrooms are cramped and small but still decent and the pool was nice, I did not get the rate I was promised but it was just a little more and being on vacation I did not want to worry about money or extra charges, through I do think in spite of no internet they should of discounted the room, they did not offer, but I did not ask, I thought it would of been a classy thing to do since my kids were really unhappy without it. Not terrible but could of been better, next time thinking of trying something newer, more updated and closer to parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Crazydaisy90
Reviews.Content: After much research and remembering that all reviews are subject to opinions, we chose the Staybridge Suites for our 1-night stay in the area. There were 4 adults, 1 3-year old child. We had a 2-bedroom suite with separate baths, a fully equipped kitchen and living area. We really didn't need that much space for 1 night but wanted to all stay together. Room was clean and spacious. Front desk service was very friendly and attentive. We arrived from the airport earlier than check-in and although our room wasn't ready, they took our cellphone and called us as soon as we could occupy it. The evening "Sundowner" reception was very surprising. Free wine, beer, hamburgs, hots,salad. Breakfast was very good for a hotel buffet. Had hot scrambled eggs, waffles, several juices, sausages, fruits and pastries. Great pool for the 3 year old, nice pool and hot tub. We did have an issue with an odor in our room which was swiftly attended to after we brought it to the front desk staff. We were not inconvenienced as we went to the reception while they took care of the problem. We requested a 3rd floor room. There are no elevators so anyone staying there should be aware of the 3 flights of stairs to climb with luggage or stay on the 1st floor. it is an older hotel and as other reviews have said, the carpets could be either replaced or cleaned. Beds were very comfortable. We all felt it was a great deal for the price and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for family vacation in Orlando/Disney”
Reviews.Author: utting
Reviews.Content: We chose Staybridge Suites after having a positive experience with this chain on our trip to San Diego several years ago. Our family of 4 booked a 6 night stay at the Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista. We booked a 2 bedroom suite, and it provides ample room. The kids (ages 10 and 13) had their own bedroom with TV, and we had a master bedroom with TV. Kitchen/family room is also nice and well equipped. I'll admit that I am a clean freak, and I prefer a very clean hotel. While this hotel is not dirty, it is not new and wear is evident on the carpet, walls, and furnishings. I was OK with it, but it could use an upgrade. I would recommend asking for a 3rd floor room. We were on the 2nd floor. A couple nights we had "noisy" neighbors above us. Sounded like a herd of elephants going in and out the door for a couple hours. Breakfast was also OK. After 5 mornings, I was a bit bored with the offerings. Always plenty to eat though. Go early if you want a table. If you arrive after 8:00 a.m, you are likely to encounter a crowd. Hotel is within 5 minutes of the main entance to Disney. SO CONVENIENT! Lots of restaurants just blocks/minutes from the hotel. Olive Garden, Chili's, Carrabbas, Steak-n-Shake, TGI Fridays, etc. We also used the Winn Dixie grocery store right next to the hotel to stock up on drinks, snacks for evening time. If you are not staying on Disney property, this is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Research pays off”
Reviews.Author: Grizzlykid
Reviews.Content: Reading every review possible and ignoring those I describe as people you can never please, I booked an 8 night stay at Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista. Let me preface my review by simply stating it was AWESOME! I traveled w/ my wife and family, 2 boys ages 10 & 12 and we stayed in "tri-suite" on the third floor overlooking the pool. Having stayed at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter 2 years prior in basically a motel room, the entire family marveled at the size of our room. We had 2 bedrooms, 1 w/ 2 queens for the boys w/ their own bathroom and television, our room w/ a king, bathroom and television and a large living room(also a television) and kitchenette. The room was spotless and updated. In fact, we had to wait a few hours to check in so the rugs that we cleaned that day could dry properly. Our room was made up daily with fresh towels and I believe on our 4th day it was thoroughly cleaned and linens changed. The whole property is beautiful and the perfect size. Its a three story building that surrounds the pool and courtyard. The grounds are impeccable and the staff could not be more friendly or more helpful. I did my homework and spoke with the manager, Melissa, prior to booking. She was upfront and honest stating that the property was not brand new nor was it a five star hotel. I still booked for a variety of reasons; price, location, ammenities , free breakfast and managers happy hours, and the ability to get a suite. The suite was really great. Having the room to get away from the kids and give them their own space made for great relaxation. We had a perfect view of the pool and the courtyard and pretty much let our kids go. There is a small gameroom w/ 2 kid friendly computers w/ internet access. They also supply some pool toys and plenty of lounge chairs and tables. The whole place had a really "safe" feel to it. As far as location, you could not get a more convenient spot. You are literally 5 min. from Downtown Disney and no more than 15 min to any attraction. There are lots of restaurants, many within walking distance as well as a grocery store across the parking lot. I would recommend the Orlando Ale House for food. Big place with lots of T.V.'s , good food, big portions and very reasonable. The hotel has a shuttle but we had a rental car so I can not comment on it. The property is on a service road off a main drag so the road noise was non-existent. The free breakfast was great. I know a lot of reviews say it was repetetive but we found it more than ample. The managers receptions on Tues, Wed and Thurs had beer, wine, hots & burgers and a whole variety of snacks, again all free. We ate outside everyday at an umbrella table and the inside had plenty of seating. The kids could even make their own Belgian waffles. We saved a lot of time and money starting our day with a good meal and in beautiful surroundings. In conclusion, I wish everything I researched so hard came out so good. I would go back in a second and would highly recommend the place to anyone, especially families. Do yourself a favor and go online and get an Orlando Magicard. I think I saved about $60.00 a night and all you have to do is mention it. We traveled 3 nights in the prime season and 5 nights after prime and my total bill was $1340.00 If I had one criticism it would be that the pool was too warm. Thanks to all who wrote honest reviews and to Melissa and all the staff for a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable, well managed, great price”
Reviews.Author: half-Brit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with another couple in a two bedroom, two bath suite with full kitchen (including dishwasher) and large living room. Price was great at only $110 per night. The full breakfast buffet was excellent, the laundry room was spotless, the staff was friendly and efficient. The hotel is just a couple of minutes' walk from a large Winn Dixie grocery store, and you don't have to cross any busy streets. This proved to be very convenient for buying groceries. The hotel service was outstanding! When we checked in, the room was quite warm. We realized the A/C was not working, so called down to the front desk. Within minutes, a maintenance man came by and told us he was going to check the overall A/C system out. In the meantime, the front desk called to see if he had made it up to us yet! The fellow was gone for about 10 minutes, then came back up and told us the system was out of refrigerant and that he had replaced it. He stayed in our room another few minutes until cold air started coming out of the vents, then checked them all to make sure they were okay. During our stay, we needed to receive a hard-copy fax. The front desk was very accommodating and the manager personally handled the receipt of the fax, then sent a return fax when we needed. If we ever return to this area, we will stay here again, no question!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place for a Family Trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Merbst
Reviews.Content: 1) Used this a place to stay when we went on a family trip to Disney with 3 little kids. Room was great, staff was very friendly and helpful and got us everything we needed (e/.g. crib for infant, towels, repair guy) right when we needed it 2) Good location: near the parks, near supermarkets etc 3) very good value for the $ 4) Only one small problem, related to the shuttle service to/from the parks. The evening shuttles return from Disney at odd hours: 6:45 PM, and then nothing until 8:50 PM, and the shuttles are combined with other hotels. This means that if the park closes at 7, you need to catch the 6:45, or you'll be waiting around for 2 hours, which in turn means that you'll be running for the monorail right in the middle of the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Disney area.”
Reviews.Author: LAFScarsdale
Reviews.Content: The two bedroom, two bath set-up was perfect for a couple with a 17-year-old, and did not break the bank. We went during Christmas week, so of course, it was very crowded, particularly at breakfast. But you also have a full kitchen. The pool area was lovely and you can choose to relax there instead of going to a park. Very close to Downtown Disney, which has some fun restaurants. They also have free shuttle bus service to the main Disney parks: Magic Kingdom, Epcot, and Animal Kingdom. Not many other amenities: Fitness "center" was a room with a few machines, breakfast was hot and free but just "OK" in terms of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Disney fun !!! avec clogged toilet+stinky carpets+monotonous breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sribulusu
Reviews.Content: " You get what you pay for !" is rightly said. This place stank ! The carpet was smelling. Wanted to take a shower after a long flight from Canada....guess what :tub was clogged and somethings started to float up from the dark side ! Had it not been for the excitement and the adrenaline rush from all the activites in Disney we would have regretted this trip. BOTTOMlLINE : There are better places out there ! Hope my two cents are worth saving someone from the agony during out stay there. Srini - Ottawa -Canada

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for us..”
Reviews.Author: RoseSayer
Reviews.Content: We are 3 sisters who chose this hotel because we could have a 2 bedroom suite, each of us could have our own bed, plus we wanted a kitchenette. We were very pleased with our choice. Staff was very welcoming, and let us check in several hours early. Our 2 bedroom suite was very clean, although decor is very basic. We did not do a lot of cooking but it was nice to have the 'fridge, stove and microwave. The first night we brought with us a frozen lasagna and ate in...we had a lot of sister-chat to catch up on. We did go to the manager's reception, which had 2 kinds of wine, beer and soft drinks. Website says it has "appetizers" but it is really a lite meal( I thought hot dogs and beans was an odd choice). There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and a grocery store within walking distance. We did not use the pool, but did get in the hot tub one evening;the pool area is very nice. Free breakfast buffet was good, not outstanding, but for the price of the suite ($107 a night ) I would not complain. We did use the free shuttle to Disney and that was very convenient. . A few notes, not complaints: there are three stories and no elevators, so if stairs are a problem for you, you might want to ask for a first floor room,. Also the kitchen was pretty well supplied, except there were no potholders, dishrags, or dishtowels. The living room set -up is not great for tv watching, but there are televisions in each bedroom. All in all I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: nogecko
Reviews.Content: Just home after spending two wonderful weeks at Staybridge Suites. Chose this hotel based on reviews and was not disappointed. The location is spot on - only a 5 minute drive to Disney and 15 - 20 minutes to Universal. What I particularly liked about the location was the fact that you could leave your hotel and walk places, not always having to drive everywhere. There is a Walgreens and Winn Dixie both within a few minutes walk and an abdunance of restaurants also within walking distance. I would highly recommend the Orlando Ale House. We stayed in a two bed suite and with five of us there was plenty of space. One bedroom had a queen size bed ad the other had two doubles. It was great having two bathrooms. Kitchen was well stocked, not that we used it a lot. Suite itself was a little jaded, looked like it was time for a coat of paint and some new furnishings. That said it was clean and had everything we needed - plenty of bedding and towels. Housekeeping came in every day and made beds and brought clean towels and soap, shampoo and shower gel. Dora was our housekeeper and she did a great job. Free breakfast in the morning was great, eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels and a selection of muffins or donuts. Kids especially liked the waffle station. We bought some chococlate syrup and took this down to breakfast with us every day. There are plastic plates and bowls for anyone who wish to take breakfast back to their room. There is a managers sundowner three times per week with complimentary food and beer or wine and sodas. We went one evening for a short time and it seemed to be very good. Business centre with free use of computers came in very handy for hiring car. Pool area was great with plenty of towels and beds. My only complaint was that the water in the pool was too hot - dont really think you need heated pools in Florida heat! First week there we didnt hire a car and took the shuttles to Disney Parks and found the service to be excellent. First 2 nights we rushed from parks after fireworks thinking we would miss bus back to hotel but then realised we had plenty of time, so don't rush they give you sufficient time. Anyone going to Disney for the first time I cannot recommend enough staying for fireworks or parade at the end of the day - it is the icing on the cake. We plan on making a return visit to Staybridge next year so that says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fenwaychef
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two boys up to Orlando in July to see the magic kingdom and the two Disney waterparks. I stumbled on Staybridge online, and it had the best price. we paid 107 a night for four nights. We had an outside, two bedroom suite, the children hooked their game systems up on the Tv in thier room, we watched communal TV in the living room, and if my husband and I wanted to watch something else, we had a TV in our bedroom. I am a priority club member, so we get early check in and late check out on request. I laso earn points for a free stay when I stay there. Breakfast buffet is decent, and free, managers sundown reception has different appetizers every night, the pool are is great, the kids loved the game room, Winn Dixie is next door, Joe's crab shack acroos the stree, Universl and Disney about the same distance away, and we found a road off of Apopka Vinlelnad road called Vista drive, you get into the magic kingdom the back tour bus way, and right after you loop around the speedway, if you take a left towards the parking lot, you miss the parking ticket gate!! we parked at Disney for Free!!! Game room is great for kids, there is even a computer in there for online games. We went back for one night Oct 29th to go to Halloween Horror nights at Universal, got our same room, and the boys walked in like they were home again. We are going back again, this time our stay was only 99 for the night! Fl resident discount, and if you are priority club, they give you choc chip macadamia nut cookies when you check in. Loved having a kitchen for snacks and pizzas, loved private rooms and bathrooms, and when the kids played their games on TV, if you shut their bedroom door, you could barely hear them in the living room. VERY quiet there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tomboofleics
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 3 sons then aged 11, 10 and 6 and I can honestly say it ticks all the boxes. There is a supermarket next door which is handy for getting supplies, although with the complimentary breakfast you don't need that much. This hotel is in a fantastic location. It is very convenient for Disney & Seaworld/Aquatica. It is furthest away from Universal but even that it is easy travelling for. Plenty of restaurants nearby too. Accomodation is comfortable and we had no complaints about although the kitchen could do with an upgrade. However we have booked to go back next Easter so it can't be that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge Is An Excellent Option”
Reviews.Author: Moyses
Reviews.Content: Staybridge is in a very good location for Disney visitors.Close to Disney parks and close to I-4 to go to Universal and Seaworld. IÂ´ve been with my 6,7 and 9 years old granddaughters and we have had a very good stay. Breakfast is good with the self-service waffle option. Childrens love it. My only complaint is that cleaning should be better. As for restaurants in Orlando, I recommend Cheesecake Factory as the best price-performance (at the Millenia Mall), Kobe Japanese Steaks and Black Angus. Oliver Garden and Red Lobster have bad food.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room for the money.”
Reviews.Author: sicemdawgs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites-Lake Buena Vista for three days in October. We originally booked 1 BR King Suite with some free nights I had from the Priority Club through Holiday Inn Express, but they gave us a free upgrade to a 2BR suite upon arrival. Pretty sweet to get upgraded on a free room. Check-in was painless and the front desk staff was very professional and courteous in all our dealings with them. The room was very dated, but seemed clean. The carpet was pretty worn, but didn't seem dingy. The bathrooms were very clean! One BR had two full sized beds, the other had a King; each had its own bathroom. There was a small furnished kitchenette which we didn't use. The breakfast was decent. Nothing spectacular, but it was free and had some nice variety, including freshly made waffles and a different meat each day. On weeknights, there is apparently a free manager's reception with beer, wine and soft drinks, along with some appetizer type things, but we didn't make any of those, either. For you techies: I had trouble staying connected to the wi-fi, but it was free when I could. The rooms are wired for high speed, but I didn't have an ethernet cable. There were three tube tvs in the room, but the picture was pretty poor due to a lousy setup. So if you're coming to Orlando to sit in your room and watch tv, this might not be for you :) Overall, we would stay again. Definitely not the fanciest place around, but for the money, it would be hard to beat if you need the space.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: CampbellConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews from Trip Advisor, we chose this hotel. We have children ranging from 1yr to 15yrs. We also had other family members; my sister and fam, my nephew & fam and my niece and fam. We all had a blast! Our flight was early but we were allowed to use the pool and our luggage was stored until our rooms were ready. We were happily accomodated with rms next to each other. The breakfast was great, something for everyone. The kids loved the pool on the days that we were too tired to leave the property. Hotel was very close to everything we wanted to see; Magic Kingdom, Wet n Wild, Universal Studios & Islands of Adventure. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and convenient for Disney”
Reviews.Author: smudge99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay here, we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was very spacious, the suite was newly painted, bed linen was good, kitchen and carpets a little tired. Overall for what we paid it was great. As we were only here for a week we didn't spend much time in the suite. The staff were all very helpful, the suite was cleaned every day and soap and shampoo was always replaced. Air con was freezing!! no complaints. There was free use of internet in Business centre and games room, important for teenagers. The pool area was good, water very warm and clean, a nice place to relax. there was always a plentiful supply of towels. There was a good choice of food for breakfast both hot and cold. The location was very good for Disney, Seaworld and Universal, nothing was more than 20 mins away. There were several chain restaurants nearby and a Walgreens across the road (take ID if you want to pay by CC). Overall a good stay, would stay again if we ever go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Ok: You get what you pay for- Sept. 09”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_Trip09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week while visiting Disney because we got a good deal on the room. I found yet another example of getting what you pay for...The room was older, smelled bad and was pretty beat-down: the carpet was stained, the cabinets were damaged, and a cockroach greeted me running across the kitchen counter one morning! (Here's a free tip: don't try to put a can of soda in the top shelf of the fridge- when you try to close the door the temp knob will puncture the can and cause it to spray soda all over!!) On the bright side, the room is plenty large for the average family. The free breakfast was ok, nothing special. The fitness room is a large closet with 1 treadmill and 2 exercise bikes. The pool is ok, again nothing special. The location isn't bad, you're about 5-6 miles from the Disney parks. Overall, it wasn't a horrible experience... it's ok if you're on a budget, but I think there are much better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dudeandlu
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent! The rooms were very clean and spacious. Everyone on the staff was very pleasant and Anthony was so kind as to upgrade our room when one became available. The breakfast buffet was an added bonus. We loved this place so much we are planning on returning year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kymmerh
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Disney World without staying on Disney property and I don't think I could have asked for a more comfortable and pleasant stay for a family of four. We stayed here for seven nights and the location to all the Disney parks is perfect - just a mile up the road from Downtown Disney and the same road will take you to all the parks in minutes. You can take the complimentary shuttle bus from the hotel, which we did one day and it was fine, I prefer not to have to worry about the bus schedule. There are a variety of restaurants and stores right accross the street. This is an excellent location! We reserved a two bedroom king suite, which was more than comfortable for two adults and two kids (11 & 14) for the same price we would have paid for a moderate room on Disney property. The boys had their own room with their own beds, bathroom and TV and we had our own room, bathroom and TV. The living room was comfortable with a sofa bed (if you need it), lounge chair, TV with DVD and VCR player. The fully equiped kitchen and dining area were perfect for our needs and there is free internet service in each room. The room was very clean and housekeeping came in every day to make beds and replace towels and soaps. They come in every third day for a full cleaning. The one thing I would recommend is trying to get a first floor room if you have a lot of luggage because there are 3 levels and no elevators so you have to carry your luggage up yourself. We requested a first level pool view room, which was a great location for the kids, but if you prefer peace and quiet, stay away from the pool side of the hotel - it can get a bit busy at times. The hotel has an arcade, with computer, a laundry room, business center with computers, gym and a library. The pool was very nice with a toddler pool, full size pool and a jacuzzi with fresh towels always available. The staff was very friendly and accomodating to any of our needs. The complimentary breakfast each morning was great, with a wide variety of breakfast foods and drinks for just about anyones taste. There is an evening reception with free food and drinks three nights a week. This benefit alone saved us a lot of money each day in meals and you are welcome to eat there or bring the food back to your room. I found the grounds to be very nice and relaxing with plenty of plants and places to sit an talk. I was a bit nervous about what I was walking into after reading some of the reviews here, but for the money, I could not have asked for a nicer place to stay for this trip and would definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsbz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites from 8/21/09 to 8/28/09 and while I must admit that the decor is getting "tired", the staff, location and comfort remain extraordinary. The breakfast every morning is very well laid out and delicious and there are "managers receptions" 3 nights a week as well that you could call "dinner". With a little facelift here and there, the hotel would be back to perfect in no time. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: tcbtcb08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here a couple of times a year. We come down from Jacksonville to relax a few days and enjoy the city. The room rates are really good right now. In the past these rooms have ran about $150.00 a night. You can get them for about $75.00 right now. The staff here is great. The hotel is really great for the money. Very nice pool area and large.
