Now this is 'Orlando' and full of tourest and kids and so is the hotel. But the good thing is they leave about 9 a.m. for the parks and don't return until late. So you almost have the pool to yourself if you want to relax at the hotel. The buffet breakfast is good. It comes with the price of the room and you should find something on it to start your day. The only problem I encouter is when they have scrambled eggs, I wish they would cook them more. The cook must like runny eggs, I don't. Now the rooms are starting to show some wear but they are kept clean and room service does a good job. Unless you want to pay a lot more to stay in a 5 Star Hotel stay here. Well worth the money. It's a great exit and has a number of restaurants on the block that you can walk to. Tip of the stay: If you want to avoid a crowd at breakfast eat between 7:30-8:00 a.m. or at 9:30 a.m. And if you encouter any problem just talk to the management that will gladly take care of you. Enjoy your stay, we do!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel - has everything you would want.”
Reviews.Author: LesleyDublin
Reviews.Content: We are just back having stayed in a 2 bedroomed suite for 12 nights. It was just perfect as far as we were concerned. There are 2 large bedrooms, one with a kingsize bed and the other with 2 doubles. There is also a sofa bed. We have 3 teenage children and had plenty of room. There are 2 bathrooms, 2 hairdryers, 3 tvs, a roomsafe, an iron and ironing board and a kitchen with a full size cooker, huge fridge and microwave. There is free internet access in the suite. We brought our laptop and the kids were able to go on MSN, BEBo etc. Our suite was spotless. There were fresh towels and beds made every day. There was bath soap, face soap and shampoo renewed every day. I thought the furnishings were lovely. There is a kitchen table also. Normally our kids fight on hols if we are in a small living area but there were no arguments at all what with the 3 tvs and the internet access. There is a courtesy bus to the Disney parks - we were given the schedule when we checked in. The breakfast has a good choice. They have paper plates for people who want to take away the breakfast. A few days when the kids slept late we brought up cereal and pastries to the room for them which was very handy. The pool area was lovely, a big pool, a small for toddlers and a jacuzzi. There are loads of loungers and plenty of fresh towels at the pool for everyone. The hotel is literally a two minute drive from Disney World. A tip when you're coming out of the Disney Parks - head for the Downtown Disney area and that road takes you out to the exit near the hotel. For Universal take a left onto Apopka Vineland Ave (outside the hotel) and then the next left up Palm Parkway. This road becomes Turkey Lake Road and there is an entrance to Universal on that road. There is also a Walmarts on Turkey Lake Road, but there is a Walgreens just outside the hotel. There are loads of restaurants just outside also. I can highly recommend the Pizza Hut just around the Corner on Palm Parkway, the food is great, very cheap and the staff are lovely. There is also a great takeaway pizza place - there is a card on the worktop. We go abroad every year mainly to the States as my husband works for an airline. With 3 teenagers we are classed as 5 adults so accommodation is always expensive but we try to get it for a reasonable rate. We got a special on this hotel as they were giving a one bedroomed suite for the price of a two offer when we were enquiring. We also booked the Disney tickets. A tip - the difference between a 3 day and 5 day Disney pass is only 10 dollars in total - 5 dollars per day so it's worth getting the 5 day one. With Universal when we were buying a 2 day pass at the park they offered us a pass for a week for an extra 5 dollars each so we took that as well! Entry to Disney and Universal is by card (ticket) and fingerprint so don't mix up the tickets or they won't match with your fingerprints when you enter. For anyone new to Disney the hopper pass means you can go between the parks and Disney have courtesy buses that go park to park all day. If you are shopping what used to be the Belz Mall is now the Orlando Prime Outlets. It's good. There are other outlets - Orlando Premium Outlets - we found them expensive. There are small outlets a short drive from the hotel - Lake Buena Vista outlets and we found them pretty good. In summary I can highly recommend this hotel. It's got everything you need in it and also it's in a great location for everything. The area is safe and also the hotel is very quiet. I can honestly say that we loved it. The hotel was recommended to me by a friend who stayed there in June and I would recommend it to anyone going to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Was About It !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomgna13
Reviews.Content: This was our experience. With the pictures on their website we thought we would pull up to something MUCH nicer. Check in was fine and the man was quite nice. We even received a bag of cookies. Upon walking to our room we noticed the landscaping and pool area not to be anything like the pictures. It was in dire need of attention. Upon entering our room we were SHOCKED. The rugs were dirty, the furniture is old and dirty and in poor condition. The baseboard molding had tons of dust on it. It grossed us out. The overall appearance of the inside of the room is poor. Clogged sinks, leaky toilet, dirty conditions in shower area. The maid service is terrible. They barely clean the rooms before you check in and while we stayed there for three days our beds weren't made until after 5:00 in the afternoon and towels, facecloths and bath mats were taken but not replenished. Why???? They only give you shampoo and a bar of soap. The water is hard so a conditioner is a must. We had to go to Walgreens across the street to purchase some. Also bring your own lotion and dirty laundry bag because you don't get those either. We also had a room where they stored their garbage bags throughout the day outside our door. It smelled great in the 90 degree heat. We never used the pool because it was always overcrowded and we were afraid of catching something. We have stayed at many hotels with our 3 children before. NEVER have we stayed at one so poorly taken care of or so neglected with such POOR room service. The best perk of this hotel is that it is within a 10 minute or so drive to most disney resorts and parks. We also enjoyed the all you can eat breakfast buffet. Many choices, delicious and it was nice and hot. The employees for the food area were nice and polite. So our review to you is....if you are looking for a great breakfast stay here. If you are looking for a nice room stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Much Needed Space after so much togetherness!”
Reviews.Author: Griswalds2251
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our softball team, 9 families. We all had 2 bedroom suites. These rooms were very accomadating. King in one two queens in other with living room and kitchen. Three TVs and two full baths with good closet space. The only slight negative was the carpets were older with stains. This property has nice pool area and breakfast buffet with waffle station, cereal, breads, eggs and meat every AM. As far as niceness... its moderate...holdiay inn style..but very good value for your money and one red light away from main disney road. Several eating places within walking distance like Chilis mac grill, chinese, joes crab shack. Not a bad choice at all.

Reviews.Title: “overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: MandMSwansea
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic 2 week holiday here in mach to celebrate my birthday,reception staff really helpful and welcoming. Regular shuttles to disney and there parks but as we had a hire car we choose after the 2nd day to use this instead. We had 2 separate suites, my parents had a 1 bed us having a 2 bed. They were both spacious and clean,1st week we had our house keeping done every day 2nd week was a little hit or miss. House keeping staff appeared not to speak any english,but when you asked for something at reception it was no problem for them to supply what was asked for. Sundowner was an added extra 3 times a week,some we managed to make,there was wine or beer supplied free of charge. There are no bars near but you can have just a drink in the italian just across the way(giodanni's i think it was called) food also good as we sampled this too.Walgreens just across the road and win dixie just behind. Pool was great after a long day in the parks aswell as have plunge pool,all towels were supplied. We used the laundry and we found that help full if you'd been to the water parks as you could rinse and dry your swimming things. Add gem was the free internet so you can email home to family,friends and of course check you emails. Buffet breakfast was a must in the morning and you could take it back to your room if you wished,waffle machine our son thought was great,i'm suprised he didn't look like one by the time we left. There is a safe for your valuables in every room and would highly recommend that you use this especially if your have any medication with you,as it costs a fortune to get it replaced if your from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean/Friendly/Great Location/Good incl. Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: h0ls13
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with all you could ask for after long day at parks. Very close to all parks at most 10-15min drive. Very good buffet breakfast to start day. Nice bonus of 3 nights a week with food and drink included if you dont want to go out. Very clean rooms with maid service every day including new towels. The beds were big and comfortable and good air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: hotelman23
Reviews.Content: As stated in the other reviews. Location and breakfast was great. Although rooms were clean they needed some TLC. Very friendly staff and pool was a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Staybridge Suites that I've ever been to. Some are very nice but this isn't one of them. It's obvious that they have updated some things but not others and it's the things that have not been updated that were really bothersome. Maybe other travelers had better rooms than I but I cannot believe that anyone would give this hotel a good rating. The carpet, bedspread, sofa, and kitchen stool were all dirty and stained. The kitchen appliances have been updated but not the cabinets and those cabinets are horrible. They are worn, appear dirty whether they are or not, scratched and I'm guessing that they were likely installed in the 1980s. The same is true for the bedroom furniture - terrible condition. The bathroom (toilet and tub) area is very small and looks like it's never thoroughly cleaned as you can see dirt, debris and mold in the corners (I took photos to back this up). I had to kill a cockroach in the bathroom on one night, something that I have NEVER had to deal with in any hotel at any other time. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACHES!!! SMELLS!!”
Reviews.Author: Harold1234
Reviews.Content: The person checking us in was nice, BUT THE ROOM HAD COCKROACHES!!!!! and it smelled musty. We did not stay. We check out immediately. The internet pictures are very misleading because the pictures look really nice, but as soon as you pull up to the building, you can see it does not look as nice as the internet pictures.

Reviews.Title: “No issues at all, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDieppe
Reviews.Content: We just finished staying there for 9 nights with out 8 year old daughter. This is a great place, no issues at all, lots of room. Keep in mind, this isn't super luxury, but everything is fine and the rate is very good. The breakfast looks good, although we prefered doing our own. 3 nights a week, they have a sundowner which includes food, soda, wine and beer, all no charge. What we probably liked the best was the fact that it's really close to everything. I could litteraly walk to the Winn-Dixie and back with 4 bags of groceries, it's THAT close. (I used the car, but I could have walked! Ha...) There is a Walgreens right accross the street and many restaurants nearby. Sea World and Disney Parks are maybe 10mins away. Close enough that on a few occasions, we left the park around lunch, grabbed lunch at the hotel, then went back to another park after a rest. The pool area is ok. Nothing fancy, but clean, nice, no issues. They supply pool toys for the kids. We did get room service everyday (I think if you stay 7 days or more, you get daily, if not, it's as required). We did have to purchase dishcloths and perhaps more dishwasher detergent if we wanted to run it daily. But these are really no big deal. We had a 2nd floor suite (there are 3 floors) and for the first few nights, I think we had a family upstairs of us that were playing Wii like all night. Anyhow, I would suggest perhaps a top floor room if you really want to avoid issues like this.

Reviews.Title: “LOADS OF ROOM BUT BRING YOUR OWN TOILETRIES!”
Reviews.Author: spike90
Reviews.Content: I, along with my elderly parents and 11 year old stayed here for 4 nights during our visit to Orlando. The hotel is very roomy and is great for multiple families with seperate bedroom suites. The beds are very comfortable, the staff is very friendly and this hotel has an awesome full breakfast buffet. Although this place is great for the money and is like have a little apartment, there are downfalls. They do not really supply toiletries. The give each bedroom one bar of soap for the sink and one for the shower and one bottle of shampoo (for the entire stay). There is not new soap or shampoo brought daily. There is not conditioner, lotion, mouthmast......nothing. Just a bar of soap and a shampoo. Luckily there is a Walgreens across the street to get these items. They do not bring fresh towels daily unless you call down to the front desk and order them. Usually a hotel will have sign throughout the room saying to hang the towels up to keep them or put them on the floor to have them replaced. This hotel takes them all (used or not) and does not replace them. After calling the front desk everyday for towels were got to know our housekeeping lady very well. She was extremly friendly and would always apologize when bringing the towels up. She did speak English but didn't seem to understand it, but she was trying. The beds were made up the first night and that was it. She did come in on our last day to vacuum. This hotel needs to improve on their toiletries and on having rooms done daily. We also got to know the maintenance man as one of the vanity lights needed replaced due to a shortage of something. He was also very friendly and fixed it right up. I would stay here again in a heatbeat but would need to bring extra soap and lotion and call the front desk every day asking for beds to be made and fresh towels. It was worth the money as we had a great rate for a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite for $120 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Your smile starts here”
Reviews.Author: TravelCritic98
Reviews.Content: Before venturing off to Disney and other area attractions during the past four days we always had happy thoughts and a smile, primarily due to the hotel staff and facilities. Great job by ALL. While not perfect, it is one of the best overall hotels I've stayed in (business requires 150+ nights / yr. globally). 2 bedroom is spacious and properly appointed with everything working. Carpet is a bit tired, but walls and amenities in excellent condition. We have 2 girls 11 yrs old and everyone had what they needed without stepping on others. Great breakfast and sundowners.Stay this good and you'll always be booked!!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard accomodation near Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: Tortoise2202
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June for 2 weeks with kids aged 16, 13 and 11. Good solid apartment by which I mean you cant hear noise from neighbours. Not a wow in decoration but rooms are spacious. We had a 2 bed suite. King size bed and two large singles and double sofa bed. 3 TVs which kept everyone happy. Dishwasher, full cooker, microwave. Maid service each day. Good complimentary breakfast each day. Shuttle buses to Disney parks. We didn't have a car and decided after we booked that Universal parks were more suited to us so we had to get taxis to the Premium Outlets shopping centre where we hopped on the I-Ride shuttle. Service in Staybridge very good but some staff a bit gloomy! There is no bar but 3 nights a week they have free foods and drinks (inc beer) for a few hours. We would come back again but would book Staybridge on International Drive instead if we weren't hiring a car and all the attractions are very accessible from I-Drive and the I-Ride shuttle. the shuttle costs 1.25 per adult irrespective of the length of journey.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hunwolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while visiting Orlando with family. The hotel has an excellent location near Downtown Disney and near many decent restaurants. However...unlike a lot of hotels in Lake Buena Vista you're far enough off the main road to not get a lot of night traffic/noise. We had a one bedroom suite with sofa bed which was plenty big for 3 people. The hotel has nice amenities with a fairly large pool and decent hot tub/spa. Laundry facilities are fairly large as is the workout/exercise room. The breakfast area also offers a decent variety include a rotation of meats (bacon/ham/sausage), eggs, omelets, and a waffle station. They also have sodas and chocolate milk along with an evening "happy hour" during the week. The rooms and facilities were all very clean...especially considering the volume of people they move through there.

Reviews.Title: “nice one!”
Reviews.Author: jubious
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - staff very friendly. Stayed in a 2 bed suite which was very spacious, although was a little 'tired' in places. Handy having the facilities of a kitchen. Breakfast was great and set us up for the day - including the waffle station! Perfect location, and good choice of restarants nearby. Overall would recommend highly - perfect for kids and couples alike!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: chilloutgirl
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay. Suites very roomy and clean. Selection at breakfast very good and loved the waffles!! Pool always clean and open from 9am - 11pm. Loved the morning when mummy duck took her ducklings for a swim in the pool!!!! We did not have a car but there were plenty of resturants in easy walking distance. Loved the Sundowner meals and drinks - What a good idea. Overall a really good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. Super rooms, great pool, awesome breakfast. Best Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilove2teach
Reviews.Content: We traveled from the midwest to Orlando with a group of high school seniors on their end of the year trip. This place was just perfect for us. The rooms were spacious, had a bathroom for each room and we were in our own little area--a great getaway. The hot continental breakfast was one of the best --had a nice variety and lots of hot items. The poool and hottub were wonderful. Location was great. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Thanks so much for making our trip a huge success.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay to be near Disney”
Reviews.Author: ps01273
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very handy for Disney and for restaurants within easy walking distance. The rooms were very clean and spacious, great to have a well equipped kitchen, we ate in one night after a long day at Epcot and really appreciated it. The pool is great, very busy in the late afternoon, but lovely early morning. Good breakfast as it is free, plenty of choice, coffee not so good!!! Winn Dixie nearby, and several restaurants, including a Sizzler and Olive Garden. Beds very comfortable, three tv's in two bedroom suite. Disney is an easy drive and so are plenty of shops, we loved Mall at the Millenia, really good stores and sales were on, so good for bargains. All in all would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Suite are better than just an Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMERYWales
Reviews.Content: its was the best the Staff were so friendly everything that was require was done ASAP Our Suite has 2 Bathrooms with a Full size Kitchen & lounge but the Hotel had the breakfast all for the same price the suite was cleaned every day et Bed Made and full change every 3 days we are going again next year

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: jbaker2858
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting the Disney Parks. I was a little disappointed in the overall condition of this Staybridge compared to others I have stayed at in the past. This is a very large hotel for Staybridge standards and loses some of the attractiveness and advantages associated with the Staybridge chain. Our room looked a little worn, carpet, title, bathroom area... It is definitely time for an upgrade, new TVs, counter tops, beds, and bathroom fixtures. The pool was by far the best feature of this hotel and gets an A+ for being kid friendly, lots of floats and toys for kids of all ages plus a lot of chairs and recliners for the adults. Overall for the price I think you can find better accommodations at other suite type hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly return”
Reviews.Author: DoriMontreal_Quebec
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Orlando for 2 days to catch a cruise from Port Canaveral. This place was great. Very friendly staff. Very conveniently located. Very clean premises. I was very impressed over the breakfast which was included. My teenage kids enjoyed the place, with access to a computer and game room. Self serve laundry was also convenient, but a little expense. Costed $8.00 to wash and dry one load and when cycle of dryer was finished, clothes were not dry. Cleaning staff was a little slow to clean rooms, but hey, we're on vacation, no stress. If I ever visit Orlando again, I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyable!!”
Reviews.Author: brad2103
Reviews.Content: We spent thirteen nights at the Staybridge Suites and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a quiet location, but still has shops, food outlets etc. within a couple of minutes walk. The rooms themselves were well equipped, nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. The complimentary breakfast each morning was delicious and plentiful no matter how late you got there! The buisiness centre, library and pool meant that you could easily amuse your self on any day you didn't fancy going anywhere. The only thing the hotel does not have is a lift, as the suites are spread over three floors and six blocks, it is not easy carrying all your luggage up three flights of stairs especially if you have small children or are elderly/disabled. However, the hotel are happy to accommodate you on the ground floor, but remember to request this when you book. All in all a great place to stay and I have no hesitation in reccommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here and loved it again”
Reviews.Author: Jaramy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Jan. 23 - 29 2009 and had a great time! The place was a bit old and needed some upgrades but overall my husband and I liked it. We had a one bedroom suite on the 3rd floor. It was clean and the bed was comfy. The kitchen had a couple cracked dishes and was missing a frying pan, both of which we told the front desk about and was fixed the same day. The layout of the living room was a bit odd but we made it work. The pool and hot tub were very nice. The free buffet breakfast was ok too! There was a slight change in what they served from day to day. They even had chocolate milk! That's big on my breakfast list. The business centre was helpful and they even had a DVD rental unit. The hotel is located near the main entrance to the Disney parks and and the I-4 was close. There was a major grocery store (Wynn-Dixie) right next door, a Walgreens also across the street and lots of restaurants within walking distance too. A great one called the Macaroni Grill and Denny's and IHOP close by. And don't forget Papa John's pizza next door! A Walmart Supercentre is about a 5 minute drive away. I always felt safe at the hotel at night. The shuttle to the Disney parks was very convenient and free - much better than having to pay $11 at each park. You can also buy your park tickets at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great people”
Reviews.Author: onepumpkinpie
Reviews.Content: This place pretty much suits everybody. The suites were excellent, clean, comfortable, TV in every room, WIFI, kitchens etc etc etc.... The pool was great and clean. Breakfast was nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Oh, and the location is spot on and very central - loads of restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacies, nail bar etc within walking distance. Great value for money - we'll be back! PS: Lots of wildlife in the ponds in front of the property - spotted otters and many different kinds of big birds!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable convenient family accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 8EDaze
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a 2 bdrm suite with other family members staying in a one bedroom in August 2008..We had to leave the kids with our family here for five days to attend a business conference. This involved some room juggling that the hotel handled easily. I chose this hotel because I wanted something easily accessible to the Disney parks with or without a car, yet not right on site and totally immersed in Disney 24/7. I thought this would be a bit much (not to mention expensive) after 10 days. The Staybridge suites fitted the bill perfectly. The 2 bedrm/2bathroom (3 TV) suite was spacious enough that we could spread out during the down times back at the hotel. The kitchen facilities meant that we didn't have to go out for every meal. The breakfast was basic but adequate - the kids especially liked the waffle station. I also appreciated having the laundry - vital to have this during our month-long trip to the US. The room wasn't flashy(nor did I expect it to be), but I thought it was pleasantly and comfortably decorated. The Winn Dixie supermarket is just across the road, and a number of other convenience stores and restaurants are within easy walking distance. Our family was without a car for a few days so this was important. They used the shuttle bus to the parks. I gather these got crowded at times, but again were very convenient if you don't have a car. The business centre was handy because we had to change our flights. The pool area was attractive and the kids enjoyed a swim. Our room was one floor up and faced out toward the parking area. Not much of a view, but noise wasn't an issue. I thought it was good value and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not for us”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghBeamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the beginning of December for 9 nights. Clean room, beds were comfortable, the breakfast buffet was your average daily breakfast food; but if you didn't get to the buffet early enough the eggs tended to be cold and runny and they never seemed to have enough hot chocolate packages. Although the hotel staff seemed nice & friendly, it came across as being forced as being part of their job and lacking sincerity. Kids seem to enjoy the heated pool in the evening and the pool area was well stocked with clean towels & well kept. The layout of the room felt cramped and kids had to go thru the master bedroom to get to the bathroom. The bathroom itself was very tiny, I had to have my child step into the bathtub for me to come in and help her dry off after swimming. The sink area was in a separate from the toilet & shower. This was our first stay at this hotel, but we probably won't come back. We like the layout of other hotel/suites a bit better. The atmosphere of the hotel didn't seem as friendly and jovial as staying on Disney property or the other hotels where we have stayed. Not just in Orlando, but other hotels elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at Staybridge Lake Bunea Vista”
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvania1
Reviews.Content: We were here the first week of December 2008 for five nights. We had a 1-bedroom suite on the 3rd floor of Bldg #17 facing the pool area. The hotel's location is absolutely ideal for visiting Disney World. It takes no more than 15-20 minutes to get to/from any of the Disney parks by car in the morning or when returning even at rush hour. There is a Winn-Dixie (one of the better ones we have shopped at in Florida) supermarket and 24-hour Walgreens across the street plus numerous stores, eating places, etc., within a 1/4 mile. I found that if you are driving a car with a GPS don't follow the Disney direction signs on I4, follow the GPS's directions, it will save you time and distance. I won't re-hash the previous reviews here as they are fairly accurate regarding the room conditions (some to moderate wear and tear and disrepair), the staff (very friendly), and the food (a bit limited in breakfast selections but OK otherwise, the evening receptions were a bit disappointing but at least there is free wine and beer). There was a large gap under the room's door which allowed plant debris from the courtyard to blow in under the door. There are at least 50 cable TV channels to watch including the local Weather Channel feed which should keep kids entertained when not out. If you don't want to listen to little (and big) kids screaming in the pool until 11PM every night, request a room facing the outsides of the buidlings or one overlooking the west-side courtyard. They said we would have to move twice if we wanted a different room when we discovered the noise at 9 PM on the first night. The heating/cooling system is a residential-type split system with the compressor/condenser unit outside so it is quiet in the room when running compared to the integrated systems found at many extended stay hotels. They have two free PC's with a printer in their Business Center and signs clearly state they are for use by guests over 18 years old. Thus you don't have kids hogging them all day and night. They also have both wireless and wired free high speed internet connections in all the rooms. The rates here were cheaper than the Residence Inn Lake Bunea Vista, which is about 1 mile due east. Our rate for 2 people was $106 plus tax versus $139 at the RI.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get away”
Reviews.Author: jas_zone
Reviews.Content: The location was close to all of the attractions we wanted to visit. Food was easy as most days we ate the complimentary breakfast at the hotel, ate snacks at the parks and cooked dinner in our room at the hotel in the evenings; the kitchen was big enough to cook for our family of six. We had a two bedroom with sofa sleeper and it worked out great. The staff at the hotel was friendly and had great local knowledge, they always responded quickly to any need we had and we felt welcome. The cardio facility was great for a morning tune up and the heated pool was a nice place for the kids to unwind as we did some laundry in the complimentary washers and dryers. I also took advantage of the free wireless internet and found the service to be fast and had no issues. We would definitely pick this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple clean suite style resort.”
Reviews.Author: DougieDaddy
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night there this past weekend (11/22/08) and found the hotel to be very comfortable. For a suite, it was one of the smaller ones we have had (may have been due to the corner location we had (Room 31)), but we found the room clean and comfortable. I'm not sure what some reviewers are talking about when they call the rooms "dated." I suppose that some people must believe that hotels need to remodeled every couple of years or something. The entire hotel itself cannot be more than 10 years old, and the room we had was fine. Yes it had a couple of signs of use, but lets get real, this isn't an expensive hotel. If you want perfect you will be spending $300+ these days, and even then you can be dissapointed. The courtyard and pool areas are very-very nice. The breakfast buffet was clean and had a good selection of breakfast items. They even have a rather large laundy area (not that we used it, but would come in handy if you were staying longer). Every staff member we encountered was friendly, and made us feel welcome and appreciated (which seems to be hard to come by these days with some hotels). The only small ding I will give our room was that the AC system did need the coils and ductwork cleaned. Some other reviewers did mension this, and our room AC did have noticable dust on the vents and a musty smell when we fired it up for a couple of hours when we arrived. Thankfully we didn't have to run it much due to it being a cool weekend in Orlando. So if anyone from this resort's management reads this, please clean those things, because that simple thing makes a clean room feel not-so clean.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy Suite; Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wsflyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a 2-bedroom suite. Our daughters were happy because the 2nd bedroom had 2 double beds: one for each girl. The suite was clean and very roomy. The appliances included a stove, oven, dishwasher, microwave--everything we needed to cook a few meals. The breakfast was quite good--a bit repetitive over several days, but there are plenty of options. The pool is heated enough to be comfortable (at least in late Oct, early Nov.) and the hot tub was soothing. The location is very convenient for all Disney parks. We would definitely recommend the Staybridge Lake Buena Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at hotel”
Reviews.Author: NittanyLionFan
Reviews.Content: We booked the Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista for a 4-night stay as part of a vacation package with Southwest Airlines Vacations. Check-in was quick and efficient. The room was a 1-bedroom suite with full kitchen (stove, oven, microwave, full-size refrigerator and dishwasher). The level of cleanliness at check-in was reasonable but certainly not impeccable (e.g. some food stains on the side of the fridge). It would have been nice if they had provided some spray cleaner with which to clean up after the previous guests as well as after ourselves. I cannot emphasize how convenient it was to have the full kitchen when staying with our 2 boys (ages 4 and 5). Pizza was an inexpensive dinner and often, the leftovers made an excellent late-night snack. A quick trip to the local Winn-Dixie (across the street) and our fridge was well-stocked with chocolate milk and bottled water, as well. Because of all the food we had in our suite, we did not utilize the breakfast as much as we would have otherwise. It did seem to contain all the staples: coffee, oatmeal, cold cereal, waffles, eggs, yogurt, juices, fruit and some type of meat (ham, bacon, sausage). Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a place for families. The price is right, the location is convenient to Disney parks (10-15 minutes) as well as Universal Studios (15-20 minutes on I-4), and the suite setup allows for a little more room and privacy than a standard hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “generally OK, large room”
Reviews.Author: RachelIsrael
Reviews.Content: The suite is spacious - we had 1 king, 2 queen. Kitchenette OK, not more. The maid does not clear the dishes. Good loaction to all Disney Parks, orlando downtown and shopping malls. There is a nice Supermarket just across the street. The hotel front desk has plenty of informative handouts with driving directions. The big disadvantage is that because of Orlando weather and humidity the room smelled bad like some laundry that stayed too long in the washing machine.. breakfast was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: gardengirl05
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay and could not have been more pleased with our visit. Check in/check out was fast and friendly, our room was clean and the perfect size for our family of 5. We booked the 2 bdrm/2 bath suite directly by phone and asked for the Magicard rate. This saved us around $40 per night, so keep that in mind if you decide to book. You cannot get the Magicard rate by Internet. The pool area was a decent size and never seemed crowded. There are some inflatable pool toys for the kids to play with, and plenty of lounge chairs and tables. Breakfast was a good variety of hot and cold items, coffee, sodas, juice, fruit, and so forth. There are also several restaurants within a 5 minute walking distance. Across the street you will find Sizzlers, Steak-n-shake, Giordanos, etc. And behind the hotel (another 5 minute walk) there is a Papa John's pizza, an ice cream shop, and a Winn Dixie grocery store which is perfect for buying bottled water and other necessities. We used the free shuttle service to the parks for both pick up and return. The bus was very comfortable and stops at all 4 Disney parks. You will receive a shuttle schedule upon check in. Make sure you are at the bus stop at least 5 minutes before pick up. The bus comes on time (sometimes a couple minutes early) and it will not wait for you. It picks up whoever is there and takes off without waiting 5 or 10 minutes, etc. So if you're not there, you will be left behind. A word of advice about return times. The Animal Kingdom closed at 5:00 and the bus didn't arrive until 6:15, so for an hour we basically stood in the parking lot waiting. With the Magic Kingdom, the park closed at 9:00 with fireworks ending between 9:15 - 9:20. The bus pickup was at 9:30, so this left little time to get to the parking lot. We were literally running to get there. ( After a long day and tired feet, this was quite painful!) So if you use the shuttle for the return trip from the Magic Kingdom, make sure you are near the front gate when the fireworks are presented and then make a beeline to the monorail as soon as they are over. Skip the express monorail! Everyone goes there and you will end up in a line. Go straight to the resort monorail and you will get right on. The 2nd stop is the TTC and that is where you will find the bus. If you don't do this, you will most likely end up in a Taxi instead of the bus. Downtown Disney is less than 10 minutes away but it is not within walking distance. We took a cab for $12 each way. The hotel lobby will call a taxi for you so you don't have to arrange that yourself. When you're ready to leave for the return trip, you will find many taxis waiting outside the Marketplace and West Side so it is easy to get a ride with no problem. Overall our family enjoyed our stay at this hotel and we will certainly book it again if we return to the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: Adir0ndack
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed based on excellent location. On a business trip but got in a trip to Epcot and Downtown Disney. Great location and decent shuttle service to Disney. Good hot breakfast and nice staff. Just disappointed that it needed updating. Cabinets in kitchen were sticky and dirty but rest of property was clean. Light switch plates needed cleaning. OK for a night but wouldn't want to take my family there for extended stay using cooking facilities. Icky, sticky. Corners of rugs in bathroom area black. They seem to just surface clean to make it appear acceptable. Clean this stuff up and you will have a really nice property with a great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Was Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegal74
Reviews.Content: If you are a couple or single traveler stay away! My boyfriend booked this room, looking at the numerous positive reviews but failed to see it is not recommended for couples. The place is substandard, and I am surprised at all the rave reviews. It is a Holiday Inn property, so keep that in mind. When we first checked in, there were left over belongings from the prior guests, tv remote and wall clock did not work. We requested room service not clean our room the next day and not only did the maid knock on our door the next morning, the maid proceeded to enter without waiting for a reply. PROS: Large rooms, hot tub, nice pool, buffet breakfast CONS: average service, cheap decor, tiny bathroom, no interior room access or elevator (only exterior outside stairs room access). Not really as close to the parks as they say - 1.4 mile away. Shuttle stops running earlier. Bottom Line: If you only plan on sleeping here and have kids, then this might be the place for you...But if your accustomed to quality or service, you will NOT find it here!

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: froggy8997
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in September. This hotel is nice but OLD! ROOMS: The rooms are clean, but kind of outdated!! They tried to mask the fact that this place is old by putting new bedding and updated paint colors on the walls, but the Kitchen and bathrooms are showing definate age. The bathtub was old and the faucets were corroded. The towels were thin and not top quality. The kitchen cabinets were very old. The garbage disposal was right out in the open under the sink.... nothng even anything covering it. Our carpet was wet, due to the fact that they had just cleaned it prior to our arrival, so we had to wear shoes or our feet got soaked. NO ELEVATORS POOL: The pool was nice and it was clean. But the tiles around the jacuzzi were starting to flake. I'm not sure if it was paint or tile finish flaking away, but it was unattractive. Pool seemed warm and Jacuzzi was HOT! The courtyard in the very center of te hotel made for a great ambiance. very relaxing. BREAKFAST: I will say that the Breakfast was Good. Alot of variety and probably the biggest and best "free" breakfast I have ever incountered at any hotel I have stayed at. I did notice, and no offense, there were many Europeans staying at this hotel. Their standards are very different from American standards, they tend to vacation much longer then Americans, therefore they like this type of "apartment" hotel. Its just an Okay hotel, the location is great. But there are many other Hotels in the area that are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place, Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: junepearle
Reviews.Content: WE WENT WITH our son and family,for 4 days, it rained soooooo much with the tropical storm, but we made the most of it,nearly ALL the kids there, were in the pool rain or not, the hotel wasGREAT we had a 2 bedroom suite, kitchen, small living room, a king bed for nana and poppa with bathroom and tv, our son and wife and 2 kids had bedroom with 2 queen beds and tv, and bathroom, there was a tv in the living room also, the towels were so nice and clean and soft, and the beds clean comfortable, i should mention i am the MOST fussiest person when it comes to hotels, i HAVE to feel VERY comfortable, or i am out of there, i cannot STAND ANY KIND of bugs, and it felt like home, the breakfast wasGREAT, nobody should EVER complain, every morning was different, scrambled eggs, ham,hash browns, ORbacon, etc porridge, EVERYTHING you would have at home and the staff there REALLYmade you feel at home,VERY friendly indeed, from there on we took the AMTRAK TRAIN to miami as we were going on a cruise, so if anyone would like to know anything E MAIL ME

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnTraveler_4
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at Hyatt down the street in 2004 during a convention and thought the location was FABULOUS for restaurants and attractions. This time the trip was a family vacation and found the Staybridge Suites to be the perfect place to accomodate our family of 4 (including 2 teenagers) in their 2-bedroom suite. Staff was VERY courteous and helpful. The hot breakfast buffet each morning was great! The price can't be beat for what you get -- including free shuttles to/from all of the Disney parks AND a hot breakfast. I can't emphasize the LOCATION enough . . . it is close enough to all of the Disney and other parks, but not so close that you're inundated with tourists everywhere you go. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay, Lovely place !”
Reviews.Author: st28ten
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 wk stay. It was wonderful. The apartment was clean and spacious. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The bedroom was spacious with an enormous bed! a walk in closet area (which was big enough for my 10 year old to utilise as a bedroom- see photo) which aslo housed the safe , spare linen and towels. The bathroom was also in the main bedroom. The bathroom would be my only critisism as it was tiny . The lounge area was a fair size even though we left the sofa bed perminately made up for my son and the kitchen was plenty big enough for our puposes although we could have made use of a grill and we took our own travel kettle ( as we had read that one isn't provided). Always plenty of ice The housekeeping was regular for change of towels and bed making although could be quite late in the afternoon. The staff were all really freindly and helpful. The breakfast was great ( some have said it's repetetive - but how many different things do you eat for breakfast at home !!) The choices are - either scambled egg or omlete with either bacon- sausage burger or ham, always a choice of cereal, fruit juices, bread, yogurt,grated cheese, boiled eggs, fresh fruit and tea & coffee ( wolfgang puck - fab !)and muffins, cake ,dohnuts or cinammon whirls. Then of course the waffle maker !! How much more choice does one need !!! The communial areas were well kept and clean as was the pool. It isn't a huge pool but big enough for a quick dip and a relaxing cool down ( there is also a hot tub and by god it was a very HOT tub so we didn't use that - remember the temp was a 100 degrees !) There is aslo a small games room and gym but we didn't need or have the time to use either of them. The location ifsbrilliant. So easy to get to and only minutes away from the entrance to DownTown Disney with complete access to all other Disney parks. Just across the road from WinneDix and Walgreens and within walking distance to several restaurants. Hope this helps not sure if there is any thing else to add. Ooh - we asked for top floor in quite location and thats what we got - no noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “lots of room!!!”
Reviews.Author: mspears
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay and loved it. We have stayed at the Wilderness lodge in the past and payed big bucks for a small room but beautiful atmosphere. The layout of this hotel room was wonderful!!! My two boys (10 and 14) loved having their own room with separate beds and a bathroom. We loved the king size bed which was comfortable. It was a wonderful place to come back to and relax. We did not have a problem with the pool being busy. Breakfast was alright. Also, great restaurants located nearby and very short drive to Disney. We will definetly stay here next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good family holiday”
Reviews.Author: theflyingdoctor
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 2 week stay at the Staybridge Suites. The hotel is conventiently close to Disney in Lake Buena Vista and offers standards that are as good as many of the better Disney offerings at far lower cost. Welcome. This was friendly but not at the standard one would expect for '10 best in the US as per trip advisor' rosettes that were being worn by the staff. The room was very clean on arrival but the standards of replenishing the goodies ( eg popcorn) fell rapidly as the stay wore on. It then improved when we handed a $30 tip to the chambermaid ( Us brits loathe this US habit). Room/suite This was very spacious with a king size bed for us and a double each for our teenage sons. The bath was a bit small and could be hard to get out of especially for my wife who has arthritis of the knees. There was a kitchen ( stock somewhat spartan) a very large US size fridge as well as a cooker and microwave. A toaster was also present and a coffee maker but no keetle ( is this a British item?). We ate out most of the time but feel we would have struggled to fix a full meal here. Air con good and can be controlled to a level that suits the occupant with ease. Swimming pool Good size with jacuzzi. Open till 11pm which was great on coming back from a day at the parks. Other facilities. Good hot buffet breakfast included in room rate. There was a business centre with 3 free internet terminals and signs in English and Spanish ( lots of South Americans staying here) advising that there was a maximum use of 15 minutes at a time and strictly no under 18's ( they had their own single terminal in the games' room). These rules seemed unenforced and I spent long periods of time waiting for young teenagers to stop talking to their boy/girlfriends back home. Washers and dries plentiful at $1.50 a load- efficent as well as reasonably priced. No restaurant/ bar in hotel but plenty in walking distance. Very small shop on site not used. Reasonable parking available but could get full late at night. All in all a good location fro a family holiday at an affordable price. You can do much worse than come here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney alternative!”
Reviews.Author: TropicalGirl22
Reviews.Content: Our party of 8 spent one night on 7/3/08 and we felt the accomodations were excellent for the price! Having two separate bedrooms and 2 baths worked perfectly. I would say that although I didn't think the suite or furnishings were "worn", the pull-out sofa bed had a caved in mattress. Not unlike most hotel sofa beds however. We had my 13 year old nephew sleep there, so he didn't really care. We had a 2nd floor room overlooking the pool which was great to watch other family members while at the pool. The pool is adequate...not very big as others stated, but it was very clean and had nice sitting areas as well as a hot tub. Even though we were visiting at a busy time, we literally had the pool area to ourselves at 10am in the morning. The free breakfast was wonderful! Hot items such as the fresh waffles and omelettes were a nice touch. My sister saved a ton of money not having to pay for breakfast for her family of 5. We literally filled up before heading out to Epcot. The parks are literally one exit away, so it is VERY convenient if you have your own transportation. If you plan to stay here, I would suggest becoming a Priority Club member first (it's free) before booking. As a Priority Club member, I received a basket of homemade cookies upon arrival as well as top notch attention. It also didn't hurt that I was wearing my "TripAdvisor" baseball cap during check-in! At first, the master bedroom toilet wasn't flushing properly and we also noticed the 2nd bathroom was missing shampoo and conditioner, but both were remedied IMMEDIATELY when I called down to the front desk. Literally, maintanence was at our door within 3 minutes and took care of everything so I can't complain about that. Oh, but their shampoo/conditioner product was horrible! So, I do suggest you bring your own. I never had so many tangles in my life! Anyway, the location can't be beat...many stores and restaurants are located in very close proximity...some even walkable. There is a grocery store, a couple restaurants, and a nice ice cream parlour right behind the hotel. Unfortunately, this hotel doesn't have elevators, so be sure to request a ground floor if anyone in your party cannot do the stairs. Overall, I definitely plan to stay there again. It is a better deal than staying on Disney property, especially if you have a group as large as ours for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: EDSTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge Suites in Lake Buena Vista is our standard home away from home in Orlando. To date we have been there 4 times and a bunch of our relatives are staying there as I type this review. My husband and I used to live right down the street and always enjoy returning to that particular area of Orlando. Lake Buena Vista is an IDEAL location if you are visiting Disney World. You are right down the street from the Downtown Disney entrance to the WDW Resort. This entrance has less traffic and is often easier to access than Maingate. You can also catch Disney Buses right at Downtown Disney if you like. Staybridge Suites is less than 2 minutes from this WDW entrance. This hotel is not fancy but we have always found it to be clean and comfortable. The layout of the suite is ideal as we are often traveling with friends. Each 2 bedroom suite has one room with a king bed and full bath and a second room with 2 double beds and a full bath. In addition, there is a small kitchen and living room. There is a full breakfast offered with both hot and cold food. Again, nothing fancy, but convenient and good. There is also a grocery store in easy walking distance. Our family has been making great use of that this week. The pool and spa are also good sized and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to family's looking for a little more space and a terrific location. Only complaint we have had - or heard - is about the shuttles. This hotel does offer shuttles to WDW but we have found them to be rather inconvenient in their timing. Drop me a line if you have any questions about this hotel or the area. We have spent a lot of time there and are happy to advise.

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge Suites Highly Recommended Disney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spadesqueen74
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at SS June 25 thru July 3, 2008. I paid about $1600 dollars for the 8 nights in a 2 bedroom suite, but that also included a $100 disney gift card. It's conveniently located (about two stoplights from downtown disney). For less than $200/night, I think we got a fair deal, especially when considering the free hot and well supplied breakfast provided every morning. Also, we caught the manager's "sundowner" four out of the eight nights and that provided dinner (plus free beer and wine) for the family! The staff was helpful and friendly. I requested weekend housekeeping and they said consider it done, so we had our maid service all eight nights. Our kids loved the pool, kiddie pool, fountain and hot tub almost to the point of annoyance because often they complained about touring the parks and just wanted to stay and swim! We stayed on the second floor overlooking the peaceful courtyard. This was convenient because when our kids would nap my husband and I could go down and play cards/read the paper/whatever and still keep an eye on our door. If we return, I would request the third floor however, because we could hear our upstairs neighbors plumbing and pipes in the morning while we were still in bed. The third floor would eliminate some of that noise. You can also hear people pretty clearly right outside your door. Some extra soundproofing would make this place even better. Overall, I highly recommend the Staybridge Suites. We would definitely stay again for a return trip to disney.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loriandlou
Reviews.Content: When we walked in our room we were very happy. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and there was enough room for the 4 of us. The staff was very friendly and check-in and check-out was very fast. The breakfast in the morning was very good and you received alot of food. We would come back hear in a heart beat. There are stores within walking distance. The is no elevator so make sure you and your family can walk those stairs. The pool was alot of fun and they always had towels by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: suzptaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite in June 2008. The public grounds were in good shape and the management was very friendly. The breakfast was very generous and the location was very good for going to Disney. On the downside, I found our room to not be as clean as the typical hotel standard. I used the kitchen to make dinner, and each time I opened any of the kitchen cabinets my hands would stick to the cabinet. The living room couch was rather worn, as well as the carpet and the bathrooms. I really liked the layout of the property and the room, but the furnishings were really worn and everything could really use to be updated. I would stay at this property again if I found that it was renovated. Otherwise, there are so many hotels in the Dsiney area, that I would certainly try another.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the bucks!”
Reviews.Author: tcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 3rd floor, didn't turn up until 7pm due to 3 hour flight delay, but check in was done within 5 minutes. We had a 3rd floor room which was a pain lugging up the suitcases but once in the room I was pleased with what we had. An open plan kitchen area, a 3 seater sofa bed, a seperate chair and a dining table and chairs. The bedrooms are on opposite sides which is useful for some privacy! The main bedroom had a huge double bed, with en suite fittings, TV, hairdryer, free safe, iron, ironboard and alarm clock. The other bedroom had two small double beds, ensuite and TV but no hairdryer and no safe. Apart from that not much different. All rooms were clean to a good standard, it's not going to satisfy everyones tastes but it satisfied my wife and she is a stickler for cleanliness! Breakfast room was a good size with tables outside so that whatever time you went down there, it never felt crowded. A good variety of breakfast options, including make your own waffles. The waffle maker is in a seperate room to the other food options. You can have cereal (doesn't change) juices, coffee, tea and even beer! They also provide an egg option and a meat option if you want to. It does get tiresome after a while so we went to IHOP a couple of times. One thing they didn't have was peanut butter! The only spread options seemed to be Mixed fruit jelly, Grape and a few strawberry ones! (Had to hunt for those!) So we brought down our own PB which we brought from Walmarts! Overall though, it was a good breakfast spread. Pool is a bit on the small side. Put it this way, if there's more than 10 people in it, it feels crowded! Apart from that it's clean and you get plenty of sun. Pool area was clean and free towels were provided and also free balls and floating devices which I thought is a nice touch. We also used the laundry service which was ok, make sure you have plenty of quarters! Maid service was the minimal standard, they did come everyday including weekends which differs to what the notices say, and most of the time they tended to arrive between 4 and 5pm, which was an incovenience, especially when we came back from the parks early! They make the bed, give you clean towels and might put on the dishwasher but there's no hoovering at all and didn't appear to be any cleaning. I guess that is in the once a week full maid service! Whatever you do, do not use the phone! Very expensive to call the UK, I told my friends it wouldn't be cheap but they did it anyway and it cost them $130 for about 20 mins! So be warned! Overall for the cost it's worth staying there, if only for the location which is superb! Never staying on i-drive again! I would definitely come back here again. Any questions then feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Had a lovely time!”
Reviews.Author: Saffy8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks end of May/first week of June, it was my first trip to Orlando and I was not disappointed at all, would of loved to of stayed longer! Iris on reception made us feel very welcome after a long flight. Hotel is an ideal base for exploring Disney, theres a free shuttle bus to Hollywood Studios, Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdon and Epcot, providing pick up and return service at various times for each park. For Disney waterparks take advantage of using the DisneyWorld Transportation System from the parks which runs throughout Disney itself. We did have to get taxi's to Seaworld and Universal but the taxi's the hotel used were all very reasonable. Our suite itself was very adequate for what we needed, bathroom is a little bit small but the king size bed makes up for that! We did miss not having a kettle in the kitchen, there is a coffee maker but for tea lovers the boiling water from the coffee maker is not nice! Cleaning was adequate but do make use of the "later please" sign if you are looking for a lie in as the timings of the cleaner varied alot! The daily breakfast was good but did get a bit boring after a while as normally either scrambled egg and bacon or scrambled egg and sausage! The waffle station is great fun though and there was always a selection of cereals, juice, tea/coffee and pastries/cakes. The hotel does not have a drinks/snack bar or any alcohol beverages, except on Managers sundowner bar b q nights, which is a shame, however there are plenty of restaurants nearby - The Olive Garden is a fab Italian, Hooters is just a bit further to the left of the Olive Garden, TGI Fridays can be found on Crossroads place, and Joes Crabshack is just opposite the hotel. Most nights we were out at the parks anyway! The hotel has a lovely gated pool area where you can swim until 11pm - theres a pool and jacuzzi which is very welcoming on the feet after walking around parks all day. Plenty of sunbeds and towels provided too. The laundry room came in handy but one request i would make is for a folding airer in the suite as there is no where as such to hang your washing that you cant tumble dry! There is also free use of computers and internet for those of you who cant leave checking your emails whilst away! This did also come in handy for looking at the photos taken over the days on Disneys photo pass :0) Overall our holiday was fantastic and i would highly recommend this hotel without a doubt to friends and family. Our stay was clean and comfortable and the hotel had everything we needed. One final point is that if you are booking this hotel through Thomson Holidays be aware that there is no Rep service at this hotel, we were given a number to call if we needed a Rep, which we did use as needed some details of pre booked excursions, however getting the Rep to come to us was not an easy process, Thomson didnt know who was covering the area and we ended up with a guy who normally covers Universal International Drive area, he didnt know where the hotel was so was over an hour late getting to us!!

Reviews.Title: “A great family base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: saparker
Reviews.Content: This is a great family base for a stay at Disney. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, there were two excellent sized bedrooms, a big parents room and 2 double beds in the 'childrens' room. They each had their own bathrooms and wash facilities. The living room and kitchen area were more than sufficient for a large family. You had the choice to eat in or go out. The rooms have been refurbished, with new curtains, bed linen, etc. What did let the rooms down where the quality and wear and tear on the kitchen and bathroom units. They were classic American, functional but not high quality. They needed refurbished. The other facilities were excellent, from the service from the staff, to the Free breakfast, which was more than adequate, and great waffles, to the Free internet and wifi in the rooms, if you wanted. One draw back at breakfast, no fresh fruit! The pool area was superb, and open until 11pm, which is a welcome break from the heat of Floirda and gives you an opportunity to rest your weary legs. The accommodation is on three floors and is situated around the coutryard pool, which gives a very safe and enclosed sense to the hotel. The utlimate question, would I stay there again and would I recommend it to friends? The answer to both questions is YES, and we did. We cancelled the last night of another hotel to return to Staybridge Suites before coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouse68
Reviews.Content: What a fab hotel! My family (2 adults 2 children) stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment - very spacious, very clean and comfortable in May 2008 for two weeks. We could not fault the hotel at all. Free breakfast every morning and Managers specials during the week which included free beer/wine between 5.30pm/7.30pm. The pool/pool towels were immaculate and lots of inflatables/toys for the children to use. This was my fifth time to Florida (3rd time for my husband and children) and it was the best hotel so far we have stayed in. Brilliant location and right on the doorstep of Walt Disney World. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. Light Maid service was daily and a complete change of sheets/hoovering was carried out on a Wednesday. We had a king sized comfortable bed in the master room with bathroom and the children had a queen sized bed each with their own bathroom. Lots of wardrobe and drawer space. The staff were very polite and friendly - even the maintenance guys. We viewed lots of hotels before making a decision and it was thanks to TripAdvisor that we picked the Staybridge Suites at Lake Buena Visita as it has glowing reviews - I can now see why! If you are travelling on a budget - this would be ideal as you could take full advantage of the free breakfasts and meals of an evening - all you do is leave gratuity. Lots of restaurants within walking distance - and a huge Walgreens opposite for holiday essentials. We took advantage of the free Internet use in the Games Room - and the children loved playing the arcade games. Also a launderette on site and a shop right next to the reception desk which stays open all the time. I cant praise this hotel enough - I would definitely stay there again it was lovely and a shame the holiday had to end!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: joe201
Reviews.Content: Party of 2 adults and a 6 year old stayed here for one week in May'08. Our flight from Dublin was delayed and by the time we got to the hotel we were under pressure to make the 9pm performance of La Nouba . Check-in was very fast. In and out in less then even 5 minutes with the staff answering some questions for me. I always like a quick check in. Our 2 bedroom suite was a good size. Full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher and cooker. Plenty of towels, replaced daily. Large TV in main room and one in each bedroom. Beds were very comfortable. Ample parking. The morning buffet was fine. Not a lot of change from day-to-day but you don't have that at home anyway. We were very happy with it. The hotel provide disposable cups, plates, bowls and plastic cutlery if you want to take your breakfast on the run. We availed of this a couple of times. Free Wi-Fi seemed to be available everywhere. Rooms have wired and wi-fi. It's a nice option to have this free. I am not a fan of charging for internet access. There is a banner in reception displaying that Staybridge is listed as one of the top 10 family hotels in Orlando (or something similar) I heard one of the staff mention this to a potential customer who dropped by, they seemed to be proud of this. I got the impression that the staff were generally proud of the hotel. I take this as good sign. Location wise the suites are close to everything. One tip when going to the Disney parks other then Typhoon lagoon, Downtown Disney or Cirque is to go via I-4. There is a entrance to Disney less then a mile away via Hotel Plaza Blvd but having to stop for traffic light every couple of hundred meters put me off. There is a 24 hour Walgreen's right across the road from the hotel. There is a large walmart within 5-10 minutes drive. When you are coming out of the hotel on to the main road, turn left and drive straight for 2-3 miles it's on your right (pass under I-4). For what it is. A mid-range spacious family friendly suite complex that is comfortable and safe close to all the attractions, I would give this 5/5. One comment my wife made was that the Laundry was very handy but a fold-up clothes airer would be useful in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for extended stay and family!”
Reviews.Author: ThisFloridaFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 22-25, 2008. This is a great place to stay if you need the "suite ammenities". We chose a one bedroom suite. It had a king bed, one bathroom, a kitchenette with stove, refriderator, toaster, microwave, and sink. The living area had a sofa bed and tv, and also a dining table area. Our boys slept on the pull out just fine. They are 6 & 9 but if they were older we would have opted for the 2 bedroom. We only ate out "nice" one evening and twice lunch in Magic kingdom & Blizzard Beach. The rest of the time the kitchen came in handy and we were able to have snacks, drinks for the kids and for us adults grabbed some beer from winn dixie next door, and sandwich stuff for the rest of the time. The bathroom was a little cramped, it needed about another 2 feet of space in there. It also needed a new shower head, but I find that in most hotels. If they would just stick to a plain ole shower head and avoid the fancy shower massagers they would work better and longer. Other than that it got us cleaned just fine. Breakfast was pretty good and got us to a great start. Eggs, bacon or sasauge, yogurt & granola, cereal, juices, milk, coffee, soda, waffles, muffins, bagels. We arrived late and did not stay during there BBQ evenings but it sounded good. We did not realize how booked the hotel was until our last day when we decided to sleep in (9am). We like to get to the parks early. There were alot of eople at breakfast that day but everything flowed just fine. Pool was small but we were there for the parks not the hotel pool. There was also a hot tub. Very close to DT Disney (5minutes). Close to all of Disney. There was shuttle service to all of these. I did notice that animal kingdom had only one pick up and return but the rest had multiple times. Saved on parking fees! If you are going to universal there is no shuttle service, but I would reccomend a closer hotel to there anyways. I think there is another staybridge closer to that. The hotel staff was ALWAYS smiling and actually seemed like they liked their job. Very nice and willing to answer any questions. We used our reward points to stay but the price is resonable compared to other hotel in the area plus you get breakfast, a kitchen, some shuttle service, and a suite. We would definately stay here again even if we did not have points to used for our stay. Oh I have to tell you this....One day after going to the Magic Kingdom when we got back into our room, our room was not only cleaned but my son's favorite stuffed animal was proudly set up on the pull out bed waiting for him. They posed him so cute. Disney hotels (All Stars) do this kind of thing with the stuffed animal you buy. So it was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: 9taz9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week in early May and loved our stay. I had done an enormous amount of planning for the trip, and was really happy with this place. If you're not staying at any of the Disney hotels, this is a great choice as we found that the hotel is never more than 10 minutes away to any of the 4 WDW parks. You can walk to Walgreen's (across street) or Winn-Dixie (next door). As well, the suites are nicely laid out and although they are not super large - they are more than enough room for a family of four. In fact, our 2 bedroom had a king size bed and 2 doubles, as well as 2 bathrooms, 3 T.V.'s, in-room safe and kitchen with full-size fridge, stove, m/wave, dishwasher and toaster. We found the rooms clean and nicely decorated/furnished. You can request a room right around the pool, but I don't know how noisy it might get (I think the pool is open quite late). Our room was still facing in towards the courtyard but was at the other end opposite the pool, and we liked that just fine as we could easily get to our parked car. However, even though the hotel was operating at full capacity, it was never noisy or overcrowded. Bear in mind there are no elevators, so if you bring a lot of luggage, you may not want to go higher than 2nd floor. The included buffet breakfast was deliciious! There's a waffle making station (yum!), and they always offer an egg dish (scrambled or omelette), meat (bacon, etc.),cereal, yogurt, granola, fruit, coffee, OJ, and cake, donut or muffins. You can choose to eat either inside or out (or in your room!), and the outside courtyard area is very tranquil and pretty. The pool and surrounding area is large and has a tropical-like feel to it. The hotel has a handy business center as well with free Internet. There's also a manager's cocktail reception 2 or 3 nights a week (I think it was Tues, Wed & Thurs evenings) and the offerings are pretty generous. They had chicken wings, salad, veggies/dip, beer and wine one night when we were there. Overall, this is a great hotel for families, couples, friends - anyone who wants a clean, comfortable stay with a great buffet breakfast included. Excellent value for money - I'm very glad we chose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes, mold and mildew alert!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinwithFamily
Reviews.Content: In preparing for my family's Orlando stay, I picked the Staybridge on the basis of many positive reviews. I am sad to say I now understand why some reviews were positive, while others less so. The benefits of this hotel for us were its location, which is handy to WDW, many restaurants, a pharmacy, and supermarket (walking distance for all but WDW). Other value-added services included the buffet breakfasts, manager receptions (3 times weekly) guest laundry (nominal fee), complimentary newspapers and shuttles to shops and WDW, tidy pool area and grounds, and willingness of staff to respond to issues brought to their attention. The drawbacks we experienced was a room that desperately needed more regular maintenance prior to guest check-in. For example, we were met with carpets that turned our feet/socks black within moments of walking on them, a toilet that would not flush/drain consistently (2 maintenance calls during our stay alone, problem still occuring on check-out), a moldy/mildewed shower head, curtain (a fresh one provided on request), toilet tank filled with mold, a moldy air exchange system, and rumpled bedding that appeared "enjoyed" by the previous guests. We appreciate that cleaning staff in most major hotels have 20 minutes or less to prepare a unit for new guests to arrive, but if you have health issues, such as sensitivities to molds, mildews, or dust mites, this is probably a hotel you want to avoid until the management works out a better maintenance schedule. Think I am being too fussy? Check out what the Centre for Disease Control has to say about exposure to molds and mildews. Offering us a portion of our stay costs back, while acknowledgement of a problem, did not fix the underlying issue, which is the need for better maintenance of the rooms, which I suspect is not unique to this particular property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Krisa816
Reviews.Content: I was hoping the good rating and reviews were accurate...and they were! This is a great location, we were there for Discovery Cove and Sea World, not Disney, but we took a ride over to DT Disney and it was very close. Very convenient to both SW and DC, within 10 minutes. Great area, several restaurants, a liquor store and supermarket in walking distance. I will admit the rooms are in need of updating ( stained rugs and some more inconspicuous areas needed a good cleaning) but overall, the positives outweighed these items 100%. I can't say enough about the friendliness of the staff. Even beyond the front desk, just about every employee we saw had a smile and a hello. The free breakfast was decent and adequate, again worth the money it saves you. The pool was a bit small for the amount of children who stay at the hotel, but we still had a great time. I wouldn't think twice of booking here again in the future if I was not going to stay on Disney property. At night, there is a nice lit up area with fountains and the palm trees made it so relaxing. We brought a few drinks out and spent some time just enjoying the nice evening. Overall, this was a excellent choice to stay for a moderate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: surprisedinfl
Reviews.Content: This was a great Hotel. The staff and everything about it was wonderful. The rooms were very clean and and the staff was very helpful. The shuttle service was great also and very timely. My daughter loved the pool and the breakfast (it had cake on the bar). We are planning another trip to Orlando with our grand children and I will surely stay at this hotel with all of my family. KUDO'S to everyone at staybridge keep up the great work. I have stayed at alot of different brands of hotels and this was be far one of the BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: gmorning
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed seven nights while we ventured off to Disneyland parks. Our stay at Staybridge was wonderful from beginning to end. The service when we checked in was very pleasant and professional. The breakfast was great we had everything from waffles to cold and hot cereal. The dining area was always clean and neat. Our room was always supplied with plenty of towels, the housekeeper even ran the dishwasher while we were gone. The beds were very comfortable my grandaughter wanted to take the pillows home with her. A Coffee pot was provided in our kitchen with coffee and tea every day, that way we could wait for the rest of the family to get ready while we started our day. We used the Hotel Shuttle to take us to the parks every day and pick us up, this was on a scheduled time so you have to be ready. The only problem with this is when you leave the parks at night you are tired and sometimes they are 5 or 10 minutes late, but considering the cost which is nothing it is worth the wait and the drivers were very pleasant. The swimming pool was always clean along with towels provided. Restaurants, Walgreens and Windixie grocery store was only a short walking distance away from Staybridge which was very convenient. We heard a lot of people complain about different hotels close to ours and we felt very fortunate to have picked the best hotel in the area. Muskegon, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Great family value close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Tenr2th
Reviews.Content: Staybridge Lake Buena Vista is an excellent place to stay to be accessible to Disney. With two growing children, the convenience of either the sofabed or separate bedroom for them (we have done both there) is a big plus compared to being squeezed into two queen (or double) beds in most hotels, and frankly I don't feel like paying for two rooms. Here, the rate is fair (but does vary considerably) and the included hot breakfast is well worth the whole deal. It may take 15-20 minutes to get to any of the parks. Disadvantage is the lack of elevators especially if you're on the third floor. It's a very nice place, overall. Our options were here or spending twice as much (at least)at Disney property, which just isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Suites!”
Reviews.Author: MandyS.
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 of our business employees stayed here in Dec. 2005 to be close to the Annual PRI ( Performance Racing Industry) Show.
