We stayed 3 nights & We opted for a suite and were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and nice accomodations. It was also very close to Disney, and shopping! The lobby is beautiful and the breakfast here is WONDERFUL! It has hot & cold breakfast, not your typical donuts! Customer Service was excellent & they even had nightly events! We will definately be back to stay here for the PRI show this year!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Disney”
Reviews.Author: solarstar
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed here a few times, and each time we have been very pleased. The rooms are larger than we'd expect for the rates (check out the Florida resident discounts on the hotel website if you live in Florida), and we loved having a kitchen and separate TV's for the kids and adults. The breakfast buffet had enough choices for even my picky kids, and the pool and hot tub were clean and attractive. We also loved how close this was to Downtown Disney and the parks, as well as a lot of restaurants when I didn't want to cook. Staff was very friendly, from the front desk to the guys working on the landscaping. The only drawback is the extremely small bathroom, but there is a large counter/mirror area next to the bathroom that my teenage daughter appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, Clean accomodations in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeGirl26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista during spring break week (March 17 - 21, 2008.) in a 1 br condo (1 king bed, 1 pull out sofa (queen size), with a full kitchen. We booked the trip with Disney and Universal Tickets and found it to be very reasonable. There was a slight mixup on our tickets, but it was very easily corrected at their guest services desk. The full buffett style breakfast that was included definetly saved money and time. They have a make your own waffle station that our 11 year old granddaughter took full advantage of, as well as a good variety of breads, cold cereals, beverages and they offered a different choice of eggs and breakfast meat each day, along with fruit and yogurt. The accomodations were clean and comfortable with a family atmosphere. The pool area is clean and nice and is stocked with towels so you don't have to bring your room towels down. There is also a hot tub. I can't say much for the restaurants we visited, which were Olive Garden and Lone Star. Both were not nearly as nice as their locations in Memphis and the food was just o.k. The Disney Parks were great and we all had a good time. Food is very expensive in the parks so you might want to carry snacks and water (water is $2.00 per bottle) at the parks. It would be handy to have a small rolling cooler or something as carrying a bag all day gets pretty tiring. Also, Staybridge Suites is very close to Disney parks (about one mile). We did not use their free shuttle as we wanted flexibility but I saw many guests taking advantage of that perk. Parking is expensive at the parks also ($11.00 per day for cars) but it was worth having the flexibility and the car came in handy for activities like shopping, etc. I would recommend Staybridge Suites for Orlando accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality at a Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: johnmOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in late February while we visted the attractions of Orlando. From check in to check out the staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and spacious although it was a bit dated. The pool was great - big and heated - and lots of fun for my daughter. The location was good - close to Disney with resturants and a supermarket close by. The breakfast each day was very good with an excellent selection for a continental buffet. There were four or five waffle makers so it was never a long wait. My only complaint would be with the shuttle bus to Disney. It serves several area hotels and while it was free, we didn't get a seat on the bus either going or returning from the park. I'd rather pay a bit and get a seat or at least be told by staff that the bus was not a good option. Overall we had a good trip and with the price we paid for a two room suite would recommend it to anyone with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Stay and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: CarScott
Reviews.Content: I was initially drawn to this hotel because of 1) the two bedroom suites, and 2) it's close proximity to the Disney Parks. However, I found so much more to like about this hotel. The suites were sufficiently large, the living room and kitchen areas were usable and fairly spacious. The furnishings were comfortable although not brand new (it is a hotel, after all). Everything was very clean. The morning breakfast was a step above the usual continental breakfast, serving eggs, bacon, self-made waffles, and fruit in addition to the usual fare of cereal, danishes, coffee, and juices. The eating area could get busy and quite loud with all the Disney visitors and small children. There is quieter, outside seating under covered tables. The business center offered 3 computers and a printer for free online access. The hotel also has free wireless internet access in all rooms and public areas. The pool area was clean, well kept, and well lighted. The pool is not as big as the hotel website shows it to be and it can be quite busy with children. The other outdoor areas were pretty, well maintained, and clean. The staff was pleasant, efficient, and helpful. Check in literally took 3 minutes. Check out was automatic, not even needing a trip to the front desk. These folks know efficiency! The hotel is in walking distance to grocery and drugstores, and a few restaurants. Since it is located on the north side of I-4, it is on the same side of the highway as the Disney Parks. Access to the parks is quite easy without having to get in the middle of I-4 traffic or the Lake Buena Vista exit. Downtown Disney is a mile a way. My only complaint is very minor: the hallway areas were at times cluttered with trash bags from recently cleaned rooms. These were never left out for more than a couple hours but sometimes there were many. Also, the hallways could be littered with flyers from local restaurants that had been stuffed into doors and fallen on the floor. While this hotel isn't perfect - others have larger pools, some have larger suites, and others won't have as many children -- but taken as a whole we found it to be a great headquarters for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable, but in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: MossyFlossy
Reviews.Content: We booked a quiet ground floor (1st floor in USA) two bed trio (Rm 1613) direct with the hotel using an Orlando Magicard which you can download for free from the internet. The rate was excellent ($119 + tax per night) and we felt that the Staybridge offered great value for money. The suite itself had 2 bedrooms (one massive king, the other 2 v.large doubles), 2 bathrooms and a kitchen with diswasher, cooker, full size fridge/freezer and microwave. No complaints at all about the space on offer, but it needed some updating: it was very tired, and the bathrooms in particular were very "old". Although clean, there were areas that had never seen a duster in their life eg. the hanging clothes rail in the master suite, the architrave round the doors, tops of mirrors, pictures etc: it just had the feel of a property that had seen much better days. The breakfast was adequate, a little repetitive, but clean and cafeteria style. It would grate on you if you stayed longer than a week, however. The pool was clean and well maintained, as was the hot tub. Where Staybridge wins hands down is in its excellent location for the price. As others have said there is a supermarket, Papa Johns and an ice cream place 3 mins walk away! We would recommend Maccaroni Grill opposite for great value Italian food, Orlando Ale House 5 mins walk away behind the Shell garage (great value food and beer/ale very very reasonable) and Steak n Shake 2 mins walk away for diner style burgers/ breakfast at McDonalds type prices. There is a Bahama Breeze that we tried about a 5 min drive away, and this was pricier but also very good. And a must do is the Cheesecake Factory at the Millenia Mall, about 10-15mins drive using the back route via Palm Parkway, great food, never yet had room to try the cheesecake! Close to Disney, Seaworld and Universal, all avoiding the I4, LBV is a fab place to stay. We would consider Staybridge again at this rate, but will probably look out for newer condos/suites in the area next time with a more luxurious and newer feel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Stay for budget minded”
Reviews.Author: mwalbom1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bdrm in November. Three adults and 3 children fit comfortably in the room. One queen bed, 2 doubles, and a very clean pull-out bed. We felt very safe at all times. Having the kitchen definitely saved us money. Any needs we may have had were met right away. The breakfast was wonderful. A great variety and always a hot meat. The kids loved making their own waffles. There is a wonderful courtyard area and a beautiful pool. I will say that only one side of the pool received sun during the day so most people were along that side, which became somewhat "cozy" at times. Most people are too busy to utilize the pool, but we had one "off" day where we just let the kids swim all day. Coming from Ohio in November this was a treat. We would return to Staybridge in a heartbeat if given the chance to go to Disney again. It is so close to the attractions, yet not in a super congested area. Walgreens is nearby and plenty of restaurants. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Boys
Reviews.Content: I needed to be in Orlando for a convention, but went a few days earlier so my husband and I could have a short, fun vacation. My husband is a Priority Club member and they treated us like royalty! We were totally surprised as we have stayed at many Holiday Inn locations where they never acknowledged him as a Priority Club member. Here, they couldn't do enough! Regardless, this is an absolutely beautiful facility. A beautifully landscaped courtyard area, spotless rooms and a wonderful staff. We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite which had a very nice sized kitchen, living area with couch and chair and a small table off to one side. The king bed was so comfortable. The breakfast was extensive...certainly not as good as the fresh cooked Embassy Suites breakfasts, but definitely much larger variety than Hampton Inn, Fairfield Inns, etc. It's a bit of an awkward layout with three separate, yet adjoining rooms, but there is plenty of comfortable seating, the food is constantly being replenished and the staff is constantly cleaning the area. There is an adjoining room off to the side which has 3 computers with online and printing capabilities. The location is outstanding. We've stayed in various parts of the Disney area, but prefer the quieter area of Lake Buena Vista rather than the hustle-and-bustle and crowds on I-Drive, which we just don't feel is as nice as Lake Buena Vista. It is conveniently located to all the Disney attractions (a stone's throw from Downtown Disney), the major highway into Orlando (Sea World, Universal, and the airport) and there is certainly no shortage of restaurants. When we return with our teenagers, we will definitely look here first as there is plenty of room for them to have their own space.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CathyinFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night, for the Mickey's Merry Christmas Party. The hotel was a great value, we got the FL Resident Rate. The 2 bedroom suite was a good size, and the kids having their own bathroom worked out great. The beds were comfortable, the suite was clean. The included breakfast buffet is okay. Come on, it's free! They did offer free bus shuttle transportation to the parks. The arcade is small, the kids liked it. It has one computer with internet access. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Large families!!!”
Reviews.Author: blessthishome
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first and probably only trip to Disney World(nothing wrong with it, just very expensive for family with 4 kids). We normally take short trips to nice places and stay in nice hotels that have breakfast (another savings with 4 kids) during off season to save money but have a very nice trip. Thanksgiving is the 2nd busiest time at Disney but the only time we could go and I've been reviewing hotels for over a year now and had reservations for this hotel since April. We were not disappointed. We stayed in a two bedroom 2 bath suite with living room with sleeper sofa, dining area and kitchen. The kitchen was fully furnished and had a disposal and dishwasher. We filled the full size fridge with drinks and snack/sandwich items. Our 13 year old is diabetic so we always get hotels with at least a mini fridge. We ate at the full breakfast buffet with waffle making station every morning and it pleased all my kids and my husband and myself. I have kids ranging in age 17,13,10 and 6 and they were all pleased. The pool and hot tub were beautiful. If we ever go back to Orlando we will stay here again and we will definitely consider Staybridge Suites in other areas for our future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on budget”
Reviews.Author: JustUs004
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bdrm for a week's visit. Not a huge living/kitchen area but definitely plenty of room for 3 adults and 2 kids. The cupboards and vanities and bathrooms are in desperate need of updating. But, the furniture and carpeting looked rather new and the bedding was top notch and VERY comfortable. Free breakfast came with the stay. The "make your own" waffles were good but coffee and eggs were substandard. Plenty of options, though, for a filling breakfast. The pool and whirlpool area was nice. Don't expect a kiddie playland -- this was a normal, decent-sized pool. Pool noodles available for kids was nice touch and saved us money at Walgreens (conveniently located right across street). Nothing at this property was super clean but more due to age than housekeeping efforts. In general, everything was perfectly acceptable. No bugs seen in the rooms at all -- that was important to me. Some money does need to be spent on sprucing up this tired property but on a budget, you can't go wrong. Close to EVERYTHING and property employees were very nice. I would much rather stay here and spend more on express passes and nice dinners than splurge at a cramped Disney room and skimp on entertainment and food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: TJDK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista for a week - 20th October to 27th October. We had already stayed at the Staybridge Suites on IDrive last year because the rooms are a very good size for families and was good value for money we decided to try the Lake Buena Vista this time. Once again the suite was excellent value, 2 very large bedrooms, lounge area and kitchen. The room was cleaned every day sometimes later in the afternoon but does that matter? The breakfast was excellent, you can even make your own waffles! A large choice from hot or cold. It was open from early in the morning to mid morning so it would suit early risers or if you wanted a lie in. Also there are 'sundowners' a few times in the evening, free snacks and drinks. The free internet use was very helpful, 3 computers so plenty for everyone. We were there to buy a house in the area so this was excellent for us. The swimming pool was clean, and larger than IDrive with plenty of sunloungers. The jacuzzi was brill! The staff was friendly and helpful, and the lady at guest services was also very helpful. The hotel is situated near lots of restaurants and shops, a supermarket is next to the hotel, turn right at the traffic lights, where the ice cream hut is. We would recommend Staybridge Suites every time!

Reviews.Title: “great!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrazilianLu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband, my mother, my father and my 2 kids (18 mo and 6 y.o) for 14 days. We were in a 2 bedroom suite. It was a wonderful experience. Breakfast is good, they offer: waffle station, coke machine, cheese, eggs, donuts, cakes, coffee, milk, sausage/ham, juices, etc. Pool area: opened until 11pm, so we could go to the pool and jacuzzi after the parks. Very clean area. Staff: so kind and helpful. We had no problems during our stay. Our room was facing the courtyard gazebo and was very quiet, excelent for children. Room: kitchen is perfect, w/ microwave, dishes, towel paper, refrigerator, stove, oven, etc. There are 3 TVs and a DVD player. Two bathtubs. The closets and wardrobes are good, the room is clean, furniture is ok. Near to Walgreens, restaurants and Winn Dixie. 10 minutes driving to the WDW Parks. The hotel could have airport shuttle service (even charging a fee), elevators and security in the parking lot area. We didn't see anything wrong, but seems like anyone could enter the hotel. In our next trip to rlando, certainly we'll stay in the Staybridge LBV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: andyboyDundee
Reviews.Content: Just back from a family holiday here with 2 kids had a great time 3rd visit to florida, very close to disney and i4, carpet had just been replaced in our room which was great and fair bit of room in the 1 bedroom suite, breakfast was fine full range for anybody,pool was never busy also very warm pool water,staff very helpful and room cleaned apart from one day, fresh towels daily. Would go back next year and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: 2travelersMaryland
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the Staybridge Suites, our first room had "lovebugs" all over the stairwell and inside the room. When we complained, we were told it's just the season for the bugs. I said we were leaving and they found us a room with no lovebugs. The carpet and the bathrooms were dirty. I commented the bathrooms in the Disney parks were cleaner. The location was good and the pool was fine. I would not stay there again and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SavberryBlanc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 7th visit to Florida. This is our first visit to Staybridge Suites, In my opinion these apartments are situated in a great location only a short drive to all the disney theme parks, seaworld and downtown disney, universal being the furthest away taking on average 25 mins. The apartments here were great, everything you needed, including 3 tv's and a dishwasher. The cleaning was a bit scarse, we are sure there was no hoovering done in the 2 weeks we were there, bins emptied but no liners replaced, however these seem petty in comparison to the actual place but perhaps the cleaning schedules need to be reviewed. We were really impressed with the breakfast such a lot on offer bearing in mind it comes free! it really sets you up for the day. Good pool area, family friendly and pool towels. Good laundry facilites and cheap too! Supermarket just across the road, places to eat within walking distance, sizzler, mexican, chinese buffet and italian restaurants. A tip, order your own yellow cab taxi as they are half the price from the ones ordered from the front desk. The staff at the front desk were really friendly and helpful, I could go on, if you decide to stay here I am sure you will re visit, I will. Enjoy your holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Old,dirty,unsafe-Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Dave-Clearwater
Reviews.Content: This place is WAY overrated. I booked a room for the weekend after reading reviews form here and was terribly disappointed. The rooms are big but that's the only thing this place has. Maid service is nonexistent - before,during,or after your stay. The maid spoke no English and I had to bring trash and towels to her before she knew what I needed done. When I go on vacation I don't want to make the bed,empty trash,do dishes - nothing. I want to relax. Our room looked like a crime scene on the carpet - disgustingly dirty. The couch stunk so bad and was so filthy we put one of the bedsheets on it before we sat on it. We wore socks in the shower because that too was gross. Our room was around back - not much lighting and lots of bushes and trees = criminal opportunity. The rooms are far from suites - more like converted apartments. There are no interior corridors - your bedroom windows are right on the balconies/stairways. All night we saw shadows going past our window which made my fiance very uncomfortable. If you have ANY standards this is not the place for you. We checked out early the next day ( after the maid fiasco ) and went down the road to Residence Inn & Suites, which had the same type of accommodation's but MUCH cleaner,safer, and actually cheaper. Don't make the mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staybridge - quality and roomy”
Reviews.Author: sarathorny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the staybridge in May 2006 - was suprised to find the place so roomy. Booked a 2 bed apartment for 4 of us and found it had plenty of room. Big beds. tv's. Kitchen well equiped - ice makers etc. Great location - 20mins from the Disney gates and a walk over the road to supermarket and Sizzler steakhouse. We are going back to Orlando again this year but unfortunatly could not tie in the flight s and accomadation to stay there again )-:. However are staying along the same road at the Cypress pointe as the location was fab!!

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge Hotel Lake Buena Vista: perfect place for families to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maule
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a holiday week in Orlando where I have stayed with my wife and my six childrens 8 ranging from 23 years old to 10 years old. We've stayed in a two bedroom appartment. I thought when I 've arrived it will to small for my family group.....Not at all. We didn't have much space to make a party there, but it was perfect to sleep confortably after a long attraction park day. The hotel is close to the attractions parks, shopping areas and dining areas. Breakfast is very good and filling, and it is included in the rate, and if you have a big family is the option you must take, so you don't have to start your vacation day cooking. The service was good, very friendly and very knowledgeable of the area with good suggestion for dining. For dining most of the days we bought takeaway food and we ate it at the interior terrace. IÂ´ve rated the place as excellent for what I've got according to the price I've paid

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 had plenty of room - very nice suite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pictishgirl
Reviews.Content: Our family (parents and three boys ages 21, 17, 15) purchased a Florida resident package with 3 Day Play Passes, the suite and the free breakfast. We were very pleasantly surprised at the size of the 2 BR suite, and loved that there were 2 full baths. Everything was very clean and the housekeeper did a great job despite our vacation clutter. The free breakfast buffet gave us a great start each morning, so that we were not hungry again until mid afternoon - so we were able to avoid lunchtime crowds, eat at 'off times' and enjoy more rides. We never used the full kitchen, but for a longer stay we would have. One thing to consider - the grocery store at the adjacent property (Winn Dixie) has closed, so you would need to get directions to another store for your groceries. Walgreens is across the street, so snacks could be purchased there. Overall we would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to our friends going to WDW. It was super close to WDW and the package deal was a big savings over staying at a Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: kcmph
Reviews.Content: We were there May 1-9 for a work/vacation trip. We were able to walk to Downtown Disney from the hotel. There was also many restaurants close by and a Walgreens across the street which was convenient for developing film and picking up some food to stock our kitchen. The rooms were very spacious for our family of 5. The rates were awesome when you used the Magic card which is put out by the Orlando tourism department and is free. The breakfasts were very filling as were the evening receptions during the week. We took the free shuttle to the outlet mall where there is a Disney outlet store. We didn't take the shuttle to the parks as we thought it would be more convenient to drive. If you come to the parks in the evening, chances are you won't have to pay to park, fyi. The pool was wonderful. The hot tub was very hot. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Great deal for larger families!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney, Huge rooms, good pool, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: IndyClint
Reviews.Content: I think my title says it all - its about a 15 minute drive to Magic Kingdom (the hotel does have a free shuttle, but we chose to drive so we could come back to the hotel in the afternoon). The rooms are gigantic- I've stayed in probably half of the staybridge suites in the country, and this one had the biggest rooms of any of them. We had a propblem with the Air Conditioning, and the service guy was at our door 30 seconds after we called the desk. The breakfast was great, lots of hot and cold items. The pool was great, with a waterfall area, separate hot tub (in 100 degree weather??), and a small kiddie pool. It could use some updating and some paint, but overall it was the perfect hotel for our family disney vacation. SUPER STAFF TOO!

Reviews.Title: “Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: mosey
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the staybridge for 15 nights in July, a family of 6. Like most of the reviews the breakfast was very good, and the staff at the desk were probably the most helpful that we ever encountered!But thats were the similarities end. Our maid must have been away on vacation, because a few times our room was not even touched.On numerous ocassions we had to call down to the desk to get fresh towels, and to get the trash lifted from outside our room. We even had both our toilets overflow. The hotel has an environmental impact statment on the cleaning of the rooms I think our maid took this to seriously! If you have to use the business suite you will have to wait until the young students have finished MSN/bebo, the suite is not monitored at all even though rules are displayed. The hotel itself is in a pretty good location (1 1/2 miles fron downtown Disney) but a lick of paint and some new carpets would freshen it up. We have stayed in Orlando a few times, and have stayed in Homewood suites American way which I would recommend over the Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: r1wigs
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Loved our stay here. Very quiet, no noisy crowds. The breakfast buffet was great except for the eggs which are bad on any buffett I've ever tried. Bought our Disney tickets right in the lobby. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I really don't have a single complaint about this hotel. I would stay here again with no second thoughts though I would ask for a ground floor room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RoryMc
Reviews.Content: We booked the Staybridge Suites with Trailfinders as part of our trip to Florida in Sep 2005. From memory, this was a perfect base when staying in Orlando; very reasonably priced, clean, and the suites were spacious, tidy and quiet. Check-in was efficient and the hotel had a well run feel to it, never felt crowded and was very relaxed. There was a good business centre with internet facilities, and a regular free shuttle bus to the various Disney parks. Breakfast was very good, with plenty of choice to fill you before a busy day in downtown Disney! If returning to Orlando, i would certainly consider staying here again!.

Reviews.Title: “most comfortable hotel beds ever”
Reviews.Author: clwBoston
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5, including parents and 3 young adults, stayed here June 6-13, 2007 for our family trip to Disney and Universal. Location is very convenient - about 1 mile to Downtown Disney and within 10 miles of all parks (Disney and Universal). Buffet breakfast, service, and hotel pool were excellent. We were even able to extend our check-out time to 2 PM at no charge. The suite layout with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 3 TVs, full kitchen, and living room worked very well for us. Kids could stay up late watching TV without disturbing parents. But best of all, the beds were the most comfortable we have ever experienced in hotels! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “L O V E D the Staybridge Suites!”
Reviews.Author: TNFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with our 6 children during the first week of June 2007. This is one of the few times that I can honestly say that I would return to a hotel. It is hard to find a good value with a big family and this was definately it!! We all loved the hotel, the staff and the amenities. We were comfortable and had everything we needed. The location is perfect to restaurants and conveniences. Breakfast was perfect for our needs. Would only recommend that the laundry facilities were a free service. We would highly recommend this location and thank the staff for the fabulous job they do!

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: JAtkinson
Reviews.Content: To start, the staff were absolutely some of the nicest, most helpful people i have ever met (and im from canada where everyone is kind and helpful)..but this group of staff exceeded my expectations in every way. I had bad blisters on my feet and everyday 4X a day i went down for first aid products and everyday i was given what i asked for. I was asked everyday how the day before was at disneyland and they even remembered which park i was at the day before. If you were ever to run into a problem or just needed some general information about orlando i can guarantee you that Iris and Dale would do everything in their power to make sure your problem is taken care of. Iris and Dale made sure that my vacation was utilized to the maximum by giving me tips on orlando as well as tending to all of my requests. For this and more if i was to ever open a hotel they would all be offered first class tickets to toronto to come work for me because they are all some of the classiest, most hardworking staff i have met. The hotel has a BBQ, FULL KITCHEN, POOL, HOT TUB, GROCERY STORE WITHIN 2 MINUTES, $10 FOR ALL YOU CAN RENT MOVIES FOR A WEEK, BIGGEST BREAKFAST BUFFET IVE BEEN TO FROM A HOTEL(100% JUICES, MILK, EGGS SAUSAGES, CEREAL), FRIENDLY STAFF, LAUNDRY, UNSTAFFED COMPUTERS, AND A GAMES ROOM WHAT R U WAITING FOR???

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: canukbajan
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 6 night stay at the Staybridge Suites in Lake Buena Vista and had a fabulous time. We booked through West Jet Vacations and got a reasonable package deal and were really impressed with the hotel. We had a 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms a kitchen with a full size fridge stove microwave and even a dishwasher.The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. THe pool was very nice although we only used it once as we were on the go the whole time lots of loungers and towels. The grounds very well kept. The buffet breakfast was wonderful even for fussy eaters like my kids they found plenty to chose from. We did not use the shuttle system as we rented a car since we have small children and did not want to have to wait for a shuttle. I did look at the shuttle schedule and it did look like it ran on a regular basis. This hotel is in a great location just 15-20 min away from the 4 disney parks and downtown disney. There were plenty of restaurants near by and also a Winn Dixie across the street which was handy to purchase drinks and groceries if you wanted to cook. We booked our disney passes with ticketmania they have a web site and got a bit of a better price than getting then from Disney I think we saved the tax which is a big savings when purchasing 5 tickets. We had them deliver them to our hotel the day we arrived which was only an additional $6.00 and they were there waiting for us with a welcome package with loads of info. We also booked a make over for my daughter 6 years old at the Bibbity Boppity Boutique which we booked a few months ahead this was worth every penny for $45.00 she got the crown package which includes a hairstyle which includes hair piece hair accessories makeup and nails by a fairy god mother in training. She wore her own Belle Costume so we did not purchase one there. THis is an amazing experience for little girls they are made to feel like little princesses. We also went for a photoshoot and purchased 5 pictures for $30.00 and they are beautiful they did a wonderful job. After the make over we went to Epcot the Norwegian Pavilion Akerishus for Story Book Dining and had dinner which was also booked ahead of time. Belle Jasmine Princess Aurora and Cinderella were there they stopped at each table to sign autographs and have photos taken with your children a great experience. This was a wonderful vacation and we can not wait to return to the Staybrige Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Staybridge.”
Reviews.Author: Gigantorq
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed at the Staybridge. We couldn't have been happier both times. The kids spent most of their time at the pool. The breakfast buffet is really good. There's something for everyone. Room is clean and the one bedroom suite is exactly what we needed, We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: niceicelady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Staybridge Suites LBV from 5/5 to 5/12/07 and it was an excellent experience. We booked the two room suite and it was exactly what we needed. The suite had a small kitchen, living room area and two separate bedrooms and two separate bathrooms. Three t.v.'s also. Everything was very clean. The pool and dining areas were great. Did not use the laundry area. The kitchen area was a little dated, but that would be the only thing that didn't look great. Trip Tip: Since we had planned to do the "Disney Experience" for several hours each day and then return midday to have lunch the location was great because there were restaurants off Disney grounds and the ability to do grocery shopping at the Winn Dixie immediately behind the hotel. This saved a lot of money for us, The breakfast buffet in the morning also provided a great selection of hot and cold menu items. Again, another great money-saving feature of the hotel. Although the hotel is not on Disney grounds this really was not a drawback. The hotel is within 2 to 10 miles from each Disney park. However, be careful because if you are looking for complete shuttle service to the Disney parks, this hotel does not have it. We opted to drive to the parks each day and pay the $10 parking fee, which ended up being much more compatible with our schedules of going back and forth to the parks when we wanted to. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who has a family with children. For the price it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staybridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: madness0284
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5-nights but wished it could have been longer. Booked this hotel using Priority Club points based on reviews on this site, and I have to say I was not disappointed. Check-in could not have been smoother, we were upgraded to a 2-bed suite as my dad is a Platinum member. The only downside for the whole stay was that there were no lifs, our room was on the first floor, so we had to cart our luggage up and down one flight of stairs. But the room was lovely. One bedroom had a king size bed and walk-in wardrobe, with safe. The other bedroom had 2 queen beds. Both bedrooms had an ensuite bathroom. The living/kitchen area was in the middle between the two bedrooms, and to be a bit picky the room isn't set-up very well to watch the TV but then that's not the worst thing in the world when you're on holiday! Having the kitchen was a bonus, and there was a full-size oven and fridge, and a dishwasher. Our room didn't have tea towels or oven gloves though. The maid service visited the room every day even though there is a sign saying that they only provide a light-touch service and nothing on weekends, unless you speak to the front desk. There is a little shop for basic amenities and the Daily Mail newspaper. There is a business centre with free internet connection and printing facilities and Wifi in the clubhouse. I didn't use the pool but it looked nice, my family who visited enjoyed it, however, it was very busy. Also the pool is open late so if you're down that end of the complex it could be quite noisy. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. Each morning there was a selection of cereals, muffins, cook-your-own waffles, and at least two hot dishes, which varied daily (bacon and scrambled eggs, sausages and cheese omelets). And that's even before I mention it's excellent location just off the 535, right next to a disney entrance and very close to the I-4. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge was great!”
Reviews.Author: Suuki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Staybridge for 3 nights while on a business / Disney trip. Customer service was awesome. We even needed a late checkout on the final day and it was no extra charge. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Bathrooms were a little small but the sink area was outside of tub area which made it nice so that one person could use sink while other showered. Very convenient to Disney and Downtown Disney. Also convenient to grocery, gas, major highway to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Legenlo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one week vacation to Orlando with our 3 kids (15yrs, 11yrs and 7yrs). We booked our vacation with Westjet Vacations. We are from Ottawa, Canada. We stayed at Staybridge and loved it. The rooms are spacious, we rented a 2 bedroom, 2 bath, Fully equip. kitchen, dinning room and living room with sofa bed. The pool was great, toys for the kids a nice waterfall and above all, it was heated! The jaccuzzi was nice but too hot. The breakfast was GREAT. They had everything, scrambled eggs, cereals, sausages, bacon, warm biscuits, muffins....and the best of all, you can make your own waffles and they are DELICIOUS!! The kids loved it. From Monday-Thursday between 5:30-7:30 they had free refreshments (Beer,wine, cola..) and they even had BBQ's for FREE!! I couldn't believe this, one night they had hotdogs and beans, the next night was ravioli with fresh buns. Upon check-in they will give you a calendar with what's on the menu. We went to all 4 Disney parks plus Typhoon Lagoon and our last day we went to Cocoa Beach which was only 1hr away. The location is GREAT, everything is close by. The entrance to Disney Resorts is only 2 blocks away. Downtown Disney is only 5mins away, Magic Kingdom 10mins. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Also if you are renting a car, there are LOTS of outlets, souvenir shops and even a WalMart close by. Also there is a Walgreen pharmacy right across the street that is open 24hrs. If you are looking for a great place to stay while visiting Orlando, Staybride Suites Lake Buena Vista is a MUST. We will stay here again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Value, Value, Value”
Reviews.Author: LawAlpharetta
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 days in Orlando with my Family...first 4 days were spent attending a conference and we stayed in the Disney Beach Club Resort @ $400 per night...for one room with 2 beds. I was travelling with my family...wife and 5 and 3 year old. Don't get me wrong the Beach Club is a very nice place...but $400 for one room without any homey ammenties other than a very small fridge gets old very, very quick. Once the conference was over and the tab became my responsiblity, we moved to the Staybridge Suites....The place is no Ritz, but, clean, spacious, and close to the park. Quite frankly, I was astonished with the value! With a AAA discount room was $127.50 per night for a 2 bedroom 2 bath apartment...fully stocked kitchen (utensils, etc. not food), daily housekeeping, nice heated pool with pool toys for the kids, awesome, hot all you can eat breakfast...only 2 miles from downtown disney in a very clean part of town (none of the Kissimmee kitsch). Did not try the shuttle service so I cannot speak to that... Place is a little dated but well maintained and you can tell it will continue to be...I travel a lot for pleasure and business and this is by far the best value I have encountered in a hotel! Having stayed at the 4 star disney and the 3 star Staybridge on the same vacation...I would choose the Staybridge regardless of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!!”
Reviews.Author: chelb33
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights 2/25/07 and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Next year we are going to stay the whole week. VERY family friendly. My family booked the 2 bedroom suite and loved it. Nice and clean. Helpful, friendly staff. For a family with 2 adults and 4 children this was the place to stay. The breakfast didn't change much but it is included within the room rate and hey....kids love this stuff. Free use of the computer station which was limited to adults only (which I feel is wonderful). Very nice to be able to check your emails and not have to pay $4 a minute. Kids had a computer that they could use in game room.I found the hotel to be overall very clean. The laundry room could use some help, but not disguisting. The kids loved the pool and it was nice to get back from Disney on the FREE shuttle that was provided by the hotel and take an hour or two to swim before they hit the sack. Many places nearby to make those oops, I left it at home purchases. Walgreens across the street was the easiest and by far the least expensive. The Winn Dixie is within walking distance to purchase groceries if you choose to use your kitchen that has place settings for 6. Had to run to the airport to pick up Husband who was flying in a day later and we returned to the hotel at 2 am and felt very safe in the parking lot. Very well lit. I am telling you as a bargain HUNTER...the Staybridge Suite is by far the best value that I have found and will return again next year with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel - lots of extras + handy for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Diffy
Reviews.Content: Just back from two weeks at the LBV Staybridge and would definitely return. I would echo all of the recent positive comments about the rooms / amenities / staff. In particular, we liked the: - free breakfast buffet (lots of choice) - free Tues - Thurs Sundowner snacks / drinks - free buses to Disney Parks (a bit late at times but it was v. busy) - the pool area - the large number of nearby restaurants - the adjacent Winn Dixie supermarket / other shops The stairs were a slight drag on arrival but, for UK readers, I should point out that the third floor only involves two flights of stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: zikki4
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 2 daughters (12 & 8) stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite during our trip to Orlando last week and we loved it! The girls loved having their own room and bath and TV. The rooms were very clean & pleasantly decorated. The full kitchen came in handy for snacks and light meals. (I didn't want to cook while on vacation but it also has pots and pans, etc.) The air conditioning worked well and is very quiet. There is a grocery store and restaurants right across the street within walking distance. The free breakfast buffet they served every morning had alot of variety. Everyone found something they liked and we saved alot of money not buying breakfast every day. We requested a 1st floor courtyard view and that is what we got. It was always very quiet. We usually went to sleep around 11:00 pm and I felt like we were the last ones awake. The grounds are very nice. We loved the pool. It was big enough that it never felt crowded and there was plenty of seating and towels always available. The pool is open until 11:00 each nite so there was plenty of time for a swim after leaving the parks. Most importantly, it was clean and the water temperature was perfect! My husband loved the hot tub but I thought it was a little too hot. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. There is a little business center with 3 computers that we used a few times. There is a shortcut to Seaworld that we used. (It took us less than 5 minutes) The Disney entrance is only a few blocks away also. We also drove to Busch Gardens (about 40 minutes). The drive from the airport was about 15 minutes. Overall, for the price we felt we got more than what we paid for and had a very good experience here. It was a very comfortable place to come back to at the end of the day and we are planning to stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bzartman
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is wonderful!!! Nice, clean rooms, spacious. 3 tv's We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, masterbedroom has a king size bed, other bedroom has 2 doubles, and a full kitchen.There is however 1 downside, after a 17 hour trip who wants to carry luggage up to the 3rd floor?....but the stay was worth it. the grounds were very nice and kept up.It's location makes it easy to get to the theme parks, there is a winn dixi behind the hotel with a great deli, hotwings, ribs etc,kids loved the mac n cheese, good alt. from eating out every night Would deff. stay here again !!!! House keeping was TREMENDOUS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: cathsann
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed just 2 nights and will definitely stay again next time in the area. The 2 bedrooms and 3 TVs were the perfect set-up with young kids. The beds were comfy, the kitchen was equipped with all we needed, and we even had housekeeping on Sunday (which we didn't think we'd get). We paid $129/nt with the FL resident's rate. When you add the money you save on breakfast, and the fact that it is very near to Disney and many restaurants, it is a fabulous deal. Down sides: no elevator - 3rd floor can be tricky with lots of luggage; rooms on hiway are a bit noisy - you might want to request a room on the inside when making reservation; hot tub TOO hot to get in.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: amom4
Reviews.Content: The place was clean and comfortable. The price for two bedrooms was great. The free Breakfast buffet was good. The evening weekday reception wasn't much most days( only salad and drinks) although once it was quite nice. We arrived at 3:45 and they said our room wouldn't be ready for awhile, so we ending up taking another room which was on the 3rd floor. This wouldn't have been too bad but there are no elevators. Another thing I think people should be aware of is there is no room cleaning on weekends; it didn't effect us but if you are going to stay on a weekend it would. The location is nice since it is close to disney and right next to a Winn Dixie.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Clean with all the Little Detals ”
Reviews.Author: KOLMO
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel for 4 nights i was very impreesed it was clean beutiful grounds a lot of space had all the little details i recomend it to anyone 2/22/07

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Anon727
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located a couple of miles from Downtown Disney. The two-bedroom suite was a good value at a special Florida resident rate of $119. It would be very suitable for a family, and has a small living room and fully-equipped kitchen in addition to the two bedrooms and two baths. The grounds were nicely landscaped. There was a good complimentary hot breakfast, and the hotel has a business center with free Internet access. We didn't check out the pool or other amenities. On the downside, the room furnishings were shabby, and taking a bath in the modular shower/tub gave you a good view of mildew growing in the joints. The manager said a total renovation of the rooms was just getting underway. I would stay here again if looking for a moderately priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Staybride Suite Hotel Lake Buena Vista is a rose among thorns.”
Reviews.Author: TSmith7630
Reviews.Content: I have taken my family to Orlando on several occasions and we have stayed at a variety of resort hotels and I can honestly say that the Staybridge Suites by far surpasses any of the dozen or so hotels and resorts that I have visited in the area. Our two bedroom - two bath suite was very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was very cordial. The heated pool and whirlpool were nice. The hot breakfast buffet was delicious and the evening managers reception was good also. The location was perfect for access to Walt Disney World as well as shopping and restuarants. Hands down this will be my choice of stay for any future visits to the Orlando area. This was also my first experience at a Staybridge but it won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, lower cost suites”
Reviews.Author: Phillygal52
Reviews.Content: We shared a 2 bedroom suite between two families of 3. The staff is friendly and helpful, the facility is simple but pretty, and the suites are well-appointed. For visiting Disney parks, the only downfall is that it is not easy to return to a park later if you are driving over. Also, the shuttles only leave the hotel 3 times a day this time of year (8,10, and 12). The only difficulties we had were first in obtaining our room. Our family arrived at 1 PM and check in is at 4 PM. We were offered an earlier check-in in a less desirable location since our reserved Priority Club room "wasn't ready." I suspected that this was a tactic to fill up less desirable rooms first and hold on to the nicest room for last minute, more profitable, room rents. The front desk said they couldn't even tell us the room number of our room until 4 PM, just the general area of the room. We sat at the pool, checked back at 3:45 and they said they needed to send someone to inspect it first. It didn't seem like they were really waiting for that particular room to be cleaned. We had some TV cable problems and AC problems--but these were fixed immediately when we called about it. We might stay there again although I would prefer a place were we could come and go into the park more easily.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: telfilo
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed four nights over the week of Thanksgiving. My family consists of two adults and four children ranging from 1 to 10 years old. When I completed my research I didn't find a lot of negative reports regarding this hotel and so I wasn't too concerned. Being one that travels frequently for business I tend to be a little more critical towards hotel properties. When we arrived it was obvious that the facilities were somewhat aged. The room we stayed in was a two bedroom suite that looked to have been remodeled sometime within the previous 3-4 years. I wasn't super impressed with the rooms due to the age and the cramped bathrooms, however this was minimized by the fact that all of my kids had thier own beds and with three tv's everyone was satisfied. By the end of our stay most of the negatives didn't even bother me. All in all my family really enjoyed thier stay and for the price you can't beat it. If your looking to spend most of your time on property I don't believe this is the place to stay, but for the budget conscious looking for a good place to stay between visits to the Disney Parks, it is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for a good value!”
Reviews.Author: gatorchick
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for nice clean rooms and a good location to visit Disney this is a great deal. We were there for three nights last weekend and I could not have been more pleased. I took my high school age niece and nephew here and we all enjoyed our stay very much. The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfy, and if you need anything like extra towels or blankets they will bring them to you immediatly on request. The breakfast buffet has something for everyone even picky eaters. The shuttle service to the parks is another big plus. They are prompt and have frequent trips back and forth to all Disney parks. The staff at the hotel are very nice and efficient and are happy to answer any questions you may have. The pool looked very inviting but we did not have time to use it. We are from Florida so we got a real nice package deal for Florida residents. I think they are reasonably priced for out of state guests as well. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All that we could have wanted.”
Reviews.Author: Martin-Family
Reviews.Content: What a delight the Staybridge Suites LBV are. From the front door, reception everyone was well mannered and pleasant, no hard sell on tickets or timeshare, in fact they did not bother us at all. What a welcome relief. We had a one bedroom suit which was great for us (This was a travel agent funded upgrade). Suite had every facility we needed if we wanted to cook and eat in ourselves. Who does in Florida? Great beds/pillows A/C was good, maid service everyday inc weekends. Breakfast included - fantastic, you can never get bored with eggs, trust me we stopped here for two weeks and this was a real bonus to us. Sundowners was ok, better on some days than others but hey, it was a free beer and small snack after you returned from the park. Pool was excellent, loads of loungers and free towels. Spa was TOO hot, watch the kids in it! Our suite was well cleaned and the overall standard was great. Only 2 points that bugged m ! 1) a roach walked in from outside under the front door, but never saw another in two weeks. 2) There was an air compressor that started at odd times in the night and woke us twice, but we told reception and we did not hear it again. We enjoyed our stay and would have no hesitation in recommending this place. This is a great location for getting around the all the sights and the road access was good without having the I4 in your back yard.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staybridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: Toby7
Reviews.Content: My family and I (myself and two teenage sons) stayed here for two weeks in October 2006 and it was fabulous! The complex itself is such a good size and so well laid out that you don't have to walk more than a few paces to anything eg; breakfast, the pool, courtyard, laundry etc. We had a ground floor room facing the courtyard. We could park our car really close so everything was just so easy. The location is ideal, you can get to any of the attractions within 10 minutes but it's not as busy as International Drive. There are plenty of restaurants, supermarkets etc close by, it really is the best. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Rooms are ace, the public areas are so well kept and attended to and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. It really was the most delightful holiday. Travel here with complete confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and roomy, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Seanjl
Reviews.Content: I must first confess that as a Priority Club Member our stay was booked in exchange for points. We picked Staybridge Suites because we wanted the freedom of a kitchen so that we weren't tied to restaurants etc. As a couple we had a one bedroom suite, which was certainly roomy, bedroom, bathroom, living area leading into kitchen. The kitchen was reasonably well stocked with pots, pans, etc., and when we left it in a bit of a mess was cleaned up by our maid, who also did a good job cleaning the room. Breakfast was okay, and the free "Sundowner" (beer, wine, soda and snacks) three midweek nights a week was okay. There is also a pool and a whirlpool, but we didn't get much chance to use them as we were busy every day. Other facilities include laundry room, games room etc. The location is excellent. Shops and restaurants within walking distance for dining options, but probably more important for most you are about 10-15 minutes drive from the Disney theme parks. International Drive is also a short drive away, as is the airport and Kennedy Space Centre. An excellent base for a holiday in Orlando, and certainly somewhere I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: spraggless
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the stay bridge suites, Lake Buena Vista from 29dec04 to11jan05. in total travelling there was 7 adults & 2 children we had three suites between us 2x2bed & 1x1bed. It has to be said that we could easily have brought at least another 5 people along with us & they still would've slept comfortably between the three suites we had. This accomodation was in a great location to all the disney parks & we met a cab driver on our 1st night in the complex who has a mini van cab which could hold us all intead of having to get two cabs when going out, needless to say we kept him in buisness over the two weeks we were there. The pool was great, I can't swim but didn't mind getting into the water to cool down & to top it off they have a jacquizi just next to it which was great after a day at the parks to be able to come back & just relax in it before having to go out for dinner. The breakfast in the morning was of a great variety although I generally stook to my cereal & toast it did have a wide selection to choose from & waffles at an extra charge which one of our party tried & really enjoyed. My friend is thinking to head over this new year with her two young girls & i have thoroughly recommended Stay Bridge Suites in this location for her as it is so close to the disney parks & what little girl doesn't find the whole disney thing magical.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Property was a wonderful value. The rooms were very clean as well as the rest of the facility. There was plenty of room to accomodate a party of 7 in the 2 bedroom suites. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. This is the only place I have stayed that once you are settled in, the Hotel Manager calls to make sure your room is to your satisfaction and all is well. I could just go on and on about how nice this facility is. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, they truly do have down pillows and pillowtop mattresses. The Kitchen area was very nice with a dishwasher, micro, full fridge, stove etc. This is a home away from home. It is also very close to Disney World, we had no trouble. They do offer a shuttle to the parks, we chose to go ourselves and it was about 15 min or less from our hotel parking lot to Disney's parking lot. There are also plenty of restaraunts and some shops within walking distance. This place has spoiled me so much that I will only want to stay in a StaybridgeSuites property from here on if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sherry73
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We stayed in the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite and had plenty of room for our family of seven (4 adults, 3 children). The breakfast buffet was magnificent, the rooms were clean and the hotel staff was very friendly, efficient and responsive. We loved the pool area and the location was terrific for enjoying Disney. There are many restaurants and grocery stores within walking distance. The value of this hotel is second to none especially considering the full breakfast buffet, in room kitchenette and the food/alcohol served every Tuesday-Thursday evening. We can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Orlando and enjoyed this hotel. The breakfast buffet was good and it is free, so any complaints about that would be unnecessary since I did not pay for that. The pool was clean and the jacuzzi was great. Always clean towels at the pool. The room was clean and spacious and a great value for the money. It is near a Winn Dixie and across the street from Walgreens and is very convienant to all the parks. We had 4 adults and 3 preteens boys in our 2 bedroom suite and never felt crowded. The grounds were clean and plenty of parking was available. We requested a first floor suite because of an autistic child and they had no problems meeting our needs. The evening reception was nice on Thursday night (our down day) and there is a Chevy's mexician restuarant nearby and we highly recommend that place. Great food, cold beer and reasonable prices. The only down fall is no maid service on the weekends but they do give you a phone call and warn you about that and give you extra towels and such, so it was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy - Near Disney”
Reviews.Author: Jollydodger
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was near Disney and pretty inexpensive. I worried about some of the reviews I found here, but found they were substantually untrue when we got there. One of the best tips I got here was there are no elevators (lifts) so If you have a problem with stairs request a lower floor. We requested a first floor, quiet, recently renovated room and that is exactly what we got even though the hotel was booked full during the spring break period. Yes the breakfast was fine, nice to be able to eat right there in the sunshine before a day of battle at the parks. Room was clean and very spacious, we had only a single bedroom suite as we only had two adults and one small child, but really ample room to make things comfortable. We really didn't use the kitchen except the sink and the fridge, but everything worked and was well stocked, silverware, glassware, corkscrew, icemaker etc. We checked in early, checked out late, felt safe the whole time, things were quiet, staff friendly and helpfull. Common areas were nice and kept clean, same for the pool and the area around. The pool is not as big as it looks in photos online, but nice just the same as we didn't go when it was busy. I think the people who complain about the grade of cabinetry or how they found a speck of dirt here and there, or the maids hadn't done thier room every day by 1pm should get a grip. If you want first class luxury accomodations go to the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress ($190-$300 a night for 360 sq ft room), Ritz-Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes ($320-$500 a night per room), Disney's Grand Floridian Resort and Spa ($400-$600 a night for 406 sq ft room). Keep in mind the above quotes are rooms, not suites so double these figures for suites or adjoining rooms. Maybe I am easy but it seems to me if you want a decent, clean, well maintained suite type hotel, right near Disney, serves free breakfast, that's inexpensive and you are able to look past the occasional flaw then this place is a good bet. If you want perfection at any price, try one of the above. If you want perfection at Staybridge Suites prices, stay home. BTW. I am not that easy, I am a platinum Priority Club member plenty of travel experience. On this trip we also stayed 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza Universal (Jr Suite Priority Club Level) and 5 nights at Disney's Grand Floridian (Lodge Concierge). Were they nicer you ask..... Yup. Did we pay a lot more for that level accommodation..... Yup, yes indeed we did. Would I go back to Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista? Certainly, I go to Orlando for fun, not to look for things to nit pick about. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: mlading
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista Staybridge Suites. The location was good if you are not going to stay on site of Disney or Universal. The staff called us on the second day and asked why we hadn't checked out yet, even though it said on our reservation two nights. The rooms weren't cleaned until 4 pm the second day and we were told it takes a while to clean 150 rooms! The breakfast was good, the rooms did offer a nice kitchen and living room area and adequate bedrooms. The bathrooms were a little small. If you want ice, get it in the lobby at check-in since the freezers are usually empty and it takes forever to make ice. They did offer three computers in the lobby for free internet use. For the money it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: hawkgirl96
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom suite is wonderful. The location of the hotel is great. Room was clean. Breakfasts were wonderful, eggs, bacon or sausage, bagels, fruit, etc. Now for the bad. No housekeeping on weekends. Your on your own to clean your suite. The pool is too small and very dirty. We didn't have phone service in our room for most of our stay. We had to leave our room and use a pay phone to call home or order a pizza. No incoming calls either. Our internet service was out the entire time we were there. We complained to the front desk several times. A manager was supposed to contact us and never did so it was never fixed. Very disappointing. We will find a new place next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staybridge Suites (LBV)”
Reviews.Author: Eeyoreisthebest
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a fortnight at the Staybridge Suites, LBV. The hotel is in an off main road position in an excellent location for all the Disney parks plus universal, seaworld (10 mins. drive) etc.and about 25 minute drive from Orlando International Airport. It's about a mile from Disneys main gates that lead to Downtown Disney. We used the complimentary bus service to the Disney parks most of the time. The breakfasts were excellent, selection of cereals every morning along with juices, then toast, pastries, muffins, bacon, eggs etc in rotation. There were waffle machines available to make your own. The kids loved these. We had a two bedroom suite overlooking the pool. The room was as we requested, non-smoking. 3 televisions, 2 double beds in one room along with it's own bathroom and a whopping king size bed in master bedroom along with it's own bathroom and dressing room (which contained ironing board etc and safe). The sitting room/kitchenette was a good size. Room was clean and well decorated - some of the kitchen cupboards had marks but who cares I wasn't there to cook! The beds were made everyday along with the towels being replaced - the room was hoovered every few days. The only day the room wasn't done was the Sundays we were there which didn't bother us (if you put in a request the room will be done 7 days per week). There was always plenty of hot water for baths/showers and plenty of car parking space. There was a managers special three times a week (Tues through to Thursday 5.30-7.30) where there were such things as chicken wings, cookout with hotdog and burgers, soft drinks, wine beer. You can get coffee 24 hours a day from the machine in the dining room. The kids loved the pool and there are plenty of sunloungers and chairs, this shuts at 11pm, so any noise will be gone by the time you want to sleep. The hot tub is as it says hot, but welcome when your feet are killing you! There were always plenty of papers (local) in the lobby but we never had time to read them anyway. The business centre had 3 computers with internet access. The hotel is in an excellent location for restaurants - Sizzler, Black Angus, Shoneys, Steak 'n' Shake, Olive Garden, Burger King, IHOP to name a few. Winn Dixies and a Papa Johns pizza place is behind the hotel, Walgreens across the road. Also a couple of gift shops across the main road, also a petrol (gas) station. Post Office and a Sony shop is also across the road. What more can I say we really enjoyed the hotel and it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is Service, Service, Service! The folks at Staybidge were absolutely great. All the staff were very helpful and anytime we had any questions or concerns they were addressed immediately. I was travelling with 3 kids and they had a blast in the pool and game room and they were treated like royalty. When I travel back to Orlando I will most definitely be staying with Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Allie.B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 weeks from the 25th Feb. Loved having 2 seperate bedrooms and plenty of space. Only myself, husband and 10yr old daughter, but she loved having a room with her own tv, shower, 2 beds and her own privacy. Beds were very comfortable. Staff were helpful and friendly. Enjoyed the breakfast, found it very convenient and sufficient. Only managed the Sundowner a couple of times, but again, enjoyable. Went in the pool quite a few times in the late afternoons, couple of times no clean towels available, but usually big pile available. Loved the jacuzzi, but yes it was very hot! Only complaint was regarding general cleanliness of the room, could have done with a thorough clean - cobwebs on tops of curtains and ceiling. The room was not dirtyon the surface, only when you looked more closely it just needed a good clean. Our room was on the top floor, which was not a problem as we were aware there was no lift and reception did offer for someone to help with our cases if we needed assistance. We actually liked our room at the front overlooking the lakes and found it very private up there. Would not have liked a room near the swimming pool area, due to noise in the evenings. Good selection of restaurants within walking distance. Would thoroughly recommend Macaroni Grill if you like Italian food and Sizzlers is good for quick eat all you want buffet food. Winn Dixie supermarket also behind Suites. Would not hesitate to return here again.

Reviews.Title: “below average”
Reviews.Author: twinmommy1
Reviews.Content: The first problem you will encounter is there is no elevator. This facility is three floors. Just imagine how angry you'll be when you have a stroller and 6 pieces of luggage you need to drag us 2-3 flights. I reserved a non-smoking room and received a disgusting smelling smoky room because I wanted the first floor. The pool is less than desirable and the gym had five ancient pieces of equipment that were all broke. The lobby had no newspapers or any reading material. Housekeeping only cleans M-F.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed for four days, three nights at the Staybridge Suites in Lake Buena Vista. Our experience was nothing but pleasant. Our suite was extremely clean albeit the bathroom/shower in one of the two bedrooms was quite small with low water pressure. The housekeeping staff were great. I called for a crib for my toddler and the crib was delivered promply. When we arrived we wanted some ice before the ice maker could make ice and the staff brought ice to our suite immediately. The complimentary breakfast was sufficient, a lot of different choices. The pool area was clean and gated with a lock to protect the smaller children from entering or leaving without an adult's assistance. Loved the location, close to the parks, restaurants and grocery store. The only black eye I can give Staybridge Suites at Lake Buena Vista is that there is no elevator to get to the suites on the upper level. Having to lug your luggage and small children up and down those stairs can be little much . . . don't have bad knees!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. Centrally located with an excellent complimentary continental buffet breakfast , including a waffle bar (hot), bacon/corn beef hash/sausage (warm) along with all the normal stuff at a continental buffet. We were very surprised with this breakfast...and all for free!! Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday night we were treated to a sundowner surprise (free chicken wings/nachos/beer/wine/, etc. as a thank you from the hotel to clients. The pool arera was adequate and the water was very warm. We felt very safe and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere. The staff were very helpful and knowledgable to the local area (and more than willing to help us with our tourist-like needs. We would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: my2boyz
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We had a 1 bedroom suite. It had a beautiful & comfy king size bed in one room with a make-up area, walk in closet and bathroom (toilet & bathtub/shower). The other room consisted of a living area, dining are and full size, very well equiped kitchen. We were 4 people (2 adults, 2 kids). My one son slept on the sofa which was a pull-out, the baby slept in a crib provided by the hotel. There were 2 Tv's much to my sons delight. I was amazed at how well equiped the kitchen was. Because we were at Disney during the day, we didn't get to enjoy the pools or other amenities but everything looked beautiful. We were there on Priority Club points and were treated like royalty. We are already planning to stay there again on our next visit, but I think we'll opt for the 2 bedroom so the kids can have their own room and we'll stay longer to enjoy the hotel and area more. Forgot to mention, it's only 1 mile from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “NIce”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge suites for a wk. Overall it was a nice stay. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. There was more than enough room and it was very clean. The free buffet breakfast every morning were wonderful and you can make your own waffles! The pool was nice and clean,the water cold though for being a heated pool. Staff was nice and polite. There were 3 computers with internet access that you can use free of charge, along with a printer also. The hotel is fairly close to attractions and walking distance to a grocery store and places to eat. Overall... we were pleased and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lots of room”
Reviews.Author: DKVogel0810
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a stay at this hotel. The layout of a king bed with bath, sofabed and another room with 2 doubles and another bathroom make this the perfect hotel for a lot of people. The few drawbacks are parking - there isn't a lot of it and not enough towels. You would think it would be common sense to leave more than a few towels in each bathroom. Overall, this hotel is a great value. The free breakfast was way more than we expected. One morning bacon and eggs the next was sausage and eggs. Can't go wrong for the price. It is a great alternative to the Disney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great alternative to Disney hotels for families”
Reviews.Author: swisstwins
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at Staybridge and we loved it. We are Disney regulars, but were looking for an alternative to booking 2 connecting rooms to accomodate our family. We got the Florida resident room rate of $109 for a 2 bd/2bth suite. The space worked great for us. My twin 3 year olds each got their own double bed and my husband and I had a king. We didn't use the shuttle because we had our own car, and the weather was too cold to use the pools(although they looked beautiful). The included breakfast was very nice--We all found something that we liked and it cost alot less than at a Disney hotel for breakfast. the location is very accessible to the parks. the room was extremely clean and quiet(paring lot side). We are going to cancel Pop Century for next month and book with Staybridge!!!

Reviews.Title: “As good as home”
Reviews.Author: ctkoo98ProspectCt
Reviews.Content: I am a holiday inn priority club member and when i was looking for a hotel i initally was concerned about the positive and negative reveiws for this hotel. however we decided to try it. we are a family of 5 including two older teenagers. we were able to get a two room suite which was more than adequate room sizes for all of us.the rooms were very clean and maintained each day. the kitchen area was great for small meals. the staff was very friendly and there is a guest services area that was very helpful. we had a first floor room and heard no noise except when the shower water was running from another room, common in many hotels. the pool area was very clean, water refreshing and jacuzzi felt great after long day at the parks. the breakfast buffet was hot with different items each day not cooked to order but fine for a buffet. there is a full supermarket behind the hotel. the shuttle service was right on schedule each day and evening, despite having a car we used the shuttle service each day. times vary at each park and this time of the year the shuttle was not very crowded. all in all a great weeks vacation at this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mkennan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in the last two weeks (3 nights and 1 night). Staff very friendly and helpful. Near to everything. Free in room ethernet internet access. Breakfast adequate. Rooms very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is terrific! Two room suite was perfect for my family of six. We had everything we needed! Close to restaurants and downtown disney area. Easy on and off the highway to disney world attractions close enough to come back for afternoon rest and back for the evening activities. My daughter left some items near the pool and housekeeping had them all packaged up neatly the next morning. Full kitchen was amazing and the staff delivered anything to our door that was missing. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Best position for Disney”
Reviews.Author: oldmovieguy
Reviews.Content: Great position, Clean and tidy rooms, staff that 'went the extra mile and very good value for money. We stayed in a two bedroom suite on the second floor, which was serviced every day to a very high standard. I had a problem with my laptop but the staff rallied around and got me out of a jam by allowing me to send faxes etc, free of charge. I cannot think of a better location for Disney World, except perhaps in it! You enter Disney gateway about three minutes after leaving Staybridge. Ignore the I18 and just turn right through the gates of Disney World, great for Downtown Disney. The pool is clean and there are a plentiful supply of towels by the poolside. The buffet breakfast is fine, and free! have no qualms about staying here, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Krow1004
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 week stay and unfortunatly my experience was not as good as other postings. After reading all the positive comments and the website detailing room refurbishment in 2005 I was quite confident that this would be perfect for us. We must have been very unlucky with our room. We were poolside, The floor space was great and newly decorated. Unfortunatly the kitchen let the suite down. The cabinets were chipped and water damaged, you could scrape grease off the hand grips and front doors of the lower cabinets. the hinges were rusty and caked in dirt. The microwave had dirt in the door and old food in the seams inside. The air conditioning vent in the living room was filthy and some of the furniture was soiled. In one of the bathrooms the handbasin was cracked and again the cabinets water damaged.
