My first complaint met with a promise of deep cleaning the next day, that wasn't done so on day 3 I asked to be moved. Was told a room was coming available that day so to repack all our cases and take our valuables out with us that day. After packing when we went to ask for a safety deposit box were told the room wasn't available after all and to come back that evening(wasted morning at the parks). The only rooms they could offer us were in the walkways between the buildings looking onto of the wall with large air conditioning vents outside the bedroom windows. Not ideal for a 14 night stay at $159 a night! Advised to ask at reception each night for next day availability. Was told the manager only worked 11am til 5pm (not true). So wrote to her and was offered the room we rejected a couple of days before. During the second week the kitchen was cleaned and checked by the manager. Other than the air vent and door grips you couldn't have told. Didn't actually use the kitchen during our stay.If we hadn't paid in advance I would have moved on. This was our 8th visit to Orlando staying in a variety of hotel/motels and have stayed in better that were much cheaper. Its position is good for Disney,the facilities and communal areas were good, breakfast a bonus and apart from two of the receptionists, staff were very pleasant. Other than the reception area and breakfast room the place just looks a bit wellworn. Windows, walkways and paths dirty, staircases rusty, broken planters around the pool. I wouldn't stay again just because of the hassel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Date 19 July 05- 2 Aug 05. We have just had a two week holiday in Florida and stayed at the Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista. The suites are absoloutly fantastic and so are the staff. On our arrival the staff were very pleasant and helpfull. On our first day we found our safety deposit box was broken I reported it to the staff and it was repaired imediately. A few days later I could not open the safety deposit box as the battery had run flat I reported it to the staff and they came to fix it in less than five mins. The suites are very very comfortable with every home comfort you will need. There is a dish washer which if you dont fill and turn on, the house keeper will do that for you. Every day the house keeper came to make beds and change them as necessary and they emptied bins and left clean towels, soap, shampoo, tissues etc. The buffet breakfast was very good and you could have as much as you like, although by the end of two weeks I did become fed up of eating scrambled egg. The sundowner was also very good with a limited choice. The pool was very good and open till late, it was nice after a long day at Disney etc, you did not need your own towels at the pool as they were also provided. The staff where more than happy to call you a cab at night if you needed one. The suites are situated close to all the Disney parks and there is a free bus service from the suites. The air-conditioning was very welcome as the temps were in the late 90's you could adjust the setting for your own comfort. At the back of the suites is a supermarket this sells everything you need if you want to cook yourself. There are also lots of eating places close by the China Buffet is excellent value for money, especially if you have a large appetite as you can eat as much as you like. Overall we had no faults about the accomodation or staff. Would go again. Best holiday we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: The_Crofter
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a seven-day stay in Staybridge Suites where I stayed with my wife, daughter and son aged 15 & 13.The first thing is location, which is excellent for getting straight onto the I4 and heading to the parks or west coast etc. The suite itself had two bedrooms,two bathrooms,living room and kitchen. We had a ground floor suite which suited us the only thing was that the ground floor rooms seem to get whatever insects are around coming through the open doorway of a night.The kitchen was well equipped and had everything necessary to cook typical family meals including full size oven with six rings etc. The food at breakfast time is just ok and a bit repetitive after seven days stay but there was enough choice that nobody went hungry, you can also have your breakfast outside which is very pleasant. The kids loved the pooland it was great to come home for a swim after long days it stayed open until 11.00pm.There is also free Internet access, but some guests disregard the twenty minute per day usage politely requested but not enforced. We would recommend to families and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved Staybridge suites.”
Reviews.Author: mickosull
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a 3 week stay at the staybridge suites lake beuna vista, We had a 1 bedroom suite which had all that we needed and more. King size bed,2 large television with 80 channels. e.g. cartoon network and nick tv for the kids. safe in the room and kitchen with microwave,dishwasher,cooker e.t.c. The staff were very pleasant and the rooms were cleaned everyday. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone with or without kids. The location was perfect, 5 mins to disney, 10-15 min to universal,seaworld and wet and wild.

Reviews.Title: “O.K place - good service!”
Reviews.Author: misterjbh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites for one night arriving on the 5th of July, after spending the 4th of July weekend in NYC. We were greeted by a very friendly lady at the front desk, and were in our room within minutes. The pool area looked great, but after trying it out the same afternoon we determined that the pool had about 3 times too much clorine than necessary (the kids didn't complain though, but I tried it myself, and the water burned my eyes...). The room was very spacious and had a well equipped kitchen area. There were however several signs of "wear and tear", but not more that you could expect from a mid-range LBV hotel. The air conditoning stayed on a constant 66 F, which we consider far too cold (prefer 72 F). We tried to turn the heat up a bit, but it didn't help. We should have called maintenance, but opted it out since we were leaving the following morning anyways. The bathroom however, especially the needs refurnishing though - low water pressure, cheap wall covering and a faulty shower head. It's an O.K. place, but we experienced far better value later the same month at the Crowne Plaza on Universal Bvld. (see separate review).

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Dirty Don't get fooled by pictures”
Reviews.Author: tjstayed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Lake Beuna Vista arriving on July 13th 2005. The place looks like it has not been cleaned or updated in years they claim renovation in 2005 but no way is that so (This claim has more to do with the staybridge on international drive which by the way some eager trip advisor commentators have mixed up with when writing there positive posts about the staybridge Lake Beuna Vista.) full house keeping is by request otherwise minimal clean up is done. The two bedrooms are a drop better then the one bedroom suites in terms of cleanliness but their only real feature is the fact that you get two bedrooms. The mattress had no support whatsoever (a problem which is hotel wide as we were offered to switch rooms) and the pull out sofa bed had springs sticking out. The bathroom and refrigerator were dirty (old disgusting stains) and the air conditionaing vents were full of dirt. Additionally while not a big deal but for the money you expect much better all the kitchen cabinets were chipped . There are NO ELEVATORS and the hotel is THREE FLIGHTS! The fact that there are no elevators is really not a well known fact. Afterarriving from the airport with your things or coming back to the hotel with a bunch of kids after a long day in the theme parks you are not interested in having to climb a bunch of steps. Currently there is also a discrepancy in the hotel ratings some websites list the hotel as 3 star while some list it a 2 - 2 1/2 star which it truly is dont get fooled! The only positive about this hotel that I can think of is that it is near disney parks and shopping areas. As there is no shortage of hotels suited for a family trip in the orlando area you are much better off spending your money elsewhere for the price the Staybridge charges. P.S. if you are thinking of staying at the staybridge international drive beware that while it is more updated then Lake Beuna vista it is more of a motel then hotel and the bedrooms have a queen bed as opposed to a king.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Clean Up”
Reviews.Author: ciog52
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five-day stay in Staybridge Suites where I stayed with my wife, adult son and my two other boys aged 16 & 11.The first thing is location, which is excellent for visiting Disney. The suite itself had three rooms and two bathrooms. The kitchen was very poorly equipped with old-fashioned equipment but what concerned me most was the condition of one of the bathrooms. Complaints about it produced no results. The shower was dirty with discoloration between the tiles and generally neglected. The other bathroom was very clean. The walls are thin and you will hear the people above moving around. We were on the ground floor. The food at breakfast time is just ok but you can have your breakfast outside which is very pleasant. The two younger boys loved the pool, gym and games room. There is also free Internet access. Staff are helpful but the place needs a revamp and there is no excuse for allowing a bathroom to become that neglected.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites Lake Buena Vista
HotelInfo.Address: 8751 Suiteside Drive, Orlando, FL 32836
